europeana:record.dc:title: A historical panorama of Saint-Petersburg and its surroundings, part 8a
Историческая панорама Санкт-Петербурга и его окрестностей, ч. 8а: Вокруг Петербурга : (Елагин дворец, Строганова дача, беседка на Пулковой горе, Пелла, Ропша, церкви в окрестностях Царского Села)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 700 The Arts;720 Architecture;750 Painting & paintings (museums);740 Drawing & decorative arts
europeana:record.dc:description: A collection of over 36 images of the residences of Russian emperors provides a peak in to a royal world. Images of Yelagin’s Palace (the residence of prime ministers since the beginning of the 20th century and now a museum) prove especially valuable as it was partly destroyed in WWII. Pictures of the intact palace exterior, built in 1818-1822 by Carlo di Giovanni Rossi for Alexander I, are included, as well as the interiors created by Giovanni Batista Skotti (1776-1830). Stroganov’s country house is another featured royal residence, built by Andrey Voronikhin in the classical style. These are made all the more poignant as the house was demolished in 1908.

Елагин дворец - резиденция российских императоров, с начала ХХ в. – резиденция премьер-министров, в настоящее время – музей. Выстроен в 1818— 1822 гг. архитектором Карлом Росси (1775 – 1849, Carlo di Giovanni Rossi) по заказу императора Александра I в стиле классицизма. Внутреннее убранство выполнено художником Джованни Батиста (Иваном Карловичем) Скотти (1776 – 1830). Строганова дача – дворец графов Строгановых, выстроенный в 1795 – 1796 гг. в классическом стиле по проекту архитектора Андрея Воронихина (1759 – 1814). Издание содержит 36 фото-тинто-гравюр на отдельных листах. Особую ценность имеют изображения интерьеров пострадавшего во время Второй мировой войны Елагина дворца и снесенной в 1908 г. Строгановой дачи.

europeana:record.dc:title: King Matthias
Hunyadi Mátyás király
europeana:record.dc:creator: Fraknói Vilmos
europeana:record.dc:subject: Történelem;940 General history of Europe
europeana:record.dc:description: In the “Hungarian Historical Biographies” series, biographies of prominent personalities in Hungarian history were introduced by outstanding historians and politicians of the age. The series of monographs was published by the Hungarian History Association, launched in 1885 by the editor Sándor Szilágyi. Vilmos Fraknói (Frankl) (1843-1924) was a conservative clerical historiographer dealing with medieval, ecclesiastical and diplomatic history. He was the editor of a number of series of publications, among them the “Treatises about Historical Sciences” (between 1872 and 1878) and the first ten volumes of the “Hungarian Parliamentary Memories” (Monumenta comitialia regni Hungariae). Besides this monograph, a number of his other works also deal with Matthias Hunyadi (1443-1490). For example, he wrote the volume “The Age of the Hunyadis and the Yagellos. 1440-1526” in the ten-volume summary called “The History of the Hungarian Nation”, and also published “King Matthias’s Letters” (I-II.). Matthias Hunyadi (also referred to as Matthias I or Matthias Corvin) was one of the greatest Hungarian kings, reigning in 1458-1490. The Renaissance monarch’s court was an outstanding centre of humanism where famous foreign humanists (e.g. Antonio Bonfini, Galeotto Marzio and others) were active. King Matthias’s library, the Bibliotheca Corviniana with some 2000 to 2500 Corvinas was the best known collection of Hungarian Renaissance culture.

A Magyar Történeti Életrajzok sorozatban, a magyar történelemben jeles szerepet játszó személyiségek életrajzait a kor kiváló történészei, politikusai mutatták be. A monográfia-sorozat a Magyar Történelmi Társulat kiadványa volt, amit 1885-ben Szilágyi Sándor szerkesztésével indítottak el. Fraknói (Frankl) Vilmos (1843-1924) konzervatív-klerikális történetíró volt, a középkori történelemmel, egyház- és diplomáciatörténettel foglalkozott. Számos kiadványsorozatot szerkesztett, többek között az Értekezések a történeti tudományok köréből sorozatot (1872-1878 között), és a Magyar Országgyűlési Emlékek (Monumenta comitialia regni Hungariae) első 10 kötetét. Hunyadi Mátyással (1443-1490) e monográfián kívül több más műben is foglalkozott, ő írta, pl. „A Hunyadiak és a Jagellók kora. 1440-1526” című kötetet A magyar nemzet története című 10 kötetes összefoglalásban, és kiadta Mátyás király leveleit (I-II.) is. Hunyadi Mátyás (I. Mátyás, Corvin Mátyás) az egyik legnagyobb magyar király volt, aki 1458-1490 között uralkodott. A reneszánsz uralkodó udvara a humanizmus jelentős központja volt, ahol híres külföldi humanisták (pl. Antonio Bonfini, Galeotto Marzio stb.) működtek. Mátyás király könyvtára, a kb. 2000-2500 corvinát tartalmazó Bibliotheca Corviniana a magyar reneszánsz kultúra leghíresebb gyűjteménye volt.

europeana:record.dc:title: Judith

Libar Marca Marula Splichianina uchomse vsdarsi Istoria sfete vdouice Judit u versih haruacchi slosena : chacho ona vbi voivodu Olopherna posridu voische gnegoue: i oslodobi [!] puch israelschi od veliche pogibili
europeana:record.dc:creator: Marulić, Marko
europeana:record.dc:subject: 220 Bible;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Judith' is Croation poet Marulić's most famous work. Written in 1501, the epic poem describes the trails of the widow Judith, who delivers her hometown of Bethulia from the Assyrian enemy. Marulić wrote the poem as an extended metaphor of his own homeland. The poet revealed his intentions about the poem in a letter stating how the Croatian language got its own Dante with Judith, and comparing his epic poem to trees in full blossom in spring (bearing fruit in autumn). The first edition came out in 1521, and the next ones shortly afterwards, in 1522 and 1523. The book is decorated with woodcuts rumoured to have been made by the poet himself . It's enduring appeal is highlighted by the reprint of the 1521 first edition in 1950.

Svoje najpoznatije djelo na hrvatskome jeziku, Juditu, Marulić je napisao 1501. Biblijski lik udovice Judite, koja spašava rodni grad Betuliju od asirskoga neprijatelja, metafora je pjesnikove domovine Hrvatske, također udovice jer nema svoga kralja, a očekuje se od nje da spasi kršćanski svijet od Turaka. Bio je svjestan značenja svojega autorskoga čina ističući u jednome pismu da je hrvatski jezik Juditom dobio svojega Dantea i uspoređujući svoj spjev sa stablima punim cvijeća u proljeće (koja će ujesen donijeti plod). Prvo izdanje pojavilo se 1521., a nova već idućih dviju godina: 1522. i 1523. Knjiga je ukrašena drvorezima za koje neki drže da ih je izradio sam Marko Marulić. Pretisak prvoga izdanja izišao je 1950., a drugo. izd. uz talijanski prijevod djela.
europeana:record.dc:publisher: V Zadri, prodaiu se v Zadri Dierolima Mirchovichia ; stampane v Bneccih, pomgnom i nastoianiem Petreta Srichichia Splichianina
europeana:record.dc:source: Nacionalna i sveučilišna knjižnica u Zagrebu
europeana:record.dc:rights: Nacionalna i sveučilišna knjižnica u Zagrebu

europeana:record.dc:title: The Poem of Serbia salvation
Песна о избављенију Сербије
europeana:record.dc:creator: Обрадовић, Доситеј
europeana:record.dc:subject: 800 - Literature
europeana:record.dc:description: The poem talks about the transition of Belgrade city from Ottoman to Austrian hands that Dositej interpreted as a redemption of Serbia. In the spirit of enlightened cosmopolitanism he celebrates the "golden century", touching the Serbian people too.
Песма о преласку Београда из турских руку у аустријске које Доситеј тумачи као избављење Србије. У духу просветитељског космополитизма слави "златни век" који дотиче и српски народ.

europeana:record.dc:title: Mare Librum
Mare libervm sive De ivre qvod Batavis competit ad Indicana commercia dissertatio | Mare Librum
europeana:record.dc:creator: Hugo de Groot
europeana:record.dc:subject: 340 Law
europeana:record.dc:description: Hugo de Groot, renowned for his escape in a book chest from Loevenstein castle in 1621, published 'Mare Liberum' (The Free Seas) in September 1609. This thin booklet had a profound impact on international maritime law of the time. In September 2009 the UN Convention of Contracts for the International Carrying of Goods Wholly or Partly by Sea was signed in Rotterdam. These so-called ‘Rotterdam Rules’ derive directly from De Groot’s 'Mare Liberum'. The history of the 'Mare Liberum' began in 1603, when admiral Jacob van Heemskerck seized a Portugese cargo ship in Indian waters. This action resulted in the enormous haul of over three million Dutch guilders for the VOC. In the course of 1604, Hugo de Groot, a lawyer from the Hague, received orders to formulate a justification of this seizure. In 1609, just before the conclusion of the Twelve-Years’ Truce, he published the 'Mare libervm sive de ivre qvod Batavis competit ad Indicana commercia dissertatio', (The Right Which Belongs to the Dutch to Take Part in the East Indian Trade).

KB: 893 G 6 Hugo de Groot (Grotius), bekend om zijn ontsnapping in een boekenkist uit slot Loevestein in 1621, publiceerde in september 1609 Mare Liberum (‘De vrije zee’). Dit dunne boekje had grote gevolgen voor het internationale maritieme recht. In september 2009 is in Rotterdam de VN Convention of Contracts for the International Carrying of Goods Wholly or Partly by Sea ondertekend. Deze zogenaamde ´Rotterdam Rules´ stammen direct af van De Groots Mare Liberum. De geschiedenis van de Mare Liberum begon in 1603, toen admiraal Jacob van Heemskerck in de Indische wateren het Portugese vrachtschip de ‘Santa Catharina’ kaapte. Deze actie leverde De VOC de enorme buit van ruim drie miljoen gulden op. In de loop van 1604 kreeg Haagse advocaat Hugo de Groot, vermoedelijk van de Amsterdamse kamer van de VOC, de opdracht een rechtvaardiging van deze kaping te formuleren. In 1609 publiceerde hij, vlak het sluiten van het Twaalsjarig bestand, de Mare libervm sive de ivre qvod Batavis competit ad Indicana commercia dissertatio, (‘Vrije zeevaart of uiteenzetting over het recht van de Nederlanders om in Indië handel te drijven’).
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Lugduni Batauorvm, ex off. L. Elzevirij
europeana:record.dc:source: Koninklijke Bibliotheek - National library of the Netherlands
Koninklijke Bibliotheek - Nationale bibliotheek van Nederland

europeana:record.dc:title: A delicious new cookbook with all sorts of dishes of vegetables, fruit meat, poultry, game, fish and baked food: not only for healthy people, but also for those who are unwell

Ein köstlich new Kochbuch von allerhand Speisen an Gemüsen, Obs, Fleisch, Geflügel, Wildpret, Fischen und Gebachens : nicht allein für Gesunde, sondern auch und fürnemlich für Krancke in allerley Kanckheiten und Gebresten, auch schwangere Weiber, Kindbetterinnen und alte schwache Leuthe, künstlich und nutzlich zuzurichten und zugebrauchen : erstlich in vier underschiedlichen Büchern mit Fleiss beschrieben
europeana:record.dc:creator: Wecker, Anna
europeana:record.dc:subject: Meals & table service;Meals & table service
europeana:record.dc:description: This title (of which this is the second edition) is probably one of the oldest cookery books in German written by a woman
Cet ouvrage, ici dans sa deuxième édition, constitue vraisemblablement l'un des plus anciens livres de cuisine en langue allemande écrit par une femme
Dieses Werk, hier in 2. Auflage, ist wahrscheinlich eines der ältesten, von einer Frau geschriebenen deutschsprachigen Kochbücher

europeana:record.dc:title: A short grammar of the Illyrian language
Institutionum linguae Illyricae libri duo. Authore Bartholomaeo Cassio ...
europeana:record.dc:creator: Kašić, Bartol
europeana:record.dc:subject: 410 Linguistics
europeana:record.dc:description: Bartul Kašić's (1575–1650) work marks the beginning of the Croation grammarian tradition. A Jesuit, he recorded his Croatian grammar as a young teacher at a Jesuit College in Rome. He was encouraged to educate people in the "Illyrian" language by none other than Pope Clement VIII himself. Kašić started his grammatical endeavour as a means of aiding missionary work, by helping fellow monks to learn the Croatian language. As he copied the Latin model of grammar, the influence of Alvarez, Manuci and Donato grammars is evident in his work. Instead of the term grammar, Kašić modestly uses the term rule (institutio) in the title of his work, which went on to become a source of great academic pride.

Isusovac Bartul Kašić (1575.–1650.) svoju je gramatiku hrvatskoga jezika napisao kao mladi učitelj gramatike u Rimskom isusovačkom kolegiju. Time je ispunio naredbu generala Družbe Isusove Klaudija Aquavive i preporuku pape Klementa VIII. da se studira ”ilirski” jezik. Pišući svoje djelo, Kašić je imao na pameti prije svega misionarske potrebe, tj. htio je pomoći redovničkoj subraći da lakše nauče hrvatski. Oslonio se na latinski gramatički model pa se u njegovu djelu vidi utjecaj Alvarezove, Manucijeve i Donatove gramatike. Tako je nastala prva gramatika hrvatskoga jezika koja opisuje gramatički ustroj književnih stilizacija u čakavštini i štokavštini ikavskoga tipa. Kašić u naslovu ne upotrebljava naziv gramatika, nego pravilo (institutio) i time pokazuje skromnost, ali napisao je gramatiku koja je ne samo početak hrvatske gramatičarske tradicije nego toj tradiciji služi na čast.
europeana:record.dc:source: Nacionalna i sveučilišna knjižnica u Zagrebu
europeana:record.dc:rights: Nacionalna i sveučilišna knjižnica u Zagrebu

europeana:record.dc:title: On the refraction of light and the theory of the rainbow

De radiis visus et lucis in vitris perspectivis et iride : Tractatus Marci Antonii de Dominis, per Ioannem Bartolum in lucem editus, in quo inter alia ostenditur ratio instrumenti cuiusdam ad clare videndum, quae sunt valde remota excogitati
europeana:record.dc:creator: Dominis, Markantun de
europeana:record.dc:subject: 530 Physics
europeana:record.dc:description: Markantun de Dominis (1560–1624), theologian and scientist, and renegade Archbishop of Senj and Split, came into conflict with the Croatian nobility and the pope over his support of the Venetian Republic in the dispute with Rome. Having denounced the title of Archbishop, he left for London and embarked on the publication of the work 'De republica ecclesiastica libri X' and other minor works, criticizing the papacy. But his hopes for closer ties between the Anglican and Catholic churches failed to materialise, and he was forced to flee England. When his ally, Pope Gregory XV, was elected, he returned to Rome, wrote a revocation of his ideas and accepted the Catholic faith. Pope Urban VIII later ordered an investigation in to his activities and de Dominis was sent to prison where he died. Although his remains and writings were publicly burned at Campo di Fiori, his works have recently been revived by clerical historians.

Markantun de Dominis (1560.–1624.), teolog i znanstvenik, senjski i splitski nadbiskup, došao je u sukob s kaptolom i domaćim plemstvom, ali i s papom jer je podupirao Mletačku Republiku u sukobu s Rimom. Odrekavši se nadbiskupije, otišao je u London i započeo objavljivati djelo De republica ecclesiastica libri X i neka manja djela u kojima kritizira papinstvo. Njegova se nada da će doći do zbližavanja Anglikanske i Katoličke crkve nije ispunila, a on je postao nepoželjnim u Engleskoj. Kada je izabran za papu Grgur XV., koji mu je bio sklon, de Dominis se vratio u Rim, napisao opoziv svojih ideja i prihvatio katoličko vjerovanje. Papa Urban VIII. ipak je naredio istragu i de Dominis je dospio u tamnicu te u njoj umro. Njegovo tijelo i spisi bili su javno spaljeni na Campo di Fiori. U novije doba njegovo je djelo doživjelo pozitivnu ocjenu crkvenih povjesničara.
europeana:record.dc:source: Nacionalna i sveučilišna knjižnica u Zagrebu
europeana:record.dc:rights: Nacionalna i sveučilišna knjižnica u Zagrebu

europeana:record.dc:title: Croatia revived
Croatia rediviva, regnante Leopoldo Magno caesare / deducta ab eq. Paulo Ritter
europeana:record.dc:creator: Ritter-Vitezović, Pavao
europeana:record.dc:subject: 940 General history of Europe
europeana:record.dc:description: This interesting blend of historical fact and fiction from polyhistorian and writer, Pavao Ritter Vitezović (1652–1713) puts the case for the expansion of Croation lands. As a member of the 'Committe for demarcation with the Ottoman Empire and the Venetian Republic' and as an expert aide to the Austrian imperial official Marsiglio, he firmly believed that all the lands where Croats, Slovenes or Serbs live belong to Croatia. He voices his anger at Austria's territorial concessions to the Venetians and the Ottomans, believing the area between Istra and Raška Croatian to be Croation. He divides the former territory of the Illyrian provinces into five lands: Hrvatska Primorska; Hrvatska Zagorska (including Bosnia); Hrvatska Savska or inter-river Croatia; Hrvatska ovostrana (Istra and Kranjska) and Hrvatska onostrana (Serbia). He also suggests that the Emperor should bear the title of the King of Entire Croatia (”totiusque Croatiae”) instead of listing Croatia, Dalmatia, Slavonia, Rama, and Serbia. This piece of nationalistic work influenced Ljudevit Gaj's ideas about Illyrian provinces.

Polihistor i književnik Pavao Ritter Vitezović (1652.–1713.), bio je članom povjerenstva za razgraničenje s Turskom i Mletačkom Republikom kao stručni suradnik austrijskomu carskomu povjereniku Marsigliju. U spomenici što ju je njemu uputio kaže da Hrvatskoj pripadaju sve zemlje u kojima žive Hrvati, Slovenci i Srbi. Ljuti se što Austrija čini teritorijalne ustupke Mlečanima i Turcima jer za njega Hrvatska obuhvaća prostor od Istre do Raške. Nekadašnji Ilirik podijelio je na pet zemalja: Hrvatsku Primorsku, Hrvatsku Zagorsku (u njoj je Bosna), Hrvatsku Savsku ili međurječnu, Hrvatsku ovostranu (Istra i Kranjska) i Hrvatsku onostranu (Srbija). Svoja je stajališta ponovio i u djelu Croatia rediviva (Oživjela Hrvatska), zanimljivome spoju povijesnih činjenica i povijesnih maštarija. Predlaže da car nosi naslov kralja čitave Hrvatske (”totiusque Croatiae”) namjesto da se nabrajaju Hrvatska, Dalmacija, Slavonija, Rama i Srbija. Djelo je utjecalo na Gajeve ideje o ilirskim zemljama.
europeana:record.dc:source: Nacionalna i sveučilišna knjižnica u Zagrebu

europeana:record.dc:title: Gruuthuse-manuscript
Gruuthuse-handschrift
europeana:record.dc:creator: Jan van Hulst
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books;240 Christian moral & devotional theology;830 Literatures of Germanic languages
europeana:record.dc:description: The Gruuthuse Manuscript' was printed in West Flanders (Bruges), around 1395 to 1408. It consists of three volumes, with a nineteenth century calfskin binding. It is thought to have been produced by five copyists in modern pencil foliation. Unfortunately, seven pages of text are missing. It was acquired in 2007 by the Koninklijke Bibliotheek, the Hague, with sponsorship from the Mondriaan Foundation, the VSB foundation, the BankGiro Lottery, the VandenEnde Foundation and the Association ‘Friends of the Koninklijke Bibliotheek’.

KB: 79 K 10. Het Gruuthuse-handschrift, West-Vlaanderen (Brugge), ca. 1395 – ca. 1408 Perkament; 4+85+10 bll. Blad oorspronkelijk ca. 295 x ca. 195 mm, thans nog maar 251 x 190 mm (fol. 2 echter 285 x 188 mm); bladspiegel ca. 225 à 230 x ca. 150 mm; 2 kolommen, 50 of 51 regels per kolom. Driedelig convoluut; moderne potloodfolië¬ring; vijf kopiisten. Er ontbreken 7 bladen met tekst. Negentiende-eeuwse kalfsleren band. Vier gouden initialen op een blauw-paarse grond; een rode initiaal; afwisselend rode en blauwe lombarden; beginletters van de verzen in een aparte kolom en rood doorstreept. Op fol 2r. onderaan, het wapen van Lodewijk van Gruuthuse. Het Gruuthuse-handschrift werd in 2007 verworven door de Koninklijke Bibliotheek, Den Haag met de steun van de Mondriaan Stichting, het VSBfonds, de BankGiro Loterij, de VandenEnde Foundation en de Vereniging ‘Vrienden van de Koninklijke Bibliotheek’.
europeana:record.dc:source: Koninklijke Bibliotheek - National library of the Netherlands
Koninklijke Bibliotheek - Nationale bibliotheek van Nederland

europeana:record.dc:title: Girl .... look out for a baby!
Meisje .... look out for a baby!
europeana:record.dc:subject: 610 Medical sciences and medicine
europeana:record.dc:description: These caricatures of Winston Churchill highlight how the allies were perceived by their enemy during WWII. The caricatures were drawn on the reverse of two envelopes, by a Dutch citizen who sided with the German occupying forces. In a leaflet also found in the collaborator's posession, Dutch girls were warned about being left stuck with a baby by the allied soldiers. This warning had a ring of truth. Countless children were born in Holland 9 months after the liberation, with the majority unaware of who their father was.

KB: 2299 F 74
De geallieerde machten staan niet altijd in een positief daglicht. Op de achterzijde van deze twee enveloppen zijn karikaturen getekend van de Britse premier Winston Churchill. Ze vormen de bewijslast in een dossier van een Nederlander die de kant van de Duitse bezetter koos. In een kleine brochure worden Nederlandse meisjes gewaarschuwd voor de geallieerde soldaten: voor je het weet, zit je met een baby opgescheept. Negen maanden na de bevrijding worden er inderdaad talloze bevrijdingskinderen geboren waarvan de meesten niet weten wie hun vader is.
europeana:record.dc:source: Koninklijke Bibliotheek - National library of The Netherlands

europeana:record.dc:title: A short introduction to the Croatian-Slavic orthography

Kratka osnova horvatsko-slavenskoga pravopisana, poleg mudrolubneh, narodneh i prigospodarneh temelov i zrokov = Kurzer Entwurf einer kroatisch-slavischen Orthographie nach philosophischen, nazionaelen und oekonomischen Grundsaetzen / od L. o. G.
europeana:record.dc:creator: Gaj, Ljudevit
europeana:record.dc:subject: 490 Other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Kratka Osnova Horvatsko–Slavenskoga Pravopisańa' (A short introduction to the Croatian - Slavic spelling) is considered pivotal to the thinking behind the Croatian National Revival Movement. Written by the movements leader, Ljudevit Gaj (1809–1872), it was published in Buda in 1830, in Kaikavian Croatian and the German language respectively. Initially unnoticed, the work went on to play a seminal role in the stabilization of spelling and the standardisation of the Croatian language.

Vođa hrvatskoga narodnoga preporoda Ljudevit Gaj (1809.–1872.) objavio je u Budimu 1830. na hrvatskokajkavskom i njemačkom jeziku Kratku osnovu horvatsko–slavenskoga pravopisańa. Ta mala knjižica (27 stranica) uzima se kao početak hrvatskih preporodnih gibanja i premda u početku nezapažena, poslije je imala dalekosežne posljedice za stabilizaciju hrvatskoga slovopisa i za standardizaciju hrvatskoga jezika.
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Vu Budimu, iz tiskarnice Kralevskoga Vseučilišča
europeana:record.dc:source: Nacionalna i sveučilišna knjižnica u Zagrebu

europeana:record.dc:title: Trivulzio-manuscript
Getijdenboek | Trivulzio-handschrift
europeana:record.dc:creator: Lievin van Lathem
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books;240 Christian moral & devotional theology
europeana:record.dc:description: This 15th-century illuminated book of hours once formed part of the famous collection of the princes of Trivulzio in Milan. Long believed to be lost, it was presented to the Koninklijke Bibliotheek in 2002. With an estimated value of nearly six million euros, this proves the most valuable private gift ever offered to a cultural institution in the Netherlands. The content of the Trivulzio book of hours consists of: a calendar; the Hours of the Seven Days of the Week, each followed by a Mass; sixteen prayers to saints; three special supplications to Mary: the Stabat Mater, the Obsecro te and the O Intemerata; four short passages from the Gospels; the Hours of the Virgin; the Seven Penitential Psalms and the Office of the Dead. The texts of the Hours of the Virgin and the Office of the Dead follow the general custom of Rome. Therefore, only careful study of the books illuminations can shed any light on its place of origin.

KB: SMC 1
In 2002 kreeg de KB een zeer kostbaar en lang verloren gewaand vijftiende-eeuws verlucht getijdenboek. Het heeft ooit deel uitgemaakt van de beroemde verzameling van de prinsen van Trivulzio te Milaan. De waarde van het handschrift wordt geschat op bijna zes miljoen euro. Voor zover bekend gaat het hier om het duurste particuliere geschenk ooit aan een culturele instelling in Nederland.
De inhoud van het Trivulzio-getijdenboek bestaat uit een kalender; de Getijden van de zeven weekdagen, elk gevolgd door een mis; zestien gebeden tot heiligen; drie speciale gebeden tot Maria: het Stabat Mater, het Obsecro te en het O Intemerata; vier korte passages uit de evangeliën; de Mariagetijden; de Zeven Boetpsalmen en de Dodenvigilie. De heiligenfeesten in de kalender zijn alle algemeen van aard en bevatten geen aanwijzingen voor een nadere lokalisering. Ook de teksten van de Mariagetijden en de Dodenvigilie volgen het algemene gebruik van Rome. Aanwijzingen over de plaats van ontstaan kunnen derhalve alleen ontleend worden aan de verluchting van het getijdenboek.
europeana:record.dc:source: Koninklijke Bibliotheek - national library of The Netherlands
Koninklijke Bibliotheek - nationale bibliotheek van Nederland

europeana:record.dc:title: Beatrijs-manuscript
Die Dietsche Doctrinale | Beatrijs-handschrift | Heimelicheit der heimelicheden
europeana:record.dc:creator: Jacob van Maerlant
europeana:record.dc:subject: 830 Literatures of Germanic languages
europeana:record.dc:description: The Beatrice' is considered to be one of the finest pieces in the Koninklijke Bibliotheek’s collection. This ‘gem of our intellectual literature' is considered by many Dutch people to be the finest example of medieval writing. The legend of Beatrice is laid out in a richly embellished manuscript. The tale probably came into existence at the beginning of the 13th century and was handed down in numerous Western European languages. The mastery of this version in Middle Dutch lies in the harmonic structure, exquisite phraseology, vivacious dialogue, and impressive portrayal of nature that lies within the text. This version probably dates from the end of the 13th century. The manuscript held at the Koninklijke Bibliotheek is a later transcript from approximately 1374.

KB: 76 E 5 De Beatrijs is onbetwist één van de topstukken van de Koninklijke Bibliotheek. Dit 'juweel in onze geestelijke literatuur' is voor heel veel Nederlanders hét voorbeeld van een Middeleeuwse tekst. De legende van Beatrijs is alleen maar overgeleverd in één rijkversierd handschrift uit de Koninklijke Bibliotheek. De Beatrijslegende is waarschijnlijk aan het begin van de dertiende eeuw ontstaan en in talloze Westeuropese talen overgeleverd. Juist echter een vergelijking met de andere lezingen van het verhaal toont het meesterschap van deze Middelnederlandse versie en de genialiteit van haar schepper. De literaire waarde is gelegen in de harmonische opbouw, de uitgelezen woordkeus, de levendige dialoog en de indringende natuurbeschrijvingen. Bovendien onderscheidt het zich door de menselijkheid van de schildering en het grote psychologische inzicht van de dichter. De Middelnederlandse versie is waarschijnlijk aan het eind van de dertiende eeuw ontstaan. Het handschrift in de Koninklijke Bibliotheek, dat als enige deze tekst overlevert, is een later afschrift uit circa 1374.
europeana:record.dc:source: Koninklijke Bibliotheek - national library of The Netherlands
Koninklijke Bibliotheek - Nationale bibliotheek van Nederland

europeana:record.dc:title: The history of Alexander the Great
Hier beghint die hystorie vanden grooten Coninck Alexander | Historia Alexandri Magni | Alexander-incunabel
europeana:record.dc:subject: 430 Germanic languages German
europeana:record.dc:description: This version of 'The History of Alexander the Great' is notable as the first Dutch book of a non-religious nature with text in prose. The first edition was printed in 1477 in Gouda by the enterprising printer-business man Gheraert Leeu. It's literary importance is also made obvious by the fact it was written in Dutch, when the majority of books from that era were written in Latin. This copy is the fourth edition, published by Leeu’s acquaintance, a printer from Delft, Christiaen Snellaert. The Koninklijke Bibliotheek acquired the work on 14 March 2009, with sponsorship from the Mondriaan Foundation and the Friends Association of the Koninklijke Bibliotheek.

KB: 172 C 22 De KB verwierf Die hystorie vanden grooten Coninck Alexander op 14 maart 2009, met steun van de Mondriaan Stichting en de Vereniging Vrienden van de KB. Het boek gaat over Alexander de Grote, de legendarische veldheer die ook in de middeleeuwen al zeer populair was. Het is voor het eerst gedrukt in 1477 in Gouda door de ondernemende drukker-zakenman Gheraert Leeu. Deze uitgave is zeer bijzonder omdat het het eerste Nederlandse boek is dat niet religieus van aard was en bovendien een tekst in proza bevat. Bijzonder is ook dat het in het Nederlands is, terwijl de meeste boeken uit die periode juist in het Latijn waren. Dit exemplaar is de vierde druk, verschenen bij een bekende van Leeu, de Delftse drukker Christiaen Snellaert.
europeana:record.dc:source: Koninklijke Bibliotheek - National library of The Netherlands
Koninklijke Bibliotheek - Nationale bibliotheek van Nederalnd

europeana:record.dc:title: Book of Hours Wolfgang Hopyl
Getijden boek Wolfgang Hopyl | Horae | Ghetyden van onser liever vrouwen
europeana:record.dc:subject: 240 Christian moral & devotional theology;090 Manuscripts & rare books
europeana:record.dc:description: Only two other copies of this 1500 Dutch-language 'Book of Hours' are known to exist. It was supposedly printed in Paris by Dutchman, Wolfgang Hopyl. At that time Paris was the centre of the publishing industry, with printers from all over Europe practising their trade there. Hopyl worked in Paris from 1489 to 1523 and produced approximately 50 books up until 1500. The 'Book of Hours' is a compact work, bound in velvet. It was printed on parchment and contains magnificent miniatures and ornamental edges. The Koninklijke Bibliotheek aquired the work in October 2008 and it was presented to Wim van Drimmelen to celebrate his directorship of the library.

KB: 172 C 21 Horae. Getijden boek. Parijs: Wolfgang Hopyl, 10 sept. 1500. Verworven 16 oktober 2008. Op 16 oktober 2008 kocht de Koninklijke Bibliotheek een prachtig geïllumineerd Nederlandstalig getijdenboek. Er zijn twee andere exemplaren bekend, die in Parijs en Brussel bewaard worden. Het werd gedrukt in Parijs door een vermoedelijk Nederlandse drukker, Wolfgang Hopyl. Parijs was in die tijd al een stad waar de boekdrukkunst floreerde. Drukkers uit heel Europa oefenden daar hun vak uit, zo ook Hopyl, die vermoedelijk uit de provincie Utrecht afkomstig was. Hij werkte in Parijs tussen 1489 en 1523 en produceerde tot en met 1500 al zo’n 50 boeken. Eén van die boeken is dit Nederlandstalige getijdenboek, voltooid op 10 september 1500. Het is een handzaam, compact boek, in een fluwelen band. Het is gedrukt op perkament en bevat schitterende miniaturen en randversieringen. Het boek werd op 15 november 2008 overhandigd aan Wim van Drimmelen als laatste bijzondere aanwinst tijdens zijn directoraat van de Koninklijke Bibliotheek.
europeana:record.dc:source: Koninklijke Bibliotheek - National library of the Netherlands
Koninklijke Bibliotheek - Nationale bibliotheek van Nederland

europeana:record.dc:title: Trutz-Nachtigal oder geistliches poetisch Lustwäldlein
europeana:record.dc:creator: Spee, Friedrich von
europeana:record.dc:subject: 830 Literatures of Germanic languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Germany is contributing digitised versions of well-known literary works by German authors from different centuries to "Reading Europe". The printed editions of these titles, taken from the stocks of the German National Library, were digitised. The brief of the library is to collect Germany's published cultural and scientific heritage since 1913, to preserve it for posterity and to make it accessible for use. The German National Library therefore documents the intellectual and literary output of the German-speaking countries. Subject librarians from the library made the selections for "Reading Europe", choosing exclusively volumes which are no longer subject to copyright.

Deutschlands Beitrag zu "Reading Europe" sind die Digitalisate von bekannten literarischen Werken deutscher Autoren aus allen Jahrhunderten. Digitalisiert wurden die Druckausgaben dieser Titel aus dem Bestand der Deutschen Nationalbibliothek, die das kulturelle und wissenschaftliche Erbe Deutschlands in seiner ab 1913 veröffentlichten Form sammelt, es für immer bewahrt und für die Nutzung zugänglich macht. Die Deutsche Nationalbibliothek dokumentiert damit das geistige und literarische Schaffen im deutschen Sprachraum. Die Auswahl für "Reading Europe" trafen Fachreferentinnen und Fachreferenten der Bibliothek, ausgewählt wurden ausschließlich Bände, die nicht mehr dem Urheberschutz unterliegen.

europeana:record.dc:title: Der Erbförster
europeana:record.dc:creator: Ludwig, Otto
europeana:record.dc:subject: 830 Literatures of Germanic languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Germany is contributing digitised versions of well-known literary works by German authors from different centuries to "Reading Europe". The printed editions of these titles, taken from the stocks of the German National Library, were digitised. The brief of the library is to collect Germany's published cultural and scientific heritage since 1913, to preserve it for posterity and to make it accessible for use. The German National Library therefore documents the intellectual and literary output of the German-speaking countries. europeana:record.dc:title: Letters from Turkey
Mikes Kelemen törökországi levelei
europeana:record.dc:creator: Mikes Kelemen (﻿1690-1761)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Magyar irodalom;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: After the failure of the Hungarian War of Independence between 1703 and 1711, Kelemen Mikes left Hungary together with Prince Ferenc Rákóczi II. Until his death, he lived in emigration. A prolific writer and translator, his most prominent work is the Letters from Turkey, which elevated him among the greatest of Hungarian prose writers. His literary correspondence written to the fictitious Baroness E. P. incorporates 207 letters written over a span of 40 years. The work reveals Mikes’ conscious composition, as the individual letters are organized into an organic whole and consitute a well-proportioned epistolary novel which gives an authentic sketch of the age and is also precious as a personal confession. Besides gaining insight into the life of Prince Rákóczi, the colony of exiles and Turkish diplomacy, modern readers may be delighted by its amusing style and by the ethereal and yet earthly relationship of Mikes and the fictitious Baroness.

Mikes Kelemen az 1703-tól 1711-ig tartó magyar szabadságharc bukása után II. Rákóczi Ferenc fejedelemmel elhagyta Magyarországot, és haláláig emigrációban élt. Sokat és sokfélét írt, főleg pedig fordított, a magyar irodalom klasszikusává, a mindenkori magyar próza egyik legnagyobbjává azonban a Törökországi levelek-kel vált. 40 éven át tartó 207 levelet eredményező fiktív irodalmi levelezése tudatos író műve, aki nem ötletszerűen, egymástól függetlenül írta az egyes darabokat. Nyilván utólag is szerkesztette, egymáshoz illesztve az egyes leveleket, így vált azzá az arányos, szervesen komponált korképpé és vallomássá, ahogy reánk maradt. A mai olvasót elsősorban stílusával bűvölheti el a levélregény. A Törökországi levelek ugyanis valóban regényszerű, két főszereplője a leveleket író rodostói száműzött, valamint a teljesen fiktív címzett, P. E. grófné, akinek érdekes, rokokó figurája egészen különleges bravúrral van felépítve a hozzá írott levek szövegében. Igen sok történelmi, kortörténeti érdekesség is van e levelekben, magáról az "öreg" fejedelemről, II. Rákóczi Ferencről, a száműzött kurucok kolóniájáról, a török diplomáciáról, ám ezeknél sokkal fontosabb és regényszerűbb a két főszereplő egyszerre éteri és földies kapcsolata.

europeana:record.dc:creator: Теодосије Хиландарац

Теодосије Хиландарац (друга половина 13. в. - прве деценије 14. в.), хиландарски монах. Два житија су најобимнија у старој српској књижевности.

europeana:record.dc:title: The Good People of Palocz
A jó palócok
europeana:record.dc:creator: Mikszáth Kálmán (﻿1847-1910)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Magyar irodalom;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: „These short stories take us back to Mikszáth’s childhood, with simple stories, villagers, with the beautiful, majestic countryside in the background” – writes László Kaiser in the foreword. The Slovak neighbours, published in 1880 is a tragic and artistic description of the life of the folk, which likens Mikszáth’s style to that of János Arany’s ballads. The Good People of Palocz, published in 1881, is a conscious composition of short stories. Real stories from various sources and from different places are organized into a cycle, like a montage of genre pictures, conveying the conviction of the writer that death is not equal with destruction and fate is independent of human will. The stories of the people of Palocz are the final piece of romantic populist literature. Its characters: the head shepherd Olej, Lapaj, the famous bagpiper, Annie Bede and the heathen master Filcsik are all unforgettable.

A művek világa Mikszáth gyermekkorát idézi föl egyszerű történetekkel, falusi alakokkal, háttérben a gyönyörű tájjal, a fenséges természettel" - írja az előszóban Kaiser László. Mikszáth korai elbeszélő művészetének két tündökletes darabja A tót atyafiakban (1880) a népélet tragikus és művészi szemlélése Arany János balladaköltészetéhez hasonlítja Mikszáth stílusát, akit a legnagyobb magyar írok sorában tartunk számon. A jó palócok (1881) kis történetek tudatos kompozíciójából áll össze. Számos forrásból eredő, több helyszínhez köthető valós történetek (zsánerképek) szerveződnek ciklussá a kötet lapjain, azt az írói meggyőződést sugallva, hogy a halál nem egyenlő a pusztulással, de azt is, hogy a sors független az emberi akarattól. A palóc történetek gyűjteménye a romantikus népiesség záró darabja. Hősei: Olej bacsa és Lapaj, a híres dudás, Bede Anna és a pogány Filcsik feledhetetlenek. Történeteiknek babonás modernségét Mikszáth a józan megfigyelés, a csaknem pozitivista kriticizmussal ellenpontozza.

europeana:record.dc:subject: 830 Literatures of Germanic languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Germany is contributing digitised versions of well-known literary works by German authors from different centuries to "Reading Europe". The printed editions of these titles, taken from the stocks of the German National Library, were digitised. The brief of the library is to collect Germany's published cultural and scientific heritage since 1913, to preserve it for posterity and to make it accessible for use. The German National Library therefore documents the intellectual and literary output of the German-speaking countries. Subject librarians from the library made the selections for "Reading Europe", choosing exclusively volumes which are no longer subject to copyright.

Deutschlands Beitrag zu "Reading Europe" sind die Digitalisate von bekannten literarischen Werken deutscher Autoren aus allen Jahrhunderten. Digitalisiert wurden die Druckausgaben dieser Titel aus dem Bestand der Deutschen Nationalbibliothek, die das kulturelle und wissenschaftliche Erbe Deutschlands in seiner ab 1913 veröffentlichten Form sammelt, es für immer bewahrt und für die Nutzung zugänglich macht. Die Deutsche Nationalbibliothek dokumentiert damit das geistige und literarische Schaffen im deutschen Sprachraum. Die Auswahl für "Reading Europe" trafen Fachreferentinnen und Fachreferenten der Bibliothek, ausgewählt wurden ausschließlich Bände, die nicht mehr dem Urheberschutz unterliegen.

Die Deutsche Nationalbibliothek dokumentiert damit das geistige und literarische Schaffen im deutschen Sprachraum. Die Auswahl für "Reading Europe" trafen Fachreferentinnen und Fachreferenten der Bibliothek, ausgewählt wurden ausschließlich Bände, die nicht mehr dem Urheberschutz unterliegen.

europeana:record.dc:title: Lebensansichten des Kater Murr, nebst fragmentarischer Biographie des Kapellmeisters Johannes Kreisler in zufälligen Makulaturblättern
europeana:record.dc:creator: Hoffmann, Ernst T. A.
europeana:record.dc:subject: 830 Literatures of Germanic languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Germany is contributing digitised versions of well-known literary works by German authors from different centuries to "Reading Europe". The printed editions of these titles, taken from the stocks of the German National Library, were digitised. The brief of the library is to collect Germany's published cultural and scientific heritage since 1913, to preserve it for posterity and to make it accessible for use. The German National Library therefore documents the intellectual and literary output of the German-speaking countries. Subject librarians from the library made the selections for "Reading Europe", choosing exclusively volumes which are no longer subject to copyright.

Книга глаголемаę ортЬшенiе грЬшнымЪ
europeana:record.dc:creator: Пејчиновиќ, Кирiлла
europeana:record.dc:subject: 270 Christian church history
europeana:record.dc:description: The edition is of particular importance because of the development of enlightenment in Macedonia. Religious-ethical aspects
Изданието е од особено значење поради развојот на просветителството во Македонија. Религиозно-етички аспекти
europeana:record.dc:publisher: вЪ тйпЪ солунскïй при хаџ папа Теодосïа архiмандрiта Сïнаíтскаго

europeana:record.dc:title: A Calendar for the Latgale region for A.D. 1864
Inflantuziemies ļajkagromota aba kalenders uz 1864 godu
europeana:record.dc:creator: Gustav Manteuffel
europeana:record.dc:subject: 050 General serials & their indexes
europeana:record.dc:description: Gustav Manteuffel (1832-1916) was a publicist, historian, ethnographer, folklorist and publisher. Influenced by the ideas of the Enlightment, he was committed to working for the people of his native region. Manteuffel’s most significant legacy is the calendar "Infļantu zemes zemes laika grõmota aba kalenders" (A Calendar for the Latgale region 1862–71). It is the first and the only 19th century publication in Latgalian written language, published on a regular basis and printed during the ban of printed Latgalian language. The publisher was awarded to pay a fine for that. It gained great favour among the people, and included lavish illustrations and extensive practical advice on farming, housekeeping and medicine. The calendar included enlightening anecdotes, riddles, proverbs, sayings poems and folk tales, which directly and indirectly urged the people to obtain education and knowledge.

Publicists, vēsturnieks, etnogrāfs, folklorists un izdevējs Gustavs Manteifelis (Manteuffel; 1832-1916) apgaismes ideju iespaidā par savas dzīves mērķi izvirzīja darbošanos dzimtās puses tautas labā. Manteifeļa nozīmīgākais devums ir viņa sastādītais un izdotais kalendārs „Infļantu zemes zemes laika grõmota aba kalenders” (1862-71). Tas ir pirmais un vienīgais regulāri iznākušais izdevums latgaliešu rakstu valodā 19. gs., kas iespiests drukas aizlieguma laikā. Izdevējs tāpēc maksāja sodu. Tautā populārajā, bagātīgi ilustrētajā izdevumā daudz praktisku padomu lauksaimniecībā, mājturībā un medicīnā. Kalendārā iekļautajiem stāstiņiem, mīklām, sakāmvārdiem, dzejoļiem un pasakām pamācošs raksturs, tiešāk un netiešāk mudinot skoloties un krāt zināšanas.

europeana:record.dc:title: The History of Various Slavic Peoples. 1
Историја разних славенских народов. 1
europeana:record.dc:creator: Рајић, Јован
europeana:record.dc:subject: 900 - History
europeana:record.dc:description: Jovan Rajic (Sremski Karlovci, 1726 - Kovilj monastery, 1801) - Serbian historian, professor, Archimandrite. The book is the first history of the South Slavs, until second half of 19th century, the main and almost the only source of knowledge about Serbian past.

Јован Рајић (Сремски Карловци, 1726 - манастир Ковиљ, 1801), историчар, професор, архимандрит. Књига је прва историја Јужних Словена, до друге половине 19. века главни и готово једини извор знања о српској прошлости.

europeana:record.dc:title: Riga and Its Buildings: Vol.2
Riga und seine Bauten : Bd. 2
europeana:record.dc:creator: Rigaschen Technischen Verein und Rigaschen Architekten-Verein
europeana:record.dc:subject: 720 Architecture;690 Buildings
europeana:record.dc:description: The collection "Riga und seine Bauten" (History of Riga and its Buildings) was published by the Riga Technical Association and the Fellowship of Architects of Riga. The introduction gives a short geographical characteristic of Riga and an overview of the history of the city until early 20th century. It is followed by a description of the most important buildings of the Riga utility and transportation system: port, docks, bridges, streets, tramway rail network, water supply equipment. The most important public, cultural and educational buildings are also extensively described, e.g. churches (the Dome, St. Peter’s Church, etc.), buildings of merchant and craftsmen’s organizations (the Great Guild and the Little Guild, The House of the Blackheads), court and administrative buildings, educational institutions, buildings of exchanges, banks, hospitals, shelters, theatres (such as the German Theatre, now the National Opera) and associations, sports structures, residential houses for rent, as well as parks and monuments. The articles were written by well known architects of the time, such as W. Neumann, A. Reinbergs, H. Hartmann, P. Mandelstam, H. Mehlbart, G. Kuphaldt and engineers B. Doss, A. Agthe, A. Tobien, A. Pabst and others. The collection is lavishly illustrated with pictures and plans of buildings. The publication not only gives information of the history of construction of each building, but also about the history of the resident organization until 20th century.

Krājuma "Riga und seine Bauten" (Rīgas ēku vēsture) izdevēji ir Rīgas Tehniskā biedrība un Rīgas Arhitektu biedrība. Ievadā dots īss Rīgas ģeogrāfiskais raksturojums un pārskats par pilsētas vēsturi līdz 20. gs. sākumam. Tālāk aprakstītas Rīgas komunālās un transporta sistēmas nozīmīgākās būves: osta, doki, tilti, ielas, tramvaja sliežu tikls, ūdensapgādes iekārtas. Plašāka uzmanība ir pievērsta svarīgākajām sabiedriskajām, kultūras un izglītības būvēm: baznīcām (Doma, Pētera u.c.), tirgotāju un amatnieku apvienību namiem (Lielajai un Mazajai ģildei, Melngalvju namam), tiesu un pārvaldes ēkām, mācību iestādēm, biržām, bankām, slimnīcām, patversmēm, teātru (piem., Vācu teātra, tagadējās Nacionālās operas) un biedrību ēkām, sporta būvēm un īres namiem, kā arī parkiem un pieminekļiem. Rakstu autoru vidū ir pazīstami tā laika arhitekti: V. Neimanis (W. Neumann), A. Reinbergs, H. Hartmanis (H.Hartmann), P. Mandelštams (P.Mandelstam), H. Mēlbarts (H.Mehlbart), G. Kūfalts (G.Kuphaldt) un inženieri B. Doss, A. Agte (A.Agthe), A. Tobīns (A.Tobien), A. Pābsts u.c. Krājums ir bagātigi ilustrēts ar ēku attēliem un plāniem. Izdevums sniedz informāciju ne tikai par katras ēkas celtniecības vēsturi, bet arī par tajā mītošās organizācijas vēsturi līdz 20.gs.

europeana:record.dc:title: Octoih
ОКТОИХ
europeana:record.dc:subject: 270 Christian church history
europeana:record.dc:description: It is an incomplete copy. The quaternions at the beginning up to number 25 are in black colour, those from number 26 to the end are in red colour. Its content is religious.
Некомплетен примерок Почетните кватерниони до бр. 25 се со црна боја, а од 26 до крај се со црвена боја. Содржината е религиозна.
europeana:record.dc:source: National and University Library “St Kliment Ohridski” - Skopje, Republic of Macedonia
Национална и универзитетска библиотека "Св.Климент Охридски" - Скопје , Република Македонија

europeana:record.dc:title: Кантычкась, арба Книнга гесмю
europeana:record.dc:creator: Valančius, Motiejus
europeana:record.dc:subject: 240 Christian moral & devotional theology
europeana:record.dc:description: "Kantičkos arba knyga giesmių" prepared by bishop Motiejus Valančius is one of the important publications in Lithuanian language, printed using Cyrillic alphabet. Tsarist authorities believed that this measure, part of a larger Russification plan, would decrease Polish influence on Lithuanians and would return them to what were considered their ancient historical ties with Russia. It has been stated that Lithuania was baptises by Orthodox Church, thus establishing Russian language, writing and culture in Lithuania. While the Latin alphabet is an instrument of alien culture, later imposed by Jesuits and polonizators of Lithuania. According to these arguments, the Lithuanian publications in the Latin alphabet were banned in 1864. However, very few books were published in Cyrillic. Most of the Latin-alphabet Lithuanian-language books and periodicals were printed in Lithuania Minor and then illegally smuggled from Prussia into Lithuania.

Šis vyskupo Motiejaus Valančiaus parengtas giesmyno „Kantičkos arba knyga giesmių“ egzempliorius svarbus kaip viena iš nedaugelio knygų lietuvių kalba, išspausdintų rusiškomis raidėmis (kirilica). Caro valdžia, norėdama lietuvius surusinti, atitolinti nuo didelę įtaką turėjusios lenkų kultūros, siekė lietuvius suprovoslavinti. Buvo teigiama, kad Lietuvą apkrikštiję stačiatikiai, kurie kartu įtvirtinę rusų kalbą, rusišką raštiją ir kultūrą. Tad ir rusiškas raidynas čia esąs pirmapradis. O lotyniškas raidynas esąs svetimos kultūros įrankis, tik vėliau primestas jėzuitų ir Lietuvos lenkintojų. Vadovaujantis tokiais argumentais, 1864 m. ir buvo uždrausta lietuviška spauda lotyniškais rašmenimis. Tačiau tik nedaugelis knygų išspausdinta kirilica, buvo organizuotas knygų lietuviškais rašmenimis spausdinimas ir nelegalus gabenimas į Lietuvą iš Prūsijos.
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania
