europeana:record.dc:creator: Jaugelis-Telega, Steponas
europeana:record.dc:subject: Psalms;Gospels;Catechisms;Prayers;Psalms;Gospels;Catechisms;Prayers;Psalms;Gospels;Catechisms;Prayers;Psalms;Gospels;Catechisms;Prayers
europeana:record.dc:description: "Knyga nobažnystės krikščioniškos" is the biggest Lithuanian book of the seventeenth century. It is a collection of Evangelical Reformed church texts, printed in the Kėdainiai printing house founded by Jonušas Radvila, in 1653. It also includes two printed dedications to the Field Hetman of Lithuania and Voivod of Vilnius Jonušas Radvila. One of them was written in rhyme by S. Jaugelis-Telega and is the first printed Lithuanian poetic dedication. The book was reprinted in 1684 as contrafaction edition in Königsberg, with some amendments and supplements. The printing was funded by Liudvika Karolina Radvilaitė. It is the first Lithuanian contrafaction in the history of Lithuanian books.

„Knyga nobažnystės krikščioniškos“ - didžiausia XVII a. lietuviška knyga, pirmą kartą 1653 m. išspausdinta Kėdainiuose Jonušo Radvilos įkurtoje spaustuvėje. Tai - evangelikų reformatų bažnytinių tekstų rinkinys. Taip pat jame spausdinamos dvi dedikacijos LDK lauko etmonui ir Vilniaus vaivadai Jonušui Radvilai. Viena jų - eiliuotai parašyta S. Jaugelio-Telegos. Tai - pirmoji išspausdinta eiliuota lietuviška dedikacija. 1684 m. ši knyga Liudvikos Karolinos Radvilaitės lėšomis buvo pakartota Karaliaučiuje kaip kontrafakcinis leidinys su tam tikrais pakeitimais, tekstų priedais. Tai - pirmoji kontrafakcija lietuvių knygos istorijoje. Antraštiniame lape nurodyta, kad tai Kėdainiuose 1653 m. išspausdinta knyga.
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: Naujas Istatimas Jezaus Christaus Wieszpaties musu
europeana:record.dc:creator: Giedraitis, Juozapas Arnulfas
europeana:record.dc:subject: New Testament;New Testament
europeana:record.dc:description: This book is the first catholic translation of "New Testament" into Lithuanian language. The book was translated by the bishop of Samogitia Juozapas Arnulpas Giedraitis (1754-1838) from the Latin version of the Bible Vulgate using a Polish translation by Jokūbas Vujekas.

Ši knyga – pirmasis katalikiškas „Naujojo Testamento“ vertimas į lietuvių kalbą. Knygos vertėjas – Žemaičių vyskupas Juozapas Arnulpas Giedraitis (1754-1838). Verčiama buvo iš lotyniškos Vulgatos, tačiau naudotasi ir lenkiškuoju Jokūbo Vujeko vertimu.
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: Priest Puncho Miscellany of 1796
Поппунчов сборник от 1796 г.
europeana:record.dc:creator: priest Puncho
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books;490 Other languages;240 Christian moral & devotional theology;090 Manuscripts & rare books;490 Other languages;240 Christian moral & devotional theology
europeana:record.dc:description: This extremely intriguing manuscript of instructive character is important first of all because it was written in vernacular Bulgarian of the late 18th century and has been provided for print. Next comes its various literary content, compiling texts from older manuscripts, Russian printed books, apokrypha, a version of the first proper Bulgarian chronicle, Paisii Hilendarski’s Istorija slavjanobalgarska, as well as texts the origin of which is unspecified. The illumination, though naïve, is very rich. It includes two self-portraits of the scribe and compiler priest Puncho together with numerous miniatures, some of them having unusual iconography. The sources, exploited by this village priest who turned to be one of the Bulgarian literary revival figures, are not fully investigated.

Този изключително любопитен сборник с поучителен характер e ценен на първо място с това, че е написан на говоримия български език от края на ХVІІІ в. и е бил предвиден за печат. На второ място идва неговият разнообразен литературен състав, компилиращ текстове от по-стари ръкописи, от печатни руски книги, апокрифни текстове, преработка на първото българско историческо съчинение „История славянобългарска” на Паисий Хилендарски, както и текстове, чийто произход не е напълно изяснен. Украсата, макар и наивна, е много богата. Тя включва два автопортрета на книжовника и съставителя поп Пунчо, както и множество миниатюри, иконографията на част от които не е обичайна. Все още остават непроучени източниците, от които се е ползвал този селски свещеник, превърнал се във фигура на българското литературно Възраждане.
europeana:record.dc:source: St. Cyril and St. Methodius National Library
Natsionalna biblioteka Sv. Sv. Kiril i Metodii

europeana:record.dc:title: Constitution of Serbia
Устав Књажества Сербије
europeana:record.dc:creator: Обреновић, Милош; Обреновић, Јеврем
europeana:record.dc:subject: 340 - Law
europeana:record.dc:description: This Constitution, well known as "Sretenjski ustav" was named after the Mileta's rebellion in Kragujevac.
Познатији као "Сретењски устав", донесен у Крагујевцу после Милетине буне.

europeana:record.dc:title: The Pretentious Pumpkine
Покондирена тиква
europeana:record.dc:creator: Поповић, Јован Стерија
europeana:record.dc:subject: 800 - Literature
europeana:record.dc:description: The book is one of the major comedies in Serbian language by one of the greatest play writers in Serbian literature.
Књига је једна од најзначајнијих драма на српском језику једног од највећих комедиографа српске књижевности.

europeana:record.dc:title: The Mountain Wreath
Горски вијенац
europeana:record.dc:creator: Петровић Његош, Петар
europeana:record.dc:subject: 800 - Literature
europeana:record.dc:description: Petar II Petrovic Njegos (Njegusi, 1813 - Cetinje, 1851) - Metropolitan of Montenegro, the ruler and poet, one of the most famous figures in Serbian literature and culture. The book is one of the most important epics in Serbian, translated into almost all European languages.

Петар II Петровић Његош (Његуши, 1813 - Цетиње, 1851), митрополит црногорски, владар и песник, једна од најзначајнијих фигура српске књижевности и културе. Књига је један од најзначајнијих спевова на српском језику, преведена на готово све европске језике.

europeana:record.dc:title: The Little Casket for Serbian history, language and customs
Ковчежић за историју, језик и обичаје Србa
europeana:record.dc:creator: Караџић, Вук Стефановић
europeana:record.dc:subject: 900 - History
europeana:record.dc:description: Significant historiographical 19th century book.
Значајна историографска књига 19. века.

europeana:record.dc:title: Poems 2
Песме 2
europeana:record.dc:creator: Радичевић, Бранко
europeana:record.dc:subject: 800 - Literature
europeana:record.dc:description: Branko Radicevic (Slavonski Brod, 1824 - Vienna, 1853) - one of the most important poets of the Serbian Romanticism. As the follower of Vuk Karadzic, he was one of the first poets, writing in Serbian vernacular. The first volume of his Poems has been published in 1847, the turning year in Serbian literature and culture in general. It was the first collection of the modern Serbian lyric poetry.

Бранко Радичевић (Славонски Брод, 1824 - Беч, 1853), један од најважнијих песника српског романтизма. Као присталица Вука Караџића први је почео да пева на народном језику. Први том Песама објављен је 1847. године која је прекретничка у српској књижевности и култури. Прва збирка модерне српске лирике.

europeana:record.dc:title: The Council of Serbian Government
Правитељствујушчиј совјет сербскиј
europeana:record.dc:creator: Караџић, Вук Стефановић
europeana:record.dc:subject: 900 - History
europeana:record.dc:description: The book was a significant historical work of the First Serbian Uprising.
Књига је значајно историографско дело о Првом српском устанку.

europeana:record.dc:title: The History of Serbian Literature
Историја српске књижевности : преглед угађан за школску потребу
europeana:record.dc:creator: Новаковић, Стојан
europeana:record.dc:subject: 800 - Literature
europeana:record.dc:description: Stojan Novakovic (Sabac, 1842 - Nis, 1915) - historian, philologist, diplomat and statesman. The book is the first complete history of Serbian literature.
Стојан Новаковић (Шабац, 1842 - Ниш, 1915), историчар, филолог, дипломата и државник. Књига је једна од првих историја српске књижевности. Прва историја целокупне српске књижевности.

europeana:record.dc:title: Counsels of Common Sense. 1
Совјети здраваго разума. 1
europeana:record.dc:creator: Обрадовић, Доситеј
europeana:record.dc:subject: 170 - Ethics (Moral philosophy)
europeana:record.dc:description: The collection of the moral lessons illustrated by Dositej autobiography and fictional examples; the true beginning of moral philosophy in Serbia.
Збирка моралних поука илустрованих аутобиографском грађом и фикционалним примерима; "почетак наравоучителне философије".

europeana:record.dc:title: Physics. 1
Фисика. 1
europeana:record.dc:creator: Стојковић, Атанасије
europeana:record.dc:subject: 500 - Science
europeana:record.dc:description: The first textbook of physics in Serbian.
Први српски уџбеник физике.

europeana:record.dc:title: Serbian News from the governing city Vienna - 1815
Новине сербске - из царствујушћег града Виене - 1815
europeana:record.dc:creator: b.a.
europeana:record.dc:subject: 900 - History
europeana:record.dc:description: Serbian News from Vienna, the third Serbian newspaper has been edited by Dimitrije Davidovic and Dimitrije Frusic. All famous Serbian authors cooperated in these newspaper, and so did Vuk Karadzic since 1815.
Треће по реду српске новине, уређивали их Димитрије Давидовић и Димитрије Фрушић. Сарађивали су најпознатији српски писци, а од 1815. и Вук Караџић.

europeana:record.dc:title: Krislai
europeana:record.dc:creator: Petkevičaitė-Bitė , Gabrielė
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages;890 Literatures of other languages;890 Literatures of other languages;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Gabriele Petkevičaitė-Bitė (1861-1943) is a famous Lithuanian prose writer, playwright, critic, publicist and public figure. Her first works of fiction published in the press in 1894. The collection of stories "Krislai" was released in 1905. These stories are typical to early Lithuanian realistic prose that emphasises national and social problems, especially questions of social injustice, education and philanthropy.

Gabrielė Petkevičaitė-Bitė (1861-1943) – žymi lietuvių prozininkė, dramaturgė, kritikė, publicistė, visuomenės veikėja. Jos pirmieji grožiniai kūriniai spaudoje pasirodė 1894 m. Apysakų ir apsakymų rinkinys „Krislai“ išleistas 1905 m. Tai ankstyvajai lietuvių realistinei prozai būdingi pozityvizmo dvasios teziniai pasakojimai, kuriuose aktualizuojamos nacionalinės ir socialinės problemos, ypač keliami socialinės skriaudos, švietimo bei filantropijos aspektai. Geriausiuose ryškiu kontrasto principu pabrėžiama žmogiškumo, išsilavinimo, normalių harmoningo gyvenimo sąlygų svarba žmogaus ir tautos brandai.
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: Užgesę Chimeros akys
europeana:record.dc:creator: Aistis, Jonas
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Jonas Aistis (1904-1973) is a famous XX century Lithuanian poet. The lyrics of Jonas Aistis belong to the classical tradition, it seeks to harmonize the relations between a person and the world. It is modern lyrics, since the poet skilfully uses both complex external forms and inner effects of the language. The collection of poetry "Užgesę chimeros akys" (Extinguished Eyes of Chimera, published in 1937) is presented in the exhibition. For this poetry Aistis was granted a State award.

Jonas Aistis (1904–1973) – žymus XX a. lietuvių poetas. Jo lyrika priklauso klasikos tradicijai, siekia harmonizuoti žmogaus ir pasaulio santykius. Tuo pačiu ji yra moderni savo sudėtingomis išorinėmis formomis ir meistriškai panaudotomis vidinėmis kalbos galimybėmis. Čia pristatoma poeto poezijos rinktinė „Užgesę chimeros akys“ (1937). Už ją autoriui buvo paskirta valstybinė premija.
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: Dievų miškas
europeana:record.dc:creator: Sruoga, Balys
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Balys Sruoga (1896-1947) is a famous Lithuanian writer, poet, playwright, critic, literature and folklore researcher. His best known work is the novel "Dievų miškas" (The Forest of Gods), based on his own life experiences as a prisoner in Stutthof concentration camp, where he was sent in March 1943. Balys Sruoga revealed life in a concentration camp through the eyes of a man, whose only way to save his life and maintain his dignity was to look at all of that through irony and humour. "Dievų miškas" has wider, universal meaning - the same phenomena are repeated by each totalitarian system of extinction of human beings.

Balys Sruoga (1896–1947) – vienas žymiausių lietuvių rašytojų, poetas, prozininkas, dramaturgas, kritikas, literatūros ir tautosakos tyrėjas. 1943 m. jis buvo suimtas ir išvežtas į Štuthofo koncentracijos stovyklą. Būtent apie ją rašoma čia pristatomame memuariniame veikale „Dievų miškas“. Pagrindinis romano autoriaus ginklas prieš žmogaus naikinimo sistemą, jos žvėriškumus yra meistriškai naudojama aštri ironija, kurios pagalba tragiškiausi momentai vaizduojami pro sarkastišką šypseną, sadistų kankintojų portretai piešiami ironiškomis spalvomis. „Dievų miškas“ turi ir platesnės apibendrinančios reikšmės – panašūs vaizdai kartojasi kiekvienos totalitarinės sistemos žmonių naikinimo pragare.
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: The History of Various Slavic Peoples. 2
Историја разних славенских народов. 2
europeana:record.dc:creator: Рајић, Јован
europeana:record.dc:subject: 900 - History
europeana:record.dc:description: Jovan Rajic (Sremski Karlovci, 1726 - Kovilj monastery, 1801) - Serbian historian, professor, Archimandrite. The book is the first history of the South Slavs, until second half of 19th century, the main and almost the only source of knowledge about Serbian past.

Јован Рајић (Сремски Карловци, 1726 - манастир Ковиљ, 1801), историчар, професор, архимандрит. Књига је прва историја Јужних Словена, до друге половине 19. века главни и готово једини извор знања о српској прошлости.

europeana:record.dc:title: Dutch Literature
Nederlandse Literatuur - Het Literatuurboek
europeana:record.dc:creator: Jan Bos Reinder Storm
europeana:record.dc:description: The 'Dutch Literature' web exhibition is based on Het Literatuurboek (‘the Literature Book’). This collection of writings was published by Waanders in 2003, under the editorship of Jan Bos and Reinder Storm. All the contributors are current or former Koninklijke Bibliotheek employees or workers at the Museum of Literature. All the items in the exhibition conclude with the author’s initials.

Deze webexpositie is gebaseerd op Het Literatuurboek dat onder redactie van Jan Bos en Reinder Storm in 2003 bij uitgeverij Waanders verscheen.
Alle stukjes in deze webexpositie eindigen steeds met de initialen van de auteur. Allen die stukjes hebben geschreven, zijn of waren werkzaam in het KB-gebouw, bij de Koninklijke Bibliotheek of bij het Letterkundig Museum.
europeana:record.dc:source: Koninklijke Bibliotheek - national library of The Netherlands
Koninklijke Bibliothaak - nationale bibliotheek van Nederland

europeana:record.dc:title: Altorių šešėly
europeana:record.dc:creator: Mykolaitis-Putinas, Vincas
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: The first Lithuanian psychological intellectual novel "Altorių šešėly" is presented in the exhibition. The book written by Vincas Mykolaitis - Putinas (1893-1967), the writer of symbolist forms and realistic psychological generalizations, a creator of philosophical lyrics, a literary critic, historian and aesthetic.

Pristatomas pirmasis lietuvių psichologinis-intelektinis romanas, kurio autorius Vincas Mykolaitis-Putinas (1893-1967) - simbolistinių formų ir realistinių-psichologinių apibendrinimų rašytojas, filosofinės lyrikos kūrėjas, literatūros kritikas, istorikas ir estetikas.
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: In Lithuania
Lietuvoje
europeana:record.dc:creator: Čiurlionienė-Kymantaitė, Sofija
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Sofija Kymantaitė-Čiurlionienė (1886-1958) is Lithuanian writer, public figure, literary and art critic, playwright, poet and translator. “Lietuvoje” (In Lithuania), published in 1910, was an important work for the cultural development in Lithuania. In this poem aesthetics of neo-romanticisms have been actualised and the independence of the talent from the social, domestic standards proclaimed.

Sofija Kymantaitė-Čiurlionienė (1886-1958) – lietuvių rašytoja, visuomenės veikėja, literatūros ir meno kritikė, dramaturgė, poetė, vertėja. 1910 m. jos išleista knyga „Lietuvoje“ svarbi kultūrinei Lietuvos raidai. Knygoje autorė aktualizavo neoromantizmo estetiką, skelbė talento nepriklausomybę nuo socialinių, buitinių normų. Maištingai stengėsi reformuoti estetinės minties ir teorinės savivokos nuostatas, agituodama už R. Wagnerio, Ch. Baudelaire’o, M. Maeterlincko, L. Andrejevo, H. Ibseno recepciją Lietuvoje. Veikiama antipozityvistinio „Młoda Polska“ sąjūdžio ir fin de siécle kultūrinio kriticizmo, meninę kūrybą kreipė „slaptingos žmogaus didybės“, intuicijos ir simbolistinės vaizduotės gilinimo linkme.
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: Ašarų vainikas
europeana:record.dc:creator: Baltrušaitis, Jurgis
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Jurgis Baltrušaitis (1873-1944) was a famous Lithuanian symbolist. A collection of poetry “Ašarų vainikas” (A Wreath of Tears) is one of the best ones created by J. Baltrušaitis. The poetry of J.Baltrušaitis is of symbolic trend. The symbolism of his poetry derives from Lithuanian tales, legends, folk songs, and the landscapes of motherland. The deep meaning of poetry is rendered in a simple form: regular verses, sustained rhythm and rhyme, simple language with no burden of fanciful words. Baltrušaitis poetry revives a romantic vision of Lithuania of old times.

Jurgis Baltrušaitis (1873-1944) – žymus lietuvių poetas simbolistas, savo kūrybinį kelią pradėjęs rašydamas rusų kalba. Čia pristatomas eilėraščių rinkinys „Ašarų vainikas“ priklauso geriausiems poeto kūriniams. J. Baltrušaičio poezija priklauso simbolizmo krypčiai. Jo poezijos simbolizmas remiasi lietuviškomis pasakomis, padavimais, liaudies dainomis, gimtinės peizažais. J.Baltrušaičio eilėraščių gilus turinys pateikiamas paprasta forma: taisyklingi posmai, išlaikytas ritmas ir rimas, paprasta kalba, neperkrauta įmantrybėmis. Poezijoje atgimsta romantinė senosios Lietuvos vizija.
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: Probotsiûn sesêliai
europeana:record.dc:creator: Vydūnas
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Vydūnas (a pseudonym of Vilhelmas Storosta, 1868-1953) is a famous Lithuanian writer, philosopher and cultural worker. Vydūnas literary heritage contains more than 60 books: plays of various genre, librettos, stories, philosophical tractates and studies of the history of philosophy, collections of folk songs, Lithuanian language textbooks, Lithuanian-German dictionary, study about Kristijonas Donelaitis, autobiography. In the dramas of trilogy "Probočių šešėliai" the relation between human and spiritual existence is revealed through individual awakening in the nation, devotion to her and willingness to work for her. The denationalisation of the Lithuanians of East Prussia is revealed as their spiritual decline, deviation from the natural way of spiritual perfection.

Vydūnas (tikrasis vardas – Vilhelmas Storosta) (1868-1953) – žymus lietuvių rašytojas, filosofas, kultūros veikėjas. Literatūrinį Vydūno palikimą sudaro daugiau kaip 60 knygų – įvairaus žanro pjesės, libretai, apysakos, filosofijos bei istoriosofijos traktatai, dainų rinkiniai, lietuvių kalbos vadovėliai, lietuvių–vokiečių kalbų žodynas, studija apie Kristijoną Donelaitį, atsiminimai. Trilogijos „Probočių šešėliai“ dramose žmogaus ir dvasinės būties santykis atskleidžiamas per individo atsibudimą tautoje, atsidavimą jai, pasiryžimą jai tarnauti. Rytų Prūsijos lietuvių nutautėjimas atskleidžiamas kaip dvasinis jų nuopuolis, iškrypimas iš natūralios dvasinio tobulėjimo eigos. Filosofinis Vydūno dramų turinys lėmė jų literatūrinės raiškos savitumą. Jų autorius kūrė modernų ritualinį teatrą, kuriam būdinga ne psichologinis dramatizmas, o veiksmo sakralumas, sceninis sąlygiškumas, dvasingumo prisodrinta atmosfera.
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: Valentina
europeana:record.dc:creator: Vaičiulaitis, Antanas
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: "Valentina" by famous Lithuanian writer, translator and diplomat Antanas Vaičiulaitis (1906-1992) is one of the most prominent works of aesthetic realism in Lithuanian literature. It retains its place in Lithuanian literature as an original manifestation of the worldwide trend in literature of the epoch of the modernism.

Žymaus Lietuvos rašytojo, vertėjo ir diplomato Antano Vaičiulaičio (1906-1992) „Valentina“ - tai vienas iškiliausių estetinio realizmo kūrinių lietuvių literatūroje ir užima svarbią vietą kaip savita tų laikų pasaulinės srovės - modernizmo apraiška.
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: The Witch and the Rain
Ragana ir lietus
europeana:record.dc:creator: Ivanauskaitė, Jurga
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: "Ragana ir lietus" (The Witch and the Rain) was written by the contemporary Lithuanian writer and essayist Jurga Ivanauskaitė (1961-2007) and is the most popular novel, translated into various foreign languages (Latvian, Estonian, German, Croatian, Swedish, Czech). This is an example of the latest Lithuanian literature, alienated from the Lithuanian literary traditions. For the first time in Lithuanian language the novel released in 1993 and caused quite a scandal. The national Ethics Commission failed to recognise the characters of the book as passionate searchers for God. They also failed to understand the deeper meaning in some of the drastic scenes of the book. The book was banned as allegedly pornographic and anti-Christian.

Ši knyga – šiuolaikinės lietuvių rašytojos, eseistės, publicistės Jurgos Ivanauskaitės (1961–2007) populiariausias romanas, susilaukęs vertimų į įvairias užsienio kalbas (latvių, estų, vokiečių, kroatų, švedų, čekų). Tai naujausios lietuvių literatūros, atitolusios nuo lietuviškos literatūros tradicijų, pavyzdys. Pirmą kartą lietuvių kalba išleistas 1993 m., dėl kūrinyje vaizduojamos jaunos moters aistros kunigui, šis romanas sukėlė visuomeninį skandalą: etikos komisija uždraudė platinti knygą kaip pornografinę ir antikrikščionišką, nepastebėdama aistringos veikėjų dievoieškos ir gilesnės poleminės drastiškų scenų prasmės.
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: Queen Beatrice
Beatrix királyné
europeana:record.dc:creator: Berzeviczy Albert
europeana:record.dc:subject: Történelem;940 General history of Europe
europeana:record.dc:description: In the “Hungarian Historical Biographies” series, biographies of prominent personalities in Hungarian history were introduced by outstanding historians and politicians of the age. The series of monographs was published by the Hungarian History Association, launched in 1885 by the editor Sándor Szilágyi. Albert Berzeviczy was a politician, aesthetician and historiographer, as well as the minister of religion and public education in the first Tisza government (1903-1905), and later Speaker of the House of Representatives (1910). As a historiographer, the two periods constituting his main interests were the age of Absolutism and, within the Middle Ages, the period of the Hungarian Queen Beatrice, of whom he wrote a monograph which was to be published into French, Spanish and Italian. Beatrice of Aragon (1457-1508) was married to the Hungarian Matthias and played a positive role in building the Renaissance court of Matthias and in supporting humanists. For example, she was the one to encourage Pietro Ransanus to produce the history of Hungarians. On the other hand, she was also active in political intrigue aimed at isolating King Matthias from his Hungarian environment.

A Magyar Történeti Életrajzok sorozatban, a magyar történelemben jeles szerepet játszó személyiségek életrajzait a kor kiváló történészei, politikusai mutatták be. A monográfia-sorozat a Magyar Történelmi Társulat kiadványa volt, amit 1885-ben Szilágyi Sándor szerkesztésével indítottak el. Berzeviczy Albert politikus, esztéta, és történetíró, az első Tisza-kormány vallás- és közoktatásügyi minisztere (1903-1905), a képviselőház elnöke (1910) volt. Történetíróként két korszakkal foglalkozott behatóbban, az abszolutizmus korával, és a magyar középkoron belül Beatrix magyar királynő korával, akiről monográfiát írt, amit több nyelvre (franciára, spanyolra és olaszra) is lefordítottak. Aragóniai Beatrix (1457-1508) magyar királyné, I. Mátyás király felesége volt. Nagy szerepet játszott Mátyás reneszánsz udvarának kiépítésében, a humanisták támogatásában, pl. Pietro Ransanust ő buzdította a magyarok történetének megírására. Emellett a politikai intrikáknak is tevékeny részese volt, melyek arra irányultak, hogy elszigeteljék Mátyást magyar környezetétől.

europeana:record.dc:title: Mindaugas; Mažvydas; Katedra
europeana:record.dc:creator: Marcinkevičius, Justinas
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Poet and playwright Justinas Marcinkevičius (b. 1930) is a prominent XX-XXI century Lithuanian poet, dramatist. Here is presented his dramatic trilogy which was written over nearly ten years. "Mindaugas" was published in 1968, "The Cathedral" in 1971, "Mažvydas" in 1976. According to the nature of the conflict these historical dramas can be referred as a tragedy. They accomplished an important historical role in the restoration of Lithuanian independence and have become symbols of the rebirth of the Lithuanian nation. They became universally recognized as a national literary and cultural identity.

Justinas Marcinkevičius (g. 1930). – žymus XX-XXI a. lietuvių poetas, dramaturgas. Čia pristatoma jo draminė trilogija parašyta per beveik dešimties metų laikotarpį: „Mindaugas“ – 1968 m., „Katedra“ – 1971 m., „Mažvydas“ – 1976 m. Šios istorinės dramos, pagal konflikto pobūdį priskirtinos tragedijos žanrui, ne tik atliko reikšmingą istorinį vaidmenį Lietuvos nepriklausomybės atkūrimo išvakarėse, bet tam tikra prasme jau tapo ir pačios lietuvių tautos dvasinio bei pilietinio atgimimo simboliu. Jos tapo visuotinai pripažinta nacionalinės literatūros bei kultūros savastimi.
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: Diemedžiu žydėsiu
europeana:record.dc:creator: Nėris, Salomėja
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Salomėja Nėris (1904–1945, real name Salomėja Bačinskaitė-Bučienė) was the most distinctive poet of interwar independent Lithuania. The pureness of emotion, the sheerness of form and melody really makes her resemble to a singing nightingale, though without special deepness of thoughts, but attractive by the candour of her heart. Her poetry collection "Diemedžiu žydėsiu" (published in 1938) is presented here in the exhibition, for which she received the State Literature Prize.

Salomėja Nėris (1904-1945, tikroji pavardė Salomėja Bačinskaitė-Bučienė) - ryškiausia tarpukario nepriklausomos Lietuvos poetė. Romantinės pasaulėjautos poetė, atnaujinusi dainingo eilėraščio tradiciją, poetinį gamtos išgyvenimą, ryšį su tautosaka, ištobulinusi lyrinės miniatiūros žanrą. Parodoje pristatoma 1938 metais išleista poezijos rinktinė "Diemedžiu žydėsiu", už šį rinkinį poetė buvo apdovanota valstybine literatūros premija.
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: Collected Works by Ilia Chavchavadze, Vol. 3
თხზულებანი -III ტომი
თხზულებანი -III ტომი
europeana:record.dc:creator: Chavchavadze, Ilia
europeana:record.dc:description: Prince Ilia Chavchavadze (8 November [O.S. 27 October] 1837 – 12 September [O.S. 30 August] 1907) was a Georgian writer, poet, journalist and lawyer who spearheaded the revival of the Georgian national movement in the second half of the 19th century, during the Russian rule of Georgia. Today he is widely regarded as one of the founding fathers of modern Georgia. In 1987 he was canonized as Saint Ilia the Righteous by the Georgian Orthodox Church. Inspired by the contemporary liberal movements in Europe, as a writer and a public figure, Ilia Chavchavadze directed much of his efforts toward awakening national ideals in Georgians and to the creation of a stable society in his homeland. His most important literary works were: The Hermit, The Ghost, Otaraant Widow, Kako The Robber and Is He Human, This "Man"?. Chavchavadze was fatally wounded by a gang of assassins. His legacy earned him the broad admiration of the Georgian people.
europeana:record.dc:source: The National Parliamentary Library of Georgia

europeana:record.dc:title: A Calendar for the Latgale region for A.D. 1870
Inflantuziemies ļajkagromota aba kalenders uz 1870 godu
europeana:record.dc:creator: Gustav Manteuffel
europeana:record.dc:subject: 050 General serials & their indexes
europeana:record.dc:description: Gustav Manteuffel (1832-1916) was a publicist, historian, ethnographer, folklorist and publisher. Influenced by the ideas of the Enlightment, he was committed to working for the people of his native region. Manteuffel’s most significant legacy is the calendar "Infļantu zemes zemes laika grõmota aba kalenders" (A Calendar for the Latgale region 1862–71). It is the first and the only 19th century publication in Latgalian written language, published on a regular basis and printed during the ban of printed Latgalian language. The publisher was awarded to pay a fine for that. It gained great favour among the people, and included lavish illustrations and extensive practical advice on farming, housekeeping and medicine. The calendar included enlightening anecdotes, riddles, proverbs, sayings poems and folk tales, which directly and indirectly urged the people to obtain education and knowledge.

Publicists, vēsturnieks, etnogrāfs, folklorists un izdevējs Gustavs Manteifelis (Manteuffel; 1832-1916) apgaismes ideju iespaidā par savas dzīves mērķi izvirzīja darbošanos dzimtās puses tautas labā. Manteifeļa nozīmīgākais devums ir viņa sastādītais un izdotais kalendārs „Infļantu zemes zemes laika grõmota aba kalenders” (1862-71). Tas ir pirmais un vienīgais regulāri iznākušais izdevums latgaliešu rakstu valodā 19. gs., kas iespiests drukas aizlieguma laikā. Izdevējs tāpēc maksāja sodu. Tautā populārajā, bagātīgi ilustrētajā izdevumā daudz praktisku padomu lauksaimniecībā, mājturībā un medicīnā. Kalendārā iekļautajiem stāstiņiem, mīklām, sakāmvārdiem, dzejoļiem un pasakām pamācošs raksturs, tiešāk un netiešāk mudinot skoloties un krāt zināšanas.

europeana:record.dc:title: Aristide and Natalia
Аристид и Наталија
europeana:record.dc:creator: Стојковић, Атанасије
europeana:record.dc:subject: 800 - Literature
europeana:record.dc:description: Atanasije Stojkovic (Ruma, 1773 - Kharkiv, 1832) - physicist, writer and professor. The book was the first novel of the Serbs.
Атанасије Стојковић (Рума, 1773 - Харков, 1832), физичар, књижевник и професор. Књига је први роман код Срба.

europeana:record.dc:title: Four Gospels NBKM 76 of 1658
Четириевангелие НБКМ 76 от 1658 г.
europeana:record.dc:creator: priest Ioann
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books;220 Bible;200 Religion;090 Manuscripts & rare books;220 Bible;200 Religion;090 Manuscripts & rare books;220 Bible;200 Religion
europeana:record.dc:description: The Gospel, also known as Etropole Gospel, was selected as an important representative of Etropole Calligraphic and Artistic School of the 17th century. It has been copied by hiereos (priest) Ioann in Etropole village and illuminated most probably by the copyist with four miniatures of the evangelists, inscribed into the headpieces. In the Calendar (Menologion) are included the holidays of St. Petka (Parasceve of Tarnovo), St. John of Rila, St. Cyril the Philosopher and the Serbian saints Sava and Stephen. The luxurious book cover is made in 1758 in the gold craft centre, active in the 17th-18th century in the region of Plovdiv and Bachkovo Monastery. The book block has been restored but the restoration changed its original volume so it needs a new binding. Therefore the codex is included into Adopt a Book donation program.

Евангелието, наричано и Етрополско, е избрано като важен представител на Етрополската калиграфска и художествена школа от ХVІІ в. Писано е от йерей Йоан в село Етрополе и е украсен, навярно от самия книжовник, с четири миниатюри на евангелистите, поместени в заставките. В календара са включени българските светци Петка Търновска, Йоан Рилски, Кирил Философ, както и сръбските светци Сава и Стефан. Реставрираната разкошна обкова на евангелието е направена през 1758 г. в златарския център, работил през ХVІІ-ХVІІІ в. в района на Пловдив и Бачковския манастир. Книжното тяло също е реставрирано, но поради променения му обем се нуждае от нова подвързия. По тази причина ръкописът е включен в библиотечната програма „Осинови книга”.
europeana:record.dc:source: St. Cyril and St. Methodius National Library
Natsionalna biblioteka Sv. Sv. Kiril i Metodii

europeana:record.dc:title: The St. Florian Psalter
Psałterz floriański
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books;200 Religion
europeana:record.dc:description: "The St. Florian Psalter" contains the texts of the psalms in three languages: Latin, German and Polish. It is the oldest Polish translation of the psalms and was created in several stages from the 1370s until the beginning of 15th century. It was probably prepared for the Polish Queen Jadwiga d‘Anjou. The Psalter was kept until 1931 in the library of the abbey of regular canons in Sankt-Florian, Austria, where it was discovered by the local librarian, Father Josef Chmel, in 1827. The Psalter was then purchased by the Polish government and given to the National Library. The manuscript is richly illustrated. A part of the decorations is the work of a Cracow illuminator known as the Master of the Hutter’s Bible. "The Psalter..." is written on parchment in two columns. Each Latin verse is repeated in the German and Polish language. The verses opening each language section are marked by coloured initials.

"Psałterz floriański" zwiera teksty psalmów w trzech językach: łacińskim, niemieckim i polskim. Jest najstarszym zachowanym polskim przekładem psalmów. Powstawał w kilku fazach – od lat 70-tych XIV wieku do początków wieku XV. Przygotowano go prawdopodobnie dla królowej Polski Jadwigi Andegawenki. "Psałterz..." przechowywano do roku 1931 w bibliotece opactwa kanoników w Sankt Florian w Austrii. Tam odkrył go ks. Josef Chmel, tamtejszy bibliotekarz. Później zakupił go polski rząd i w końcu trafił do Biblioteki Narodowej. Rękopis jest bogato ilustrowany. Część ilustracji wykonał krakowski iluminator nazywany Mistrzem Biblii Hunterów. Teksty psalmów spisano na pergaminie w dwóch kolumnach. Każdy wers łaciński powtórzony jest w języku niemieckim i polskim. Wersety poszczególnych części językowych zostały oznaczone kolorowymi inicjałami.

europeana:record.dc:title: A.V. Suvorov, Generalissimo
Генералиссимус Суворов
europeana:record.dc:creator: Петрушевский, Александр Фомич (1826-1904)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 940 General history of Europe
europeana:record.dc:description: This seminal work on the life and career of the great Russian Commander, Alexander Suvorov, lays bare the conditions and conflict that moulded the great leader. Author Alexander F. Petrushevskiy draws on a vast array of documentary sources to shed light on the incidents and pivotal points in his career. The detailed accounts of his life highlight the spirit behind the charismatic commander.

Книга А.Ф.Петрушевского «Генералиссимус князь Суворов» является фундаментальным трудом, посвященным жизни и деятельности великого русского полководца. На основе богатого документального материала автор подробно описывает условия формирования характера и полководческого гения своего героя, позволяя читателю ощутить непередаваемый суворовский дух.

europeana:record.dc:title: A Description of Kamchatka Semi-island. V.1
Описание Земли Камчатки. Т. 1
europeana:record.dc:creator: Крашенинников, Степан Петрович (1711-1755)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 550 Earth sciences;940 General history of Europe
europeana:record.dc:description: This early travel guide to Kamchatka paved the way for a completely new style of academic travel writing. Author Stepan P. Krasheninnikov (1711-1755) went with an expedition to Kamchatka peninsula in 1737. During his time there he gathered valuable information on the flora and fauna of the region as well as on its ethnography, history, natural settings, the indigenous population’s life and its language. On Krasheninnikov’s return to St. Petersburg in 1743, he set about recording his findings and experiences. The book comes complete with illustrations and proved popular for its attention to detail and use of supporting data.

Автор книги – сын солдата, получивший образование в Славяно-греко-латинской академии. В 1732 г. был направлен в Петербург для дальнейшего обучения в Академии наук и участия во 2-й Камчатской экспедиции. В эти годы Крашенинников собрал ценные материалы о растительном и животном мире Камчатки, этнографии и истории полуострова, его природных условиях, жизни и языке коренного населения. Вернувшись в Петербург (1743 г ), он начал готовить к печати материалы экспедиции, содержащие плоды комплексного обследования неизученного тогда региона. Книга С. П. Крашенинникова положила начало новому для русской книги жанру - публикации материалов научных путешествий по России. Самостоятельное научное и художественное значение имеют иллюстрации к книге, изготовленные и награвированные И.Э. Гриммелем и И.А. Соколовым по зарисовкам участника экспедиции И.Х. Беркгана. Книга включает карты, виды сибирских городов, изображения животного мира Камчатки, зарисовки этнографического характера. В мае 1755 г. в Академическую книжную лавку поступили 1288 экземпляров книги. Остальные 62 экземпляра пошли на бесплатную раздачу.

europeana:record.dc:title: Ferenc Rákóczi II.
II. Rákóczi Ferencz
europeana:record.dc:creator: Márki Sándor
europeana:record.dc:subject: Történelem;940 General history of Europe
europeana:record.dc:description: In the Hungarian Historical Biographies series, biographies of prominent personalities in Hungarian history were introduced by outstanding historians and politicians of the age. The series of monographs was published by the Hungarian History Association, launched in 1885 by the editor Sándor Szilágyi. Sándor Márki (1853-1925) was a historian, a university professor at Kolozsvár and a member of the Hungarian Academy of Sciences and the Saint Stephen Academy. He is also the author of a number of volumes in the “Hungarian Historical Biographies” series. Ferenc Rákóczi II (1676-1735) was the Prince of Transylvania and the leader of the Rákóczi War of Independence. At the 1704 Gyulafehérvár Diet he was elected to be the Prince of Transylvania, and at the 1705 Szécsény Diet the ruling Prince of Transylvania. He fought an anti-Habsburg war for the establishment of a centralised state with a regular army. He died in emigration in Turkey. His ashes were brought back to Hungary in 1806 to be buried in the Cathedral of Kassa.

A Magyar Történeti Életrajzok sorozatban, a magyar történelemben jeles szerepet játszó személyiségek életrajzait a kor kiváló történészei, politikusai mutatták be. A monográfia-sorozat a Magyar Történelmi Társulat kiadványa volt, amit 1885-ben Szilágyi Sándor szerkesztésével indítottak el. Márki Sándor (1853-1925) történész, kolozsvári egyetemi tanár, a MTA, és a Szent István Akadémia tagja volt. A Magyar Történeti Életrajzok sorozat több kötetének szerzője, forráskiadási tevékenysége is jelentős (pl. Gyulai Ferenc gróf naplója, Monaci Lőrinc krónikája Kis Károlyról, Rákóczi fejedelem históriája stb.), emellett helytörténeti munkákat, tankönyveket, és egy historiográfiáról szóló értekezést is írt. II. Rákóczi Ferenc (1676-1735) erdélyi fejedelem, a Rákóczi-szabadságharc vezetője volt. 1704-ben a gyulafehérvári országgyűlésen Erdély fejedelmévé, 1705-ben a szécsényi országgyűlésen pedig a magyarországi szövetkezett rendek fejedelmévé választották. A Habsburg elnyomás ellen, a reguláris hadsereggel rendelkező központosított állam megteremtéséért harcolt. Törökországi emigrációban halt meg, hamvait 1806-ban hozták haza és temették el a kassai székesegyházban.

europeana:record.dc:title: Dobreisho Gospel from the first quarter of the 13th century
Добрейшово евангелие от първата четвърт на 13 в.
europeana:record.dc:creator: priest Dobreisho
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books;200 Religion;220 Bible;090 Manuscripts & rare books;200 Religion;220 Bible;090 Manuscripts & rare books;200 Religion;220 Bible;090 Manuscripts & rare books;200 Religion;220 Bible
europeana:record.dc:description: The parchment manuscript, of which only a part survived, is from the first quarter of the 13th century. A modern note bearing the year 1221 is suggestive about a probable colophon, the date of which was copied by a late owner. The choice of the manuscript is due to the fact that the Gospel is among the important witnesses of the history of Bulgarian language. Of particular interest is the rich illumination, including two full-page miniatures of the evangelists Luke and John, the portrait of the latter accompanied by the figure of priest Dobreisho, the donor and/or (?) the copyist. The iconography of the miniatures reveals many strange features, not yet fully substantiated. The other part of the manuscript has been kept in the National Library of Serbia in Belgrade, where the fire after the bombing in 1941 destroyed it together with other manuscripts.

Ръкописът, писан на пергамент и запазен частично, се датира от първата четвърт на ХІІІ в. Годината 1221, написана значително по-късно, подсказва за вероятна оригинална приписка-колофон, датата от която е копирал късен собственик на книгата. Изборът на ръкописа е предизвикан от това, че евангелието е един от важните свидетели за историята на българския език. Особен интерес представлява неговата богата украса, включваща две миниатюри на цял лист с изображенията на евангелистите Лука и Йоан, като вторият портрет е съпроводен от фигурата на поп Добрейшо - ктиторът и/или (?) преписвачът на ръкописа. В иконографията на миниатюрите има редица особености, които все още не са напълно обяснени. Другата част от ръкописа е била притежание на Сръбската национална библиотека в Белград, където е била напълно унищожена при пожара след бомбардировката през 1941 г.
europeana:record.dc:source: St. Cyril and St. Methodius National Library
Natsionalna biblioteka Sv. Sv. Kiril i Metodii

europeana:record.dc:title: Akathists and Canons
Акатисти с канони
europeana:record.dc:creator: unknown
europeana:record.dc:subject: 220 Bible;000 Generalities;090 Manuscripts & rare books
europeana:record.dc:description: “Akathists and Canons” (1765) is one of the most richly decorated Ukrainian editions, kept in the St. St. Cyril and Methodius National Library. This book, printed in typography of the Kiev Pechersk Lavra, represents an extremely high level of the book design art. Engraved ornamental frames decorate the pages. In the text there are 20 illustrations, 16 of which are copper engravings and they are work of the engraver Averkij Kozachkinski. The ornamental decoration includes headpieces, tailpieces and 100 engraved initials. The copy is well preserved and restored.

„Акатисти с канони” (1765 г.)– едно от най-богато украсените украински издания, съхранявани в Националната библиотека „Св. св. Кирил и Методий”. Изкуството на оформление на книгите, отпечатани в типографията на Киево-Печорската лавра достига изключително високо ниво. Представяната книга е доказателство в това отношение. Страниците са в гравирани орнаментални рамки. В текста има 20 илюстрации, от които 16 са листови медни гравюри, дело на гравьора Аверкий Козачкивски. Орнаменталната украса включва заставки, концовки и 100 гравирани инициали. Двуцветен печат – черно и червено. Екземплярът е много добре запазен и реставриран.
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Typography of the Kiev Pechersk Lavra
europeana:record.dc:source: SS Cyril and Methodius National Library
Natsionalna biblioteka Sv.Sv. Kiril i Metodii

europeana:record.dc:title: Convolute of 7 editions from the end of the 16th – beginning of the 17th c. №1.Beseda Izbrannaya o Vaspitanii Chad. Lviv, 1609
Конволют ХVІ-ХVІІ. №1. Беседа избранная о воспитании чад.
europeana:record.dc:creator: Jov Boreckij
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books;370 Education;240 Christian moral & devotional theology;090 Manuscripts & rare books;370 Education;240 Christian moral & devotional theology
europeana:record.dc:description: This item of the 'Konvolut' (the first of seven bound items) is a rare example of an early print of a Slavonic cyrillic book. The work consists of a compilation of passages of a pedagogical nature, from the works of St John Chrysostom, with the addition of a small amount of text from St Basil. The work is attributed to Jov Boreckij and it was used like a textbook at schools of the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth. Only one other copy is known to exist, in the Museum of Ukrainian Art at Lviv.

Това издание от конволюта (№ 1 от 7) представлява компилация, подготвена от Йов Борецки. Състои се от части от трудове на Св. Йоан Златоуст с педагогическа насоченост, както и от текстове на Св. Василий Велики. Рядка и ценна славянска кирилска печатна книга, използвана и като учебник в братските школи на Жечпосполита. От изданието е известен още само един екземпляр, съхраняван в Музея на украинското изкуство в Лвов
europeana:record.dc:source: St. Cyril and St. Methodius National Library
Natsionalna biblioteka Sv. Sv. Kiril i Metodii

europeana:record.dc:title: Evangelion
„Евангелион сиреч благовестие богодухновенных евангелист”
europeana:record.dc:creator: Michael Sliozka
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books;000 Generalities;220 Bible
europeana:record.dc:description: "Evangelion sirech blagovestie bogoduhnovennih evangelist" (1644) is an edition of the L’vov Assumption Stavropigion Community (L’vov Uspenskoe Bratstvo). During the first half of the 17th century in the Community’s printing house were printed different liturgical books in several issues: Octoechos (1630, 1639, 1644); Apostle (1634, 1637, 1648), Anthologion (1632, 1638, 1643) and Evangelion (1636, 1644). The presented book is the second edition of the richly illustrated Evangelion from 1636. The printer is Michael Sliozka. The decoration includes frontispiece wood engravings of the four evangelists, more than fifty illustrations within the text, headpieces, tailpieces, initials (including also engraved ones). The text is printed in black and red. The restored and almost complete copy, owned by the St. St. Cyril and Methodius National Library, has numerous inscriptions on its pages.

„Евангелион сиреч благовестие богодухновенных евангелист” /1644/ е издание на Лвовското Успенско братство. През първата половина на 17 в. в типографията на Братствотото се отпечатват в повече от едно издания различни богослужебни книги : „Октоих” /1630, 1639, 1644/, „Апостол”/1634, 1637, 1648/, „Антологион” /1632, 1638, 1643/ и „Евангелие”/1636, 1644/. Представяната книга е второ издание на богато илюстрираното „Евангелие” от 1636 г. Печатар по поръчка на Братството е Михаил Сльозка. Украсата включва рязани на дърво фронтисписни гравюри на четиримата евангелисти, повече от петдесет илюстрации вътре в текста, заставки, концовки, инициали /включително и гравирани/. Печатът е двуцветен – черно и червено. Екземплярът, който е притежание на Националната библиотека „Св. св. Кирил и Методий” е реставриран. Той е сравнително пълен в количествено отношение и на много места има запазени приписки.
europeana:record.dc:source: SS Cyril and Methodius National Library.
Natsionalna biblioteka Sv.Sv. Kiril i Metodii

europeana:record.dc:title: [Dryad of Zamech]
[Dryas Zamchana]
europeana:record.dc:creator: Kochanowski, Jan (1530-1584)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Jan Kochanowski (1530-1584) was a Polish Renaissance poet and the creator of the modern literary language. He was born in Sycyna near Zvolen in 1530 and died in Lublin in 1584. "Dryas Zamchana Polonice et Latine. Pan Zamchanus Latine" are examples of court idylls. The two panegyrics were written by Kochanowski in honor of the Polish monarch, King Stefan Batory, who had come to the Zamech district to rest and participate in a hunt there. The idylls were sung during the ceremony at the court of Jan Zamoyski by people dressed as forest deities, Dryads and Pan. Kochanowski's panegyrics were published anonymously in the summer of 1578 in Lviv by Walenty Łapka’s printing house, which was set up on the initiative of Chancellor Jan Zamoyski by virtue of a royal privilege of 1577. The print consists of six leaves with both idylls in Latin ("Dryas Zamchana" and "Pan Zamchanus"), the former also being in Polish ("Dryas Zamechska").

Jan Kochanowski (1530-1584) to polski poeta epoki renesansu. Był twórcą nowoczesnego języka literackiego. Urodził się w Sycynie koło Zwolenia w 1530 roku. Zmarł w Lublinie w 1584 roku. "Dryas Zamchana Polonice et Latine. Pan Zamchanus Latine" to przykład sielanek dworskich. Kochanowski napisał dwa panegiryki na cześć polskiego króla Stefana Batorego, który przybył do Zamechu, aby wziąć tam udział w łowach i odpocząć. W czasie uroczystości na dworze Jana Zamoyskiego osoby przebrane za leśne bóstwa Driadę i Pana odśpiewały oba utwory. Panegiryki Kochanowskiego zostały wydane anonimowo. Ukazały się latem 1578 roku we Lwowie w drukarni Walentego Łapki, powołanej z inicjatywy kanclerza Jana Zamoyskiego, na mocy królewskiego przywileju z 1577 roku. Druk składa się z sześciu kart zawierających obie sielanki w wersji łacińskiej ("Dryas Zamchana" i "Pan Zamchanus") oraz pierwszą z nich po polsku ("Dryas Zamechska").

europeana:record.dc:title: Balladyna : A Tragedy in Five Acts
Balladina : tragedya w 5 aktach
europeana:record.dc:creator: Słowacki, Juliusz(1809-1849)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Juliusz Słowacki (1809-1849) was a Polish Romantic poet and playwright. His works took on a patriotic tone linked with the national movement, but at the same time exposed his philosophical ideas, in particular the genesic idea. Słowacki was also the precursor of the ironic trend in Polish literature. "Balladyna" was written in Switzerland during the last months of 1834. It was published for the first time in 1839 by Eustachy Januszkiewicz. The publication was based on the Swiss manuscript. The language of the Paris publication according to researchers contained some inconsistencies and strays from the author’s language, which could suggest the publisher’s interference in the text. The other publications of "Balladyna" are based on a different text, probably the manuscript of "Balladyna" which belongs to the collection of the National Library. It is a small notebook, which was written in Słowacki’s own hand and in his small-sized handwriting. "Balladyna’s" theme is the pursuit of power and playing the role of a murderer. It is a stylized folk tale, taking place in the Gopło region in the reign of the legendary King Popiel III.

Juliusz Słowacki (1809-1849) to polski poeta i dramatopisarz romantyczny. W swoich utworach podejmował tematykę związaną z ruchem narodowowyzwoleńczym, ale był też twórcą filozofii genezyjskiej i prekursorem nurtu ironicznego w literaturze polskiej. Słowacki napisał "Balladynę" w ostatnich miesiącach 1834 roku w Szwajcarii. Została wydana po raz pierwszy w 1839 roku przez Eustachego Januszkiewicza na podstawie szwajcarskiego rękopisu. W języku paryskiego wydania badacze dopatrzyli się niekonsekwencji i odstępstw od języka poety, co świadczy o ingerencji wydawcy w tekst utworu. Kolejne wydania "Balladyny" opierają się na innym tekście. Prawdopodobnie jest nim rękopis "Balladiny" znajdujący się w zbiorach polskiej Biblioteki Narodowej. Jest to niewielki zeszyt zapisany drobnym pismem Słowackiego. "Balladyna" opowiada o dążeniu do władzy i wcielaniu się w rolę mordercy. Stylizowana jest na opowieść ludową. Akcja rozgrywa się w okolicach Gopła w za panowanie legendarnego króla Popiela III.

europeana:record.dc:title: The Adventures of Sinbad the Sailor
Przygody Sindbada Żeglarza
europeana:record.dc:creator: Leśmian, Bolesław (1878-1937)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Bolesław Leśmian (1878-1937) was a Polish poet of Jewish origin, the author of prose fairy-tale, love poems, and the new type of ballad. He was an original and innovative writer of a unique personality. For many years he worked as a humble lawyer in the provincial town of Hrubieszów. "The Adventures of Sinbad the Sailor" is an example of children's literaure, combining both poetry and prose elements. The title refers to Sinbad the Sailor, the hero of the story cycle "One Thousand and One Nights" of Middle Eastern origin. Sinbad the Sailor lives with his uncle Tarabuk, a poet, in Bagdad. Once day, encouraged by a Sea Monster, he decides to leave his home, which leads to many adventures...

Bolesław Leśmian (1878-1937) to polski poeta pochodzenia żydowskiego. Autor baśni prozą, erotyków, twórca nowego typu ballady. Pisarz oryginalny, nowatorski, o niezwykłej osobowości, który przez wiele lat zarabiał na życie jako skromny notariusz w prowincjonalnym mieście Hrubieszowie. "Przygody Sindbada Żeglarza" jest utwórem dla dzieci z pogranicza poezji i prozy. Tytuł i treść nawiązuje do postaci Sindbada Żeglarza z arabskiej "Księgi tysiąca i jednej nocy". Sindbad Żeglarz mieszka z wujem Tarabukiem - poetą, w Bagdadzie. Pewnego dnia, zachęcony przez Diabła Morskiego, postanawia wypłynąć w świat i przeżywa wiele przygód…

europeana:record.dc:title: Rebuilding of Babylon
Babilono atstatymas
europeana:record.dc:creator: Geda, Sigitas
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Sigitas Geda (1943-2008) was famous contemporary Lithuanian poet. One of the most significant collections of his poetry "Babilono atstatymas" (Rebuilding of Babylon) is presented in the exhibition. For this book the poet has been awarded the National Award in 1995. The main theme of the poems in "Babilono atstatymas" is the search of the universal mythic memory and attempts to trace the kinship ties between matter and the language. As the title of the book implies, poet attempts to discover the sources of the language. The ingenuous style of the book is characterised by the ritualistic discourse married with blasphemy and pictograms integrated into the text, seeks to reconstruct the very process of the language formation. Themes and images from the Eastern and Western religions and mythologies are woven together in the texts of his poems.

Sigitas Geda (1943-2008) – žymus šiuolaikinis lietuvių poetas. Čia pristatomas vienas reikšmingiausių jo poezijos rinkinių “Babilono atstatymas”. Už šią knygą poetas buvo apdovanotas Nacionaline premija (1995). Pagrindinė „Babilono atstatymo“ eilėraščių tema – universalios mitinės atminties, daiktų ir kalbos giminystės paieškos. Kaip rodo jau pats rinkinio pavadinimas, poetui rūpi kalbos ištakos. Išmoninga stilistika, kurioje dera ritualizuota kalbėsena, piktžodžiavimas, į tekstą įtraukiama piktograma, poetas siekia parodyti patį kalbos radimosi procesą. Eilėraščiuose susipina Rytų ir Vakarų religinių sistemų mitologinės temos bei įvaizdžiai.
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: Festal menaion from the 15th c.
Празничен миней от ХV в.
europeana:record.dc:creator: unknown
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books
europeana:record.dc:description: In the manufacture of this 15th-century Festal menaion six anonymous scribes participated, representing the tradition of one and the same scriptorium. Written in a peculiar type of semiuncial, usually practiced in monastic ateliers of the period, the liturgical book was most probably provided for a monastery not yet identified. It may be assumed that besides the services for big ecclesiastic feasts and holydays of especially venerated in Bulgaria and on the Balkans saints such as St. Petka (Parasceve from Tarnovo, 14 October) and St. Theodore Tyron (17 February), the manuscript originally included other services for the locally most popular saints. The text includes a small selection of Resurrection Troparia and Kontakia in the 8 Tones from the Octoechos.

В изработването на празничния миней от ХV в. участват шестима анонимни кописти, вероятно представители на един и същ скриптториум. Ръкописът е изписан с един от характерните типове монашески полуустав и вероятно е направен за богослужението в неидентифициран засега манастир. Освен големите църковни празници, предполага се, че тук са включени и служби на почитани на Балканите светци, сред които са св. Петка Търновска и св. мчк Теодор Тирон.
europeana:record.dc:source: St. Cyril and St. Methodius National Library
Natsionalna biblioteka Sv. SV. Kiril i Metodii

europeana:record.dc:title: The Przemyśl Meditation
Rozmyślanie o żywocie Pana Jezusa (Rozmyślanie przemyskie)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 200 Religion;090 Manuscripts & rare books
europeana:record.dc:description: The most extensive monument of Polish medieval prose and apocryphal literature in the Polish language. The codex comes from the end of the 15th century and is probably a copy of an earlier work. Until 1945 it had been stored in the Library of the Greek Catholic Chapter in Przemyśl. But when the Przemyśl bishopric was abolished, it was transferred, together with other manuscripts, to the National Library. "The Przemyśl Meditation" deals with the life of the Holy Virgin and Christ on the basis of the Gospels and such works as Petrus Comestorus’s 12th century "Historia Scholastica" and the 13th century rhymed poem “Vita Virginis Mariae rhythmica”. The brisk colourful text is interspersed with prayers. The autor uses colloquial expressions in the dialogues and he painstakingly portrays all persons (especially Mary), attaching great importance to realities. Alongside "The Florian Psalter", it is one of the most valuable and one of the earliest monuments of the Polish language. This is why it has long aroused scholarly interest.

Jeden z najcenniejszych i najobszerniejszych zabytków średniowiecznej prozy i literatury apokryficznej w języku polskim. Rozmyślanie powstało prawdopodobnie w połowie XV stulecia, a zachowane jest w kopii sporządzonej na początku XVI wieku. Jest to "powieść" o dziejach Świętej Rodziny, zawierająca m.in. przemilczany w Ewangeliach okres dzieciństwa Jezusa, szczegółowe opisy urody Maryi i jej Syna. Jest znakomitą pod względem redakcyjnym kompilacją najrozmaitszych źródeł: biblijnych, apokryficznych, kaznodziejskich, teologicznych i hagiograficznych. Ewangeliczną historię Świętej Rodziny autor rozbudował i uzupełnił m.in. w oparciu o traktat "Vita beatae Virginis Mariae et Salvatoris rhythmica, Historia scholastica" Piotra Comestora oraz "Passio Christi..." Jakuba de Vitry.

europeana:record.dc:title: Textbook on ecclesiastical music
Γραμματικη μουσικης θεωρητικης και πρακτικης
europeana:record.dc:creator: Basileios Nikolaides Byzantios
europeana:record.dc:subject: 780 Music;090 Manuscripts & rare books;780 Music;090 Manuscripts & rare books
europeana:record.dc:description: This manuscript is a textbook on ecclesiastical music and has been provided for print. It was written and probably composed by Basileios Nikolaou Byzantios. It attracts the interest of those readers who study Byzantine Ecclesiastical music.

Учебник по църковна музика НБКМ Гр. 90 Този ръкопис е учебник по църковна музика и е бил подготвен за печат. Негов писач и вероятно автор е Василиос Николаидис Византиос. Посочени са място и година на изписване (Яш, 1825). Този паметник, както и преходният Гр. 61, привлича интереса на читатели, изучаващи Византийска църковна музика.
europeana:record.dc:source: SS Cyril and Methodius National Library
Nationalna Biblioteca Sv. sv. Kiril i Metodii

europeana:record.dc:title: Prophetologion
Προφητολογιον
europeana:record.dc:creator: unknown
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books;220 Bible
europeana:record.dc:description: The Greek Prophetologion kept in the National Library in Sofia, Bulgaria, is a parchment manuscript representing a rare kind of book from the second half of the 11th century. It is provided for liturgical needs and contains a collection of readings mainly from the Old Testament, to be read during the Vespers before Great Ecclesiastical Feasts. This kind of book became obsolete after the 16th century. According to the illumination and the manner of writing the South Italian provenance of the manuscript could be suggested.

Профетологион НБКМ Гр. 18 Гръцкият профетологион, съхраняван в Националната библиотека в София, е пергаментен ръкопис и представлява рядък тип книга от втората половина на 11 век. Той е създаден за богослужебни нужди и съдържа текстове основно от Стария завет, предназначени за четене на вечерните служби преди големи църковни празници. Този тип книга започва да изчезва след 16 век. Според украсата и начина на изписване паметникът може да бъде причислен към ръкописите, създадени в Южна Италия.
europeana:record.dc:source: SS Cyril and Methodius National Library
Natsionalna Biblioteka Sv. sv. Kiril i Metodii

europeana:record.dc:title: Mayne zikhroynes
Mayne zikhroynes
europeana:record.dc:creator: Perec, Icchok Lejb (1851-1915)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 010 Bibliography
europeana:record.dc:description: Icchok Lejb Perec (1851-1915), a Polish and Jewish author, was one of the most important writers of Yiddish literature. He was born in Zamość and raised in an Orthodox Jewish home of Sephardic origin. Receiving a traditional education, he obtained an external law degree, which enabled him to pursue the profession of a lawyer in Zamość. Later he found a job in Warsaw in the small bureaucracy of the city's Jewish community. Poems written in the Polish language were considered to be his debut, his literary output, however, was not limited to poetry: He gained fame as the author of stories and dramas. He became a publicist and literary critic, involved in publishing activities. Perec tried to encourage young writers. His Warsaw apartment became the centre of Yiddish culture and literature. With Mendele Mokher Seforim and Sholem Aleichem, he is one of the three great classical Yiddish writers. In the Interwar period, the Jewish Section of the Pen Club in Poland awarded him the PEN/Peretz award. He died in Warsaw and was buried at the Okopowa Street Jewish Cemetery, lying next to those of two other masters of Yiddish literature: An-Ski and Jacob Dinezon.

Icchok Lejb Perec (1851-1915), jid. יצחק לײב פּרץ – polski i żydowski pisarz, jeden z głównych twórców literatury jidysz. Urodził się w Zamościu w rodzinie ortodoksyjnej o korzeniach sefardyjskich. Odebrał tradycyjne wykształcenie, po czym eksternistycznie ukończył wydział prawa. Pracował jako adwokat w Zamościu, a następnie jako urzędnik w Gminie Starozakonnych w Warszawie. Debiutował wierszami i poematami w języku polskim. Twórczość Pereca nie ograniczała się do poezji; zasłynął autor opowiadań i dramatów. Zajmował się także publicystyką i krytyką literacką oraz działalnością wydawniczą. Starał się wspierać młode talenty pisarskie, a jego mieszkanie w Warszawie stało się swoistym centrum literatury i kultury jidysz. Zaliczany jest, obok Mendele Mojcher Sforima i Szolema Alejchema, do wielkiej trójcy pisarzy żydowskich. W okresie międzywojennym Żydowska Sekcja Pen Clubu w Polsce przyznawała nagrody jego imienia. Zmarł w Warszawie i został pochowany na cmentarzu żydowskim przy ul. Okopowej. W jego grobie tzw. ohelu Pereca spoczywa także An-Ski oraz Jakub Dinezon.

europeana:record.dc:title: Physics. 2
Фисика. 2
europeana:record.dc:creator: Стојковић, Атанасије
europeana:record.dc:subject: 500 - Science

Октоих

europeana:record.dc:title: Convolute of 7 editions from the end of the 16th – beginning of the 17th c. №7. Lament (Lament Domou Knyazat Ostrozskih…).Ostrih,[1604].
Конволют ХVІ-ХVІІ. № 7. Ламент дому княжат Острозских...Острог,[1604]
europeana:record.dc:creator: Demyan Nalivayko
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books;090 Manuscripts & rare books
europeana:record.dc:description: A rare and interesting example of a threnody for Prince Alexander Konstantinovich of Ostrih, written in rhymed syllabic verses and composed as a memorial to his life and death (№7 of 7 items bound together). It is the most complete copy of the poem ever known.

Рядък и интересен образец на погребална поема (ламент), възхваляваща героичния живот и подвизи на острожкия княз Александър Константинович (№ 7 от 7 издания, подвързани заедно). Творбата е написана в мерена реч – т. нар. „вирши”. Това е най-пълното копие на тази рядка и ценна книга, известно на науката до този момент.

europeana:record.dc:title: A Calendar for the Latgale region for A.D. 1871
Inflantuziemies ļajkagromota aba kalenders uz 1871 godu
europeana:record.dc:creator: Gustav Manteuffel
europeana:record.dc:subject: 050 General serials & their indexes
europeana:record.dc:description: Gustav Manteuffel (1832-1916) was a publicist, historian, ethnographer, folklorist and publisher. Influenced by the ideas of the Enlightment, he was committed to working for the people of his native region. Manteuffel’s most significant legacy is the calendar "Infļantu zemes zemes laika grõmota aba kalenders" (A Calendar for the Latgale region 1862–71). It is the first and the only 19th century publication in Latgalian written language, published on a regular basis and printed during the ban of printed Latgalian language. The publisher was awarded to pay a fine for that. It gained great favour among the people, and included lavish illustrations and extensive practical advice on farming, housekeeping and medicine. The calendar included enlightening anecdotes, riddles, proverbs, sayings poems and folk tales, which directly and indirectly urged the people to obtain education and knowledge.

Publicists, vēsturnieks, etnogrāfs, folklorists un izdevējs Gustavs Manteifelis (Manteuffel; 1832-1916) apgaismes ideju iespaidā par savas dzīves mērķi izvirzīja darbošanos dzimtās puses tautas labā. Manteifeļa nozīmīgākais devums ir viņa sastādītais un izdotais kalendārs „Infļantu zemes zemes laika grõmota aba kalenders” (1862-71). Tas ir pirmais un vienīgais regulāri iznākušais izdevums latgaliešu rakstu valodā 19. gs., kas iespiests drukas aizlieguma laikā. Izdevējs tāpēc maksāja sodu. Tautā populārajā, bagātīgi ilustrētajā izdevumā daudz praktisku padomu lauksaimniecībā, mājturībā un medicīnā. Kalendārā iekļautajiem stāstiņiem, mīklām, sakāmvārdiem, dzejoļiem un pasakām pamācošs raksturs, tiešāk un netiešāk mudinot skoloties un krāt zināšanas.

europeana:record.dc:title: Memoirs of my wretchedness
Jammers Minde
europeana:record.dc:creator: Leonora Christina Ulfeldt
europeana:record.dc:subject: 830 Literatures of Germanic languages;830 Literatures of Germanic languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Jammers Minde' ('Memoirs of my Wretchedness') is Christian IV's daughter, Leonora Christina's account of her 22-year imprisonment in The Blue Tower in Copenhagen from 1663-85. For nearly two hundred years the work remained unknown to the public until its publication in 1869, when it caused a well-deserved sensation. Her tales of degredation and suffering form one of the most impressive pieces of work from the Danish Baroque period. The work is teeming with realistic observations, sights, odours, sounds, often rendered with grotesque humour. Leonora’s ability to capture the looks and character of the people she is forced to be in contact with, has also preserved for posterity a number of often insignificant people. Her spirit and noble linguistic style lends brilliance to even the most sordid detailsand mark the book out as a Danish literary masterpiece. The Danish Literature Canon Committee has prepared the texts published in reprint from the Ministry of Culture’s magazine Kulturkontakten in January 2006. The English translation is by Vibeke Cranfield.

"Dersom man min Jammer veje kunde og mine Lidelser tilsammen i en Vægt Skaal lægge, da skulde de være tungere end Saand i Havet." Leonora Christine (1621-98). Jammers Minde er den titel, kongedatteren Leonora Christina valgte til skildringen af sit 22-årige fængselsophold i Blåtårn fra 1663-85. Titlen betyder: Erindringen om min elendighed. Værket er uden tvivl det mest respektindgydende værk, den danske baroktid har efterladt. Som menneskelig præstation er det enestående, at den fængslede kongedatter overhovedet overkommer at berette om og nedskrive de mange års lidelser og ydmygelser, skønt hun i sin fortale med rette overvejer, om det var klogere at skrive det hele i glemmebogen. Værket var igennem næsten to århundreder ukendt i offentligheden, indtil det ved sin offentliggørelse i 1869 vakte berettiget sensation. En helt uventet gave fra en fjern fortid.
Fængselsbiografien skildrer en ukueligt stærk og selvbevidst kvindes evne til at gennemlide, hvad der påføres hende, og dog ikke bukke under. Værket er myldrende fuldt af realistisk iagttagelse, syn, stank, lyde, ofte gengivet med sanselig væmmelse, men også med grotesk humor, som blot gør detaljerne endnu mere påtrængende. Leonoras evne til at fastholde udseende og karakter hos de mennesker, fængselsopholdet påtvinger hende berøring med, har for eftertiden opbevaret billeder af en række oftest betydningsløse mennesker, især en række kvinder, som ellers for evigt ville være forsvundet i tidens gang. Når denne temperamentsfuldt sansede og gennemlevede bog vokser til et litterært hovedværk, beror det ikke mindst på, at forfatterinden overkom at indfatte det hele i en yderst kunstfærdig og fornem sprogdragt, der kaster glans og elegance over selv de mest lurvede detaljer.
Kilde: Kanonudvalget for Litteratur. Udvalgets begrundelser for valg af tekster i Litteraturkanon er optrykt i et særnummer af Kulturministeriets magasinet Kulturkontakten januar 2006
europeana:record.dc:source: Society for Danish Language and Literature, partner of The Royal Library: The National Library of Denmark and Copenhagen University Library
Det Danske Sprog- og Litteraturselskab i samarbejde med Det Kongelige Bibliotek: Nationalbibliotek og Københavns Universitetsbibliotek

europeana:record.dc:title: Istoria slavianobolgarskaja from 1841, Baskioi copy
История славяноболгарская, Башкьойски препис от 1841 г.
europeana:record.dc:creator: monk Paisii from Hilandar
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books
europeana:record.dc:description: The handwritten copy of Istoria slavianobolgarskaja is made in 1841 by priest Vassilii Manuilov, born in the town of Sliven. Beside the text of Istoria, the manuscript contains two miracles of the Holy Mother. What makes it a curious exhibit however is the colophon, in which the book is named Carstvenik. The copyist, son of priest Emanuil, son of the protohiereus Stephan, represents himself, not unlike Paisii, as the compiler of the chronicle and points to the Hilandar Carstvenik of 1820 as his direct source. From the colophon it is also known that the work was completed in the colony of Bessarabian Bulgarians in “Bashkova that is Novo Kirsovo”. To the National Library the manuscript has come from Tulcea, Rumania.

Ръкописният препис на Царственика (История славяноболгарска, съставена от йеромонах Паисий Хилендарски) е направен през 1841 г. от йерей Василий Мануилов, роден в Сливен. Освен текста на Историята, паметникът съдържа две чудеса Богородични. Запазена бележката на книжовника, където ръкописът е наречен Царственик. Копистът, син на свещеника Емануил, син на Стефан протойерей, представя себе си като съставител на тази хроника и посочва прекия си източник – Хилендарския Царственик от 1820 г. От текста на колофона се разбира също, че книгата е изписана в колония на бесарабските българи „Башкова или ново Кирсово”. Ръкописът е постъпил в колекцията на Националната библиотека от Тулча, Румъния.
europeana:record.dc:source: St. Cyril and St. Methodius National Library
Natsionalna biblioteka Sv. Sv. Kiril i Metodii

europeana:record.dc:title: Convolute of 7 editions from the end of the 16th – beginning of the 17th c. №6. Primer. Ostrih, 1598
Конволют ХVІ-ХVІІ. № 6. Буквар. Острог, 1598
europeana:record.dc:creator: unknown
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books
europeana:record.dc:description: A defective copy of a primer, published in Ostrih in 1598. It is thematically related to the other items in the same convolute (№6 of 7 items bound together) and is important for its rarity alone as an early Slavonic cyrillic primer used in Ukrainian and Belorussian schools at the beginning of the 17th c.

Дефектен екземпляр от ранен славянски печатен буквар, издаден в Острог през 1598 г. (№ 6 от 7 издания, подвързани заедно). Книгата е ценна сама по себе си като учебно пособие, използвано в украинските и белоруски училища в началото на ХVІІ в.
europeana:record.dc:source: St. Cyril and St. Methodius National Library
Natsionalna biblioteka Sv. Sv. Kiril i Metodii

europeana:record.dc:title: Apostle Lectionary from the second half of the 13th c.
Изборен апостол от втората половина на ХІІІ в.
europeana:record.dc:creator: unknown
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books;220 Bible
europeana:record.dc:description: The Apostle Lectionary, written on parchment in the second half of the 13th century, is one of the important linguistic sources, delimiting the early (Preslav) from the later (Athonite) redaction of this liturgical book. The manuscript is remarkable with the completeness of the readings from the Deeds and Epistles and its detailed Menologion, which includes feasts of saints, otherwise occasionally mentioned, but very important for the mediaeval Bulgarian religious culture and history.

Изборният апостол, изписан на пергамент през втората половина на ХІІІ в., е един от важните паметници, които очертават езиковата граница между ранната преславска традиция и по-късната атонска редакция на този тип книга. Ръкописът се отличава с пълнотата на апостолските четива към съответните календарни дни и подробен синаксар, който включва рядко отразявани, но важни за българската културна история памети на светци. Колофон и по-късни приписки няма запазени.
europeana:record.dc:source: St. Cyril and St. Methodius National Library
Natsionalna biblioteka Sv. Sv. Kiril i Metodii

europeana:record.dc:title: Art and society
Kunst en samenleving
europeana:record.dc:creator: Walther Crane Gerrit Willem Dijsselhof
europeana:record.dc:subject: 740 Drawing & decorative arts
europeana:record.dc:description: "This book is hailed as one of the earliest manifestations of Modern Art in the Netherlands. Artist and art critic Jan Veth (1864-1925) translated Walter Crane’s influential English study 'The Claims of Decorative Art' (1892) in 1894 and a milestone in book design was born. The work was commissioned by Scheltema & Holkema’s Bookshop in Amsterdam. ‘Decorative artist’ Gerrit Willem Dijsselhof (1866-1924) adorned the publication with woodcut vignettes. One of the copies of this publication was coloured entirely by hand by Dijsselhof and is available to view digitally. The original work is donated to the Meermanno Museum. "

KB: 1310 F 3 [gedigitaliseerd exemplaar; origineel is geschonken aan Museum Meermanno] In 1894 verscheen met de Nederlandse vertaling Kunst en samenleving een van de vroegste manifestaties van de Nieuwe Kunst in Nederland. De oorspronkelijke titel luidde: The Claims of Decorative Art (1892). Kunstenaar en criticus Jan Veth (1864-1925) vertaalde de invloedrijke tekst van Walter Crane uit het Engels. 'Sierkunstenaar' Gerrit Willem Dijsselhof (1866-1924) voorzag de uitgave van vignetten in houtsnede. Deze mijlpaal in de vormgeving van het boek ontstond in 1893 in opdracht van Scheltema & Holkema's Boekhandel in Amsterdam. Een van de exemplaren van deze uitgave is door Dijsselhof zelf met de hand ingekleurd. Dit exemplaar is geheel gedigitaliseerd.
europeana:record.dc:source: Koninklijke Bibliotheek - National library of The Netherlands
Koninklijke Bibliotheek - Nationale biblibotheek van Nederland

europeana:record.dc:title: Count István Széchenyi’s Biography
Gróf Széchenyi István életrajza
europeana:record.dc:creator: Zichy Antal
europeana:record.dc:subject: Történelem;940 General history of Europe
europeana:record.dc:description: In the Hungarian Historical Biographies series, biographies of prominent personalities in Hungarian history were introduced by outstanding historians and politicians of the age. The series of monographs was published by the Hungarian History Association, launched in 1885 by the editor Sándor Szilágyi. Antal Zichy (1823-1898) was a politician, a writer and a member of the Hungarian Upper House, of the Kisfaludy Society and the Hungarian Academy of Sciences. A number of his pieces dealt with István Széchenyi: he published Széchenyi’s journalism, foreign travelogues, notes, his correspondence, speeches and diaries and even wrote his biography. István Széchenyi (1791-1860) was a politician and writer in the Reform Era and the Batthyány Government’s Minister of Transport and Labour. His intention was to use the experience he had gained in Western European countries in the service of reforming Hungary.
