As part of his efforts he founded the Hungarian Academy of Sciences, the National Casino and the Hungarian National Economic Association, introduced horse racing and made recommendations for making the Danube navigable, established steam shipping on Lake Balaton, contributed to the establishment of the Roller Mill and Trade Bank in Pest, and in 1842 he had an active part in concluding the contract for the construction of the Chain Bridge. Although Széchenyi strongly opposed Kossuth’s political direction and style, Kossuth called him the “Greatest Hungarian”.

A Magyar Történeti Életrajzok sorozatban, a magyar történelemben jeles szerepet játszó személyiségek életrajzait a kor kiváló történészei, politikusai mutatták be. A monográfia-sorozat a Magyar Történelmi Társulat kiadványa volt, amit 1885-ben Szilágyi Sándor szerkesztésével indítottak el. Zichy Antal (1823-1898) politikus, író, a magyar főrendiház, a Kisfaludy Társaság, és a Magyar Tudományos Akadémia tagja volt. Széchenyi Istvánnal több művében is foglalkozott, kiadta hírlapi cikkeit, külföldi útirajzait, és följegyzéseit, levelezését, beszédeit, naplóit és megírta életrajzát is. Széchenyi István (1791-1860) reformkori politikus, író, a Batthyány-kormány közlekedés- és közmunkaügyi minisztere volt. Az európai polgári államokban szerzett tapasztalatait Magyarország megreformálására kívánta hasznosítani. Megalapította a Magyar Tudományos Akadémiát, a Nemzeti Kaszinót, a Magyar Országos Gazdasági Egyesületet, meghonosította a lóversenyt, javaslatot tett a Duna hajózhatóvá tételére, létrehozta a balatoni gőzhajózást, részt vett a pesti Hengermalom és Kereskedelmi Bank megalapításában, 1842-ben tevékeny szerepe volt a Lánchíd megépítésére vonatkozó szerződés megkötésében. Kossuth őt nevezte a „legnagyobb magyar”-nak, annak ellenére, hogy Széchenyi élesen fellépett Kossuth politikai szereplésének irányával és stílusával szemben.

europeana:record.dc:title: Endre Ady collected poems
Ady Endre összes költeményei
europeana:record.dc:creator: Ady Endre
europeana:record.dc:subject: Magyar irodalom;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Endre Ady was the grandest and most inspiring figure of Hungarian poetry and the pioneer of 20th century modern literature, with the most individual voice of the period. Breaking the hegemony of popular-national verse, he broadened the literary scope of Hungarian lyrics to include symbolism and secession, while creating the modern Hungarian poetic speech by his peculiar poetics and use of language. He organized his poems written from the turn of the century until his death in cycles, bigger entities and volumes, creating a distinctive lyrical horizon of modern literature, which spans from his programmatic verse Gog and Magog till the poem The Salute to the Victor, composed shortly before his death. The main motifs of Ady’s poetry are the relationship of man and woman, the humanist thought, God-seeking, the crucial questions regarding the nation’s fate, political involvement culminating in the approval of the revolution and the modern artist’s feeling towards life.

Ady Endre a magyar költészet legnagyobb formátumú és máig inspiráló hatású géniusza, egyben a XX. századi irodalmi modernség úttörője és legegyénibb hangú képviselője. A népi-nemzeti versidom korábbi egyeduralmát föloldva a szimbolizmus, a szecesszió irányába tágította a magyar líra eszmekörét, miközben sajátos poétikájával és nyelvhasználatával megteremtette a modern magyar versbeszédet. A századfordulótól haláláig írott verseit sajátos ciklusokba, szerkezeti egységekbe, kötetekbe csoportosította, így rajzolva ki az irodalmi modernség sajátos, csak rá jellemző lírai horizontját, amely a Góg és Magóg fia vagyok én kezdetű programadó versétől a halála előtt írt Üdvözlet a győzőnek című fájdalmas verséig ér. Ady költészetének motívumait a férfi-nő kapcsolat, a humanista gondolat, az istenkeresés, a nemzeti sorskérdések, a forradalom igenléséig eljutó politikum, valamint a modern művész életérzés rajzolják körül. Rövid élete és terjedelmes – más műfajokra is kiterjedő – életműve a magyar irodalom egyik leginkább termékenyítő, inspiráló hatású műve.

europeana:record.dc:title: Anastasimatarion
Αναστασιματαριον
europeana:record.dc:creator: unknown
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books;780 Music;090 Manuscripts & rare books;780 Music
europeana:record.dc:description: Created in the 18th century, this manuscript contains the text with musical notation of the various compositions sung during the Sunday offices of the Orthodox Church. It is of great interest for the readers studying Byzantine Ecclesiastical music.

Възкресник НБКМ Гр. 61 Създаден през 18 в. ръкописът съдържа текст с музикална нотация на различни песнопения, предназначени за неделните служби на Православната църква. Паметникът представлява интерес за читатели, които се занимават с изучаване на Византийската църковна музика.
europeana:record.dc:source: SS Cyril and Methodius National Library
Natsionalna Biblioteca Sv. sv. Kiril i Metodii

europeana:record.dc:title: Serbian News from the governing city Vienna - 1816
Новине сербске - из царствујушћег града Виене - 1816
europeana:record.dc:creator: b.a.
europeana:record.dc:subject: 900 - History
europeana:record.dc:description: Serbian News from Vienna, the third Serbian newspaper has been edited by Dimitrije Davidovic and Dimitrije Frusic. All famous Serbian authors cooperated in these newspaper, and so did Vuk Karadzic since 1815.
Треће по реду српске новине, уређивали их Димитрије Давидовић и Димитрије Фрушић. Сарађивали су најпознатији српски писци, а од 1815. и Вук Караџић.

europeana:record.dc:title: Maria. The Ukrainian Novel
Marja : powieść ukraińska
europeana:record.dc:creator: Malczewski, Antoni (1793-1826)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Antoni Malczewski (1793-1826) is known for his only work, the poetic novel "Mary", which he wrote at the age of 32. Malczewski never achieved fame during his lifetime, dying in obscurity. It was only after his death that critics realized the originality of Mary, which - released in 1925 - was the first Polish narrative poem. Fascinated by Byron, Malczewski used complicated narration, an odd sequence of events, blanks, ambiguities and puzzles in his work. Both artists led scandalous lives and traveled through the southern Europe. The injury of an ankle, which Malczewski had sustained defending his lover's good name, destroyed the writer's military career; the injury returned and he could not participate in Napoleon's campaign against Russia in 1812. Affairs with married women ruined Malczewski's reputation. Disease only intensified his feeling of loneliness, which had a definite influence on the shape of the work by touching on aspects of death and the passing of time. "Mary" has fascinated a great number of readers with its somber and melancholic lyricism

Antoni Malczewski (1793-1826) zapamiętany został jako autor jednego dzieła. Powieść poetycką "Maria" stworzył w wieku 32 lat. Nie doczekał się za życia należnej sobie sławy – umarł opuszczony i schorowany. Dopiero po jego śmierci zwrócono uwagę na oryginalność jego dzieła. Wydana w 1925 roku "Maria" była pierwszą polską powieścią poetycką. Zafascynowany Byronem autor wprowadził do utworu powikłaną narrację, nieprzejrzysty układ zdarzeń oraz luki, niedomówienia i zagadki. Obaj artyści prowadzili burzliwe i pełne skandali życie, a także podróżowali po południu Europy. Rana kostki odniesiona w pojedynku o dobre imię kochanki przeszkodziła w rozwoju kariery wojskowej Malczewskiego. Kontuzja odnowiła się i autor "Marii" nie mógł wziąć udziału w kampanii Napoleona przeciw Rosji w 1812 roku. Romanse z zamężnymi kobietami sprowadziły na Malczewskiego społeczną infamię. Choroba spotęgowała poczucie osamotnienia, które miało niewątpliwy wpływ na kształt stworzonego dzieła. Wszystko w utworze Malczewskiego ciąży ku przemijaniu i śmierci. Posępny i melancholijny liryzm "Marii" zafascynował czytelników.

europeana:record.dc:title: Katinka from Quiet Lives
Ved Vejen fra Stille Eksistenser [Værker i mindeudgave. Herman Bang Bd.1]
europeana:record.dc:creator: Herman Bang
europeana:record.dc:subject: 830 Literatures of Germanic languages;830 Literatures of Germanic languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Herman Bang’s novel, 'Katinka' has become one of the most treasured works in Danish literature for its sensitive portrayal of a bygone provincial world. The novel focuses on the humdrum life of Katinka Bai, a station master's wife, who lives in a small village in Jutland. The arrival of a new bailiff sparks the beginnings of a romance but stuffy social conventions hamper their relationship. With its alternation between spoken and unspoken and its myriad of small, unheeded details, Bang shows how life is being lived in a remote corner far from the main roads of society. And he masters the art of relating this lonely, unheroic suffering to the lives of modern day readers. The Danish Literature Canon Committee has prepared the texts published in reprint from the Ministry of Culture’s magazine Kulturkontakten in January 2006. The English translation is by Vibeke Cranfield

“Og naar hun selv kom tilsengs og laa i Mørket ved Siden af Bai, der sov dybt, kunde hun ikke falde i Søvn og følte et Ubehag, saa hun stod op igen og gik ind i Stuen. Der sad hun saa ved Vinduet. Nattoget suste forbi, og den store Stilhed laa igen over Marken.” I en jysk flække lever den endnu unge Katinka Bai sit ensformige liv sammen med stationsforstanderen, en sat, middelmådig mand med hang til bordets glæder og et lille sidespring i ny og næ. Dagene afløser næsten ubemærket hinanden, mens togene passerer og årstiderne veksler, men en dag får den nærliggende proprietærgård ny forvalter. Langsomt vågner Katinka af den døsige trummerum, til at begynde med uden at forstå, hvad der er ved at ske, og hun oplever for første gang at være i dybere kontakt med et andet menneske. Men de sociale bånd og det indelukkede provinsmiljø kvæler den spæde kærlighed, og Ved Vejen bliver den melankolske beretning om et ensomt menneskes fortvivlelse og resignation.
Når Herman Bangs lille roman er blevet en af den danske litteraturs kæreste skatte, skyldes det ikke mindst hans nænsomme og indfølende skildring af et sagtmodigt sind, der kommer til bevidsthed om sig selv i mødet med følelser, hun ikke selv var klar over, at hun rummede. Med bittersød ironi lader Bang den evigt omsorgsfulde Katinka få færten af sin forelskelse ved at lægge øre til andres hjertesorger, og gennem skildringen af hendes følelsesskred blottes de øvrige personers indre liv i skarpt aftegnede glimt. Romanens knappe, nærmest filmiske sekvenser holder i hver eneste sætning balancen mellem underdrejet humor og totalt gehør for, hvad der rører sig i menneskers indre. Med sin vekslen mellem sagt og usagt og sit mylder af små, upåagtede detaljer viser Bang, hvordan livet leves i en afsides krog fjernt fra samfundets hovedveje. Men der er ikke kun tale om et lydhørt portræt af en svunden provinsverden, der virker så typisk dansk. Det er Bangs kunst at gøre den lille egoisme og den skjulte ensomheds uheroiske smerte genkendelige også for nutidige læsere.
Kilde: Kanonudvalget for Litteratur. Udvalgets begrundelser for valg af tekster i Litteraturkanon er optrykt i et særnummer af Kulturministeriets magasinet Kulturkontakten januar 2006
europeana:record.dc:source: Society for Danish Language and Literature, partner of The Royal Library: The National Library of Denmark and Copenhagen University Library
Det Danske Sprog- og Litteraturselskab i samarbejde med Det Kongelige Bibliotek: Nationalbibliotek og Københavns Universitetsbibliotek

europeana:record.dc:title: The Pastor of Vejlbye
Præsten i Vejlbye
europeana:record.dc:creator: Steen Steensen Blicher
europeana:record.dc:subject: 830 Literatures of Germanic languages;830 Literatures of Germanic languages
europeana:record.dc:description: A chilling and intense early example of Danish crime writing that follows the tale of a miscarriage of justice. A young, inexperienced district judge in East Jutland must sentence his future father-in-law to death, after he is falsely convicted of a crime. The terrible course of events is revealed through the judge's diary. The Danish Literature Canon Committee prepared the reprinted texts from the Ministry of Culture’s magazine Kulturkontakten in January 2006. The English translation is by Vibeke Cranfield.

"...saa jeg vel mærkede: at han kun havde været et blindt Redskab i Djævelens Haand." Dette er fortællingen om et justitsmord. En ung, uerfaren herredsfoged i Østjylland må dødsdømme sin tilkommende svigerfader, fortællingens titelperson, fordi han bringes til at fælde dommen på helt forfalskede præmisser. Igennem den unge herredsfogeds dagbog underrettes læseren dag for dag om begivenhedernes skrækkelige gang, som til sidst fremtvinger den uretfærdige dom og efterfølgende henrettelse. Men den juridisk og menneskeligt uerfarne dagbogsskriver er offer for et systematisk iværksat bedrageri, hvorved fortællingens hovedskurk, Morten Bruus, udøver sin nådesløse hævn imod præsten. Der er tale om en snedig iscenesættelse af falske anklager, hvis egentlige kilde den naive fortæller er ude af stand til at afsløre. Både herredsfogden, den dømte og den stakkels forlovede datter mener at være i kløerne på en rædsom skæbnemagt, indtil det mange år efter præstens henrettelse kommer for dagen, at det er menneskelig nederdrægtighed, der fra det skjulte har styret hele forløbet. En from kristelig gudshengivenhed afløses da – alt for sent – af en indsigt i den handlende ondskab, der styrer så meget.
Fortællingen, som er et meget tidligt eksempel på en dansk kriminalfortælling, er virtuost komponeret og den frygtelige pointe dygtigt skjult, fordi den troskyldige dagbogsskriver ikke har haft panisk fantasi nok til overhovedet at forestille sig det anslag, han og de andre er genstand for. Stilen lyser af elegisk smerte og uhyggeligt fortættet drama, og fortællingen er svær at ryste af sig.
Kilde: Kanonudvalget for Litteratur. Udvalgets begrundelser for valg af tekster i Litteraturkanon er optrykt i et særnummer af Kulturministeriets magasinet Kulturkontakten januar 2006
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Kbh.: Det Danske Sprog - og Litteraturselskab og Borgens forlag
europeana:record.dc:source: Society for Danish Language and Literature, partner of The Royal Library: The National Library of Denmark and Copenhagen University Library
Det Danske Sprog- og Litteraturselskab i samarbejde med Det Kongelige Bibliotek: Nationalbibliotek og Københavns Universitetsbibliotek

europeana:record.dc:title: The Little Mermaid
Den lille havfrue [ H.C. Andersens eventyr, kritisk udgivet efter de originale eventyrhæfter med varianter ved Erik Dal m. fl.]
europeana:record.dc:creator: Hans Christian Andersen
europeana:record.dc:subject: 830 Literatures of Germanic languages;830 Literatures of Germanic languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Renowned Danish author, Hans Christian Andersen's tale 'The Little Mermaid' is as endearing now as when it was first written. The mermaid can become part of “the celestial world”, if a human being loves her. The sea witch cuts her tongue out in return for helping her to get rid of the fish tail. The little mermaid then saves the prince but, as she can only speak to him with her eyes and movements, it is not possible for her to gain his love. She chooses not to become a mermaid again by killing the prince but instead becomes one of the daughters of the air, able to create an immortal soul by doing good deeds. It is going to take three hundred years, but well behaved children who listen to her story can cut short her tribulations. The fairytale is inspired by verbal folk literature and by contemporary writing. Undine' (1811), by German author Friedrich de la Motte Fouqué, is cited as the source for the mermaid’s longing for an immortal soul and her disintegration in the waves. The Danish Literature Canon Committee has prepared the texts published in reprint from the Ministry of Culture’s magazine Kulturkontakten in January 2006. The English translation is by Vibeke Cranfield.

“Jeg vilde give alle mine hundrede Aar, jeg har at leve i, for blot een Dag at være et Menneske og siden faae Deel i den himmelske Verden!” Den Lille Havfrue er i puberteten og tiltrukket af menneskenes verden. Hendes bedstemoder har fortalt hende, at havfolk lever tre hundrede år, hvorefter de bliver til skum på vandoverfladen. Mennesker, derimod, lever kort, men har en udødelig sjæl. Havfruen kan få del i “den himmelske Verden”, hvis et menneske elsker hende, men sønderlemmelsen er forudsætningen for prinsens kærlighed. Havheksen skærer hendes tunge ud som løn for at hjælpe hende af med fiskehalen. Den lille havfrue redder prinsen i stedet for at lokke ham ned i dybet, hvorfra hun kommer. Når hun kun kan tale til ham med øjne og bevægelser, kan hun dog ikke opnå hans kærlighed. Men som andre retfærdige hos Andersen får hun endnu en mulighed. Hun kan blive havfrue igen ved at dræbe prinsen. Hun vælger i stedet at kaste kniven i havet, og gennem dette definitive afkald bliver hun én af luftens døtre, der selv kan skabe sig en evig sjæl gennem gode gerninger. Det vil tage tre hundrede år, men de lyttende børn kan forkorte prøvelserne ved at opføre sig ordentligt i de familier, hvor historien læses op.
Eventyret er inspireret af mundtlig folkelitteratur og af samtidig digtning. Fra Undine (1811) af den tyske forfatter Friedrich de la Motte Fouqué er lånt havfruens længsel efter en udødelig sjæl og hendes opløsning i bølgerne.
Kilde: Kanonudvalget for Litteratur. Udvalgets begrundelser for valg af tekster i Litteraturkanon er optrykt i et særnummer af Kulturministeriets magasinet Kulturkontakten januar 2006
europeana:record.dc:source: Society for Danish Language and Literature, partner of The Royal Library: The National Library of Denmark and Copenhagen University Library
Det Danske Sprog- og Litteraturselskab i samarbejde med Det Kongelige Bibliotek: Nationalbibliotek og Københavns Universitetsbibliotek

europeana:record.dc:title: A.B.C. for soldiers on leave
europeana:record.dc:creator: Max Lowland pseud. van Max Schuchart
europeana:record.dc:subject: 940 General history of Europe
europeana:record.dc:description: ‘A.B.C. for Soldiers on Leave’ was printed specifically for the allied soldiers. It especially appealed to the Canadians who could not return home straight away due to limited space on ships. Each letter is designed to help the soldiers interact with the Dutch population. They're accompanied by handwritten texts in rhyme, and caricatures in black and white, or red and bronze. Several subjects were covered including Amsterdam, allied soldiers and Dutch women, Hitler and beverages in order to help the men communicate with the locals.

KB: 2299 F 33
Een groot deel van de Canadese soldaten kan niet direct terugkeren naar huis vanwege een gebrek aan scheepsruimte. In de tussentijd leggen ze contact met de Nederlandse bevolking. 'A.B.C. for soldiers on leave' is speciaal gedrukt voor de geallieerde soldaten. Bij elke letter staan rijmende teksten in handschrift en karikaturale tekeningen in zwart-wit of met rood en bronskleur. Op deze manier kunnen ze met de Nederlandse bevolking communiceren. Verschillende onderwerpen komen aan bod: Amsterdam, geallieerde soldaten en Nederlandse vrouwen, Hitler en drank.
europeana:record.dc:source: Koninklijke Bibibliotheek - National library of The Netherlands
Koninklijke Bibibliotheek - Nationale bibliotheek van Nederland

europeana:record.dc:title: The Fall of the King [manuscript rough draft ]
Kongens fald [manuskriptudkast]
europeana:record.dc:creator: Johannes V. Jensen
europeana:record.dc:subject: 830 Literatures of Germanic languages;830 Literatures of Germanic languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Danish novel, 'The Fall of the King' depicts the events leading up to the Massacre of Stockholm in 1520. The action plays out through the eyes of an educated villager and soldier who becomes the King, Christian the Second's, confidante. The book is hailed as a brutal and harsh but poetic example of an early modernistic novel. The Danish Literature Canon Committee has prepared reprinted texts from the Ministry of Culture’s magazine Kulturkontakten in January 2006. The English translation is by Vibeke Cranfield.

“Stille var der i Stokholms By. Kun Hovslag lød gennem Gaderne, naar Ryttertroppe jog rundt for at paase, at alle Døre holdtes lukkede.” Sådan lyder optakten til de kapitler, der i Kongens Fald skildrer blodbadet i Stockholm i året 1520. Kongen er Christian den 2., men han er ikke den centrale skikkelse i romanen, det er Mikkel Thøgersen, en falleret, rodløs bondestudent.
Mikkel bliver soldat, og han kommer efterhånden tættere og tættere på kongen, og jo tættere han kommer, desto værre går det denne. Mikkel er med kongen i Stockholm og med ham i hans fængsel på Sønderborg Slot. Inden kongen ender dér, følges hans forvirrede, vægelsindede sejlads frem og tilbage over Lillebælt, under hans “Fortvivlelses Nat”: “Da Solen kom, var han (dvs. kongen) paa Fynssiden, og der blev han, fordi han tilfældigvis var der”, hedder det. Til slut sidder kongen og Mikkel sammen i fængslet på Sønderborg Slot.
Mikkel skader i løbet af sit liv mange andre bl.a. Axel, “den letsindede”, der dør dansk digtnings smukkeste død en nat, da “Himlen var som hvide Roser”. I et af de afsluttende kapitler synger jættepigerne Fenja og Menja om alt det, de maler menneskene, mens de trækker deres kværn i Nordpolsnatten. Fenja vil male: “Solopgang og Høveder og frodige Agre, skinnende Skyer og Grøderegn, Kløver og gule og hvide Blomster”, mens hendes søster Menja vil male afsvedne: “Marker, Vandløshed og Mørke, Lyn og ulmende Tomter”. Kongens Fald er på mange måder en brutal, barsk fortælling, men den er tillige en lyrisk og en tidlig modernistisk roman. Sprogligt er den et umådeligt rigt, strømmende digterværk.
Kilde: Kanonudvalget for Litteratur. Udvalgets begrundelser for valg af tekster i Litteraturkanon er optrykt i et særnummer af Kulturministeriets magasinet Kulturkontakten januar 2006
europeana:record.dc:source: The Royal Library: The National Library of Denmark and Copenhagen University Library
Det Kongelige Bibliotek: Nationalbibliotek og Københavns Universitetsbibliotek

europeana:record.dc:title: Manuscript atlas by Battista Agnese
Atlas de Battista Agnese
europeana:record.dc:creator: Agnese, Battista (m. 1564)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Geografía e historia
europeana:record.dc:description: Decorated with gold strokes. Battista Agnese was an Italian cartographer who worked in Venice between the years 1536 and 1564, and one of the most important figures in Renaissance cartography. Throughout his life he created almost one hundred manuscript atlases, of which more than seventy have been conserved that are signed by him or can be attributed to his school. His atlases are considered as works of art for their perfection and beauty.

Decorado con trazos en oro. Battista Agnese fue un cartógrafo italiano que trabajó en Venecia entre los años 1536 y 1564 y una de las figuras más importantes de la cartografía renacentista. Realizó, a lo largo de su vida, cerca de cien atlas manuscritos, de los que se conservan más de setenta firmados por él o que pueden atribuirse a su escuela. Sus atlas están considerados como obras de arte por su perfección y belleza.

europeana:record.dc:title: Either/Or [manuscript]
Enten - eller [manuskript]
europeana:record.dc:creator: Søren Kierkegaard
europeana:record.dc:subject: 830 Literatures of Germanic languages;830 Literatures of Germanic languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Danish writer, Kierkegaard displays his literary brilliance in his novel, 'Either/Or', which explores the differences between forms of existence and expression. The novel is divided in to two sections. The first is from the perspective of an idling aesthetic, who recklessly cultivates the pleasures of the moment. The second part is from the perspective of an ethicist, who tries to persuade the hedonist that the individual life is lived most completely within social obligations. The texts introduce the reader to different forms of existence and their existential obligations through a variety of literary mediums including, dissertations, diarys and letters. The Danish Literature Canon Committee has prepared the texts published in reprint from the Ministry of Culture’s magazine Kulturkontakten in January 2006. The English translation is by Vibeke Cranfield.

"Dog, den der spotter Andre, han spotter sig selv, og det er ikke for Intet, men en dyb Spot over Dig, et sørgeligt Beviis paa, hvor ledeløs Din Sjæl er, at Din Livsanskuelse concentrerer sig i een eneste Sætning ‘jeg siger bare enten – eller’." Opsangen til A – den flanerende æstetiker, der uforpligtet dyrker øjeblikkets nydelse – kommer fra etikeren B. Han er en lidt grå embedsmand, som søger at få A til at indse, at det individuelle liv leves mest fuldkomment i sociale forpligtelser. Samtalen mellem forføreren A og ægtemanden B drejer sig om kærlighed. Enten – Eller er komponeret, således at A’s papirer udgør første del og B’s papirer anden del. I første del skaber æstetikeren sit liv og sine forhold som et kunstværk, idet han bruger tilfældet som redskab og søger at undgå forpligtende valg. I anden del søger B at påvirke ham til at vælge mellem det æstetiske og det etiske. Læseren konfronteres med tekster, som ikke blot argumenterer for eksistensformer, men som modstiller disse gennem forskelle i sprogføring og genre. A’s papirer omfatter således aforismer, akademiske afhandlinger og sluttes af med ‘Forførerens Dagbog’ – en sprudlende prosa, der kontrasteres med B’s lange personlige breve, som er præget af embedsmandens professionelle sans for problemudredning.
Etikeren hævder, at det ikke først og fremmest er vigtigt, hvad man vælger, men måden at forholde sig til valget på, altså den eksistentielle forpligtelse, som er forbundet med det. Videre hævder B, at mennesket føder sig selv som fri ånd ved at vælge sig selv.
Kierkegaards forfatterskab ligger i svøb i Enten – Ellers spænding mellem eksistens- og udtryksformer, som her fastholdes i en dristig prosakomposition.
Kilde: Kanonudvalget for Litteratur. Udvalgets begrundelser for valg af tekster i Litteraturkanon er optrykt i et særnummer af Kulturministeriets magasinet Kulturkontakten januar 2006
europeana:record.dc:source: The Royal Library: The National Library of Denmark and Copenhagen University Library
Det Kongelige Bibliotek: Nationalbibliotek og Københavns Universitetsbibliotek

europeana:record.dc:title: Complete Works by Guram Rcheulishvili, Vol. 2
თხზულებათა სრული კრებული ტომი II
europeana:record.dc:creator: Rcheulishvili, Guram
europeana:record.dc:description: Guram Rcheulishvili's first stories brought him a big success. In writer’s life, only few of his works were published. His collected works “Salamura” were published after his death, in 1961. Rcheulishvili’s prose attracted readers by its style, dialogues and ideas. At the age of 26, he died in Gagra on 23 August 1960, when saving an unknown Russian girl in a rough sea.
europeana:record.dc:source: The National Parliamentary Library of Georgia

europeana:record.dc:title: Voyages of Cristopher Columbus
Viajes de Cristóbal Colón
europeana:record.dc:creator: Casas, Bartolomé de las
europeana:record.dc:subject: Historia de América
europeana:record.dc:description: The original diaries of Columbus' four voyages were lost but the events have been reconstructed, in part thanks to other documents. Two extracts written by Brother Bartolomé de las Casas have been conserved from the first journey. This is one of them. But the Dominican friar did not use the original document, which was in the royal archive, nor is it certain that he wrote the summary himself; rather it seems that he used an already abbreviated text. The other extract is included in the Historia de las Indias (History of the Indies) by De las Casas himself, which is also stored in our Biblioteca Nacional and was drawn up based on the first summary and the biography of Columbus, written by his son Hernando. The diary of the second voyage has been reconstructed, as far as possible, from the stories of the Dominican friar and Columbus' son, as both consulted the Admirals document. For the third voyage, the two authors used the lost diary and the account written to the king and queen by Columbus, from Hispaniola.

Los diarios originales de los cuatro viajes colombinos se han perdido, pero los hechos se han podido reconstruir en parte gracias a otros documentos. Del primer viaje se conservan dos extractos escritos por fray Bartolomé de las Casas. Uno de ellos es este. Pero el dominico no utilizó el documento original, que estaba en los archivos reales, ni es seguro que el resumen lo hiciera él mismo; más bien parece que utilizara un texto ya abreviado. El otro extracto está incluido en la Historia de las Indias del propio De las Casas, que también guarda nuestra Biblioteca Nacional, y fue elaborado en base al primer resumen y a la biografía de Colón que escribió su hijo Hernando. El diario del segundo viaje se ha reconstruido, en la medida de lo posible, mediante las historias del dominico y del hijo de Colón, ya que ambos consultaron el escrito del almirante. Para el tercer viaje, los dos autores utilizaron el diario perdido y la relación que escribió Colón a los reyes, desde La Española.

europeana:record.dc:title: Collected Works by Ilia Chavchavadze, Vol. 4
თხზულებანი -IV ტომი
europeana:record.dc:creator: Chavchavadze, Ilia
europeana:record.dc:description: Prince Ilia Chavchavadze (8 November [O.S. 27 October] 1837 – 12 September [O.S. 30 August] 1907) was a Georgian writer, poet, journalist and lawyer who spearheaded the revival of the Georgian national movement in the second half of the 19th century, during the Russian rule of Georgia. Today he is widely regarded as one of the founding fathers of modern Georgia. In 1987 he was canonized as Saint Ilia the Righteous by the Georgian Orthodox Church. Inspired by the contemporary liberal movements in Europe, as a writer and a public figure, Ilia Chavchavadze directed much of his efforts toward awakening national ideals in Georgians and to the creation of a stable society in his homeland. His most important literary works were: The Hermit, The Ghost, Otaraant Widow, Kako The Robber and Is He Human, This "Man"?. Chavchavadze was fatally wounded by a gang of assassins. His legacy earned him the broad admiration of the Georgian people.
europeana:record.dc:source: The National Parliamentary Library of Georgia

europeana:record.dc:title: Complete Works by Guram Rcheulishvili, Vol. 1
თხზულებათა სრული კრებული ტომი I
europeana:record.dc:creator: Rcheulishvili, Guram
europeana:record.dc:description: Guram Rcheulishvili's first stories brought him a big success. In writer’s life, only few of his works were published. His collected works “Salamura” were published after his death, in 1961. Rcheulishvili’s prose attracted readers by its style, dialogues and ideas. At the age of 26, he died in Gagra on 23 August 1960, when saving an unknown Russian girl in a rough sea.
europeana:record.dc:source: The National Parliamentary Library of Georgia

europeana:record.dc:title: In My Happy Youth and Other Short Stories
Boldogult úrfikoromban és más elbeszélések
europeana:record.dc:creator: Krúdy Gyula
europeana:record.dc:subject: Magyar irodalom;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: The time after the end of the 1920s is considered to be the last, much disputed creative phase of Krúdy. He abandoned the depiction blurring dream and reality for a much clearer realism, manifested in the meticulous description of ordinary life. In 1929, his most exceptional novel, In My Happy Youth appeared, and he wrote some short stories as well. In these short stories nothing extraordinary happens; in fact, hardly anything happens at all. Yet through them Krúdy tackles the fundamental questions of life an death, usually facing decease with conviviality. The voice of these writings is characterised by serenity, humour, soft irony and love of life transcending all that is dramatic and tragical. The once colourful, ornate style typical of Krúdy became unadorned. After the mannerist romanticism of his previous phase, in these stories he reached a real romanticism, with a more intimate, realistic depiction.

Az 1920-as évek legvégétől számítja az irodalomtörténet Krúdy utolsó, sokat vitatott alkotói korszakát. Az álom és valóság határán mozgó ábrázolást ekkoriban világosabban realista színezetű hang váltotta fel, amely a mindennapi események rendkívül részletező feltárásában nyilvánult meg. 1929-ben jelent meg talán legkülönösebb, legrendhagyóbb regénye, a Boldogult úrfikoromban, és ez az utolsó korszak hozta azokat a novelláit is, amelyekkel szemben leginkább tanácstalan a kritika és olvasói értékelés. Való igaz, e művekben nem történik semmi rendhagyó. Sőt, alig is történik bennük valami. Egy úr kispörköltet fogyaszt. Egy férj kimarad néhány napig, kocsmáról kocsmára járva ünneplik egy öreg barátjuk születésnapját. Egy beteg, kivénült alkoholista mereng az elmúlásról és annak különös jeleiről, előjeleiről. Ezekben a történetekben azonban az élet és a halál alapkérdéseivel foglalkozik az író, kedélyes keretek között szembesülve az elmúlással. A sorok között bujkáló humor, a szelíd irónia és a minden drámait, sőt tragikust legyőző életszeretet és derű jellemzik e művek hangnemét. Lecsupaszult e művekben a valaha oly sokszínű, sokhúrú Krúdy-stílus is. Korábbi korszaka modoros romantikájától itt érkezett igazabb regényességhez, a modorosságtól egy bensőségesebb, realistább igényű ábrázoláshoz.

europeana:record.dc:title: Heinrich Pestalozzi, the Swiss friend of youth and educator: his life in story form for young people
Heinrich Pestalozzi, der schweizerische Jugendfreund und Volksbildner : ein Lebensbild in Form einer Erzählung für Jugend und Volk
europeana:record.dc:creator: Roth, Richard
europeana:record.dc:subject: Education
europeana:record.dc:description: Roth's laudatory presentation demonstrated that Pestalozzi (after whom many schoolhouses in Switzerland are named) was highly respected outside the national borders
La présentation élogieuse de Roth démontre que Pestalozzi, dont de nombreuses écoles en Suisse portent le nom, était hautement considéré au-delà des frontières helvétiques
Roths rühmende Darstellung belegt, dass Pestalozzi, nach dem in der Schweiz zahlreiche Schulhäuser benannt sind, über die Landesgrenzen hinaus hoch geachtet war

europeana:record.dc:title: Commentary on the Apocalypse
Beato de Liébana: códice de Fernando I y Dña. Sancha
europeana:record.dc:creator: Beato de Liébana, Santo
europeana:record.dc:subject: Biblia
europeana:record.dc:description: Written in 1047 by Facundo for King Ferdinand I and Queen Sancha of Castile and León, it contains comments on the Apocalypse made by the monk Beatus, in the district of Liébana (Santander) and is illustrated with some 100 Mozarabic miniatures, many of which are full page and several are double page. They have great visual expressiveness and technical ability and evidence of Romanesque, Mozarabic and North African influences. Highlights include the miniature of the Four Horsemen, the vision of celestial Jerusalem, the seven-headed serpent and the destruction of Babylon. In was held in the private collection of the Marquis of Mondéjar since the 17th century, until it was requisitioned along with the rest of his library by Philip V during the War of Succession, thus passing to the Royal Library, precursor of the Biblioteca Nacional de España.

Escrito en 1047 por Facundo para los reyes Fernando I y Sancha de Castilla y León , contiene los comentarios al Apocalipsis realizados por el monje Beato, en la comarca de la Liébana (Santander) y está ilustrado con unas 100 miniaturas mozárabes, muchas de ellas a pagina entera y a varias en doble página, de gran expresividad visual y habilidad técnica, con influencias románicas, mozárabes y norteafricanas. Destacan las de los Cuatro Jinetes, la visión de la Jerusalén celestial, la serpiente de las siete cabezas o la destrucción de Babilonia. En poder del marqués de Mondéjar desde el siglo XVII, fue requisado junto con el resto de su biblioteca por Felipe V en la guerra de Sucesión, pasando así a la Biblioteca Real, germen de la Biblioteca Nacional.

europeana:record.dc:title: Book of hours of King Charles VIII of France (1494-96)
Libro de horas de Carlos VIII, Rey de Francia
europeana:record.dc:subject: Religión
europeana:record.dc:description: It seems that Louis XIII delivered the codex to a Spaniard, ambassador to France or confessor of Queen Anne. Afterwards it belonged to the Count of Peñaranda and the Marquis of Mejorada, joining the Biblioteca Nacional in 1708. A work of extraordinary interest, made for Charles VIII in the Parisian workshop of Antonio Verard, whose portrait appears on p. 112r., and his anagram on p. 112v. It has 16 full page miniatures and the same number of half page miniatures, as well as other smaller ones that illustrate the calendars and borders of all the pages. Especially noteworthy is the page that represents Louis XII at prayer and, on foot behind him, Charlesmagne; the head of Louis XII replaces that of Charles VIII, who originally figured in the composition (p. 13v).

Al parecer, Luis XIII entregó el códice a un personaje español, embajador de Francia o confesor de la reina Ana. Después perteneció al Conde de Peñaranda y al Marqués de Mejorada, pasando a la Biblioteca Nacional en 1708 . Obra de extraordinario interés hecha para Carlos VIII en el taller parisino de Antonio Verard, cuyo retrato figura en h. 112r., y su anagrama en h. 112v. Tiene 16 miniaturas a página entera y otras tantas a media página, además de otras más pequeñas que ilustran el calendario y las orlas de todas las hojas. Destaca la que representa a Luis XII en oración, y detrás de él, en pie, Carlomagno; la cabeza de Luis XII sustituye a la de Carlos VIII, que originariamente figuraba en la composición (h. 13v).

europeana:record.dc:title: Dialogue on language
Diálogo de la lengua
europeana:record.dc:creator: Valdés, Juan de (ca. 1509-1542)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Filología
europeana:record.dc:description: It contains the Diálogo de la lengua (Dialogue on Language) by Juan de Valdés, written in Naples between 1535 and 1536. Only another two manuscripts of the work are known; one is conserved in the Real Biblioteca de El Escorial (Royal Library of El Escorial) and the other in the library of the British Museum in London. Of these, this is the oldest and most complete of the works and the other two could be copies of it. Juan de Valdés is one of the most genuine representatives of the Spanish Renaissance. In 1529 he had published in Alcalá his Christian doctrine, which could be defined as an Erasmist catechism and it earned him being accused for signs of heterodoxy. For fear of the intervention of the Inquisition, Valdés left Spain to settle in Italy and was one of those who introduced reformist ideas there.

Contiene el Diálogo de la lengua de Juan de Valdés, compuesto en Nápoles entre 1535 y 1536. Se conocen sólo otros dos manuscritos de la obra, uno conservado en la Real Biblioteca de El Escorial, y el otro en la biblioteca del British Museum de Londres. De ellos, éste, es el más antiguo y el más completo, y de él podrían ser copia los otros dos. Juan de Valdés es uno de los representantes más genuinos del Renacimiento español. En 1529 había publicado en Alcalá su Doctrina cristiana, que podría definirse como un catecismo erasmista y que le valió una denuncia por indicios de heterodoxia. Por temor a la intervención de la Inquisición, Valdés salió de España para asentarse en Italia, siendo uno de los introductores de las ideas reformistas allí.

europeana:record.dc:title: Castilian grammar
Gramática castellana
europeana:record.dc:creator: Nebrija, Antonio de (1444-1522)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Filología
europeana:record.dc:description: It is the first grammar of the Castilian language and also the first grammar of a vernacular language printed in Europe, at a time when Castilian was not yet considered as a "language of culture". Nebrija was ahead of his time and, after publishing the Introductiones latinae, he came to the conclusion that it was necessary to study Castilian Spanish in order to learn Latin, as by setting its rules, it would avoid the natural process of corruption distancing it more from this language. The work is divided into five books: "Orthography", "Prose", "Etymology", "Syntax" and "Introduction to the Castilian language for those who from a foreign language want to learn". Red and black ink were used in the text, printed with Gothic fonts, and the blank space for the initial letters can be observed.

Es la primera gramática del castellano y también la primera gramática de una lengua vulgar que se imprime en Europa, en una época en la que todavía no se consideraba el castellano como «lengua de cultura». Nebrija se adelanta a su época y, después de haber publicado las 'Introductiones latinae', llega a la conclusión de que es necesario aprender el castellano para estudiar el latín, pues, al fijarse sus reglas, se evitaría que el proceso natural de corrupción lo alejara más de éste. La obra está dividida en cinco libros: «Ortografía», «Prosodia», «Etimología», «Sintaxis» e «Introducciones de la lengua castellana para los que de extraña lengua querrán deprender». En el texto, impreso con tipos góticos, se han utilizado tintas roja y negra y puede observarse el hueco en blanco para las iniciales.

europeana:record.dc:title: Alfonsine tables (h. 1-22v). Liber de sphera by Johannis de Lineriis (h. 23-48v)
Tabule Alfonsi (h. 1-22v). Tabule magristri Johannis de Lineriis (h. 23-48v)
europeana:record.dc:creator: Giovanni da Legnano. Liber de sphera
europeana:record.dc:subject: Astronomía
europeana:record.dc:description: A reflection of the knowledge of astronomy at the time, these tables were composed by Isaac ben Sid and Judah ben Moses between 1263 and 1272 when the Ptolemaic system prevailed and two centuries before the heliocentric planetary system was established by Copernicus, who personally studied and annotated the Tables. It was the only Alfonsine astrological work to reach the press during the Renaissance. It was first published in Venice in 1483. It is a set of astronomical tables that follow the legacy of Arzachel's Tables of Toledo. Originally from Toledo Cathedral, it belonged to Cardinal Zelada in Italy and was brought to Spain by Cardinal Lorenzana at the end of the 18th century.

Reflejo del saber de astronomía de la época, estas tablas fueron compuestas por Isaac ben Sid y Judah ben Moses entre 1263 y 1272, cuando imperaba el sistema ptolemaico y aún faltaban dos siglos para el sistema planetario heliocéntrico establecido por Copérnico, quien estudió y anotó personalmente las Tablas. Fue la única obra astrológica alfonsí que llegó a la imprenta en el Renacimiento. Se editó por primera vez en Venecia, en 1483. Se trata de un conjunto de tablas astronómicas que siguen la herencia de las Tablas de Toledo de Azarquiel Procede de la catedral de Toledo. Fue propiedad del cardenal Zelada en Italia, y traído por el cardenal Lorenzana a fines del siglo XVIII.

europeana:record.dc:title: Etymologies
Etymologiae
europeana:record.dc:creator: Isidoro, Santo, Arzobispo de Sevilla
europeana:record.dc:subject: Historia de la ciencia
europeana:record.dc:description: An important work of Visigothic writing from the Toledo Cathedral, with notes and correspondence in Arabic words, italics. Several pages formed by parchment cut outs, roughly out together. It contains a world map with Arabic writing on p. 116v and coloured geometric figures and titles, epigraph, initials and capitals in red and green.

Importante obra en escritura visigótica, procedente de la catedral de Toledo, con notas y correspondencia de vocablos árabes, cursivas. Varias hojas formadas de recortes de pergamino, toscamente elaborado. Contiene Mapamundi con escritura árabe en h. 116v y Figuras geométricas en color y títulos, epígrafes, iniciales y capitales en rojo y verde.

europeana:record.dc:title: The twenty-one books of devices and machines
Los veintiún libros de los ingenios y de las máquinas
europeana:record.dc:creator: Lastanosa, Pedro Juan de (m. 1576)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Ingeniería mecánica
europeana:record.dc:description: This manuscript, a copy of an original lost in the 16th century, is one of the most important scientific codices and the first treatise on hydraulic works in Spanish. It was attributed to Juanelo Turriano, "mechanic to Charles V and Philip II, author of complex watch systems and large elevations of water with strange devices" but this was put in doubt by the first researchers on the manuscript in the 18th century. By analysing the language used and the geographical references, it was considered to be the work of an author from Aragon and Nicolás García Tapia attributes it to Pedro Juan de Lastanosa, who was "engineer to Philip II". The four hundred and forty high-quality, immensely detailed drawings complement the precise description of the technical processes. The machines and devices are accompanied by their exploded views, which enable the details of their functioning to be observed.

Este manuscrito, copia de un original perdido del siglo XVI, es uno de los códices científicos más importantes y el primer tratado en español sobre obras hidráulicas. La atribución a Juanelo Turriano, «mecánico de Carlos V y Felipe II autor de complejos sistemas de relojes y de grandes elevaciones de aguas con extraños artificios» ya fue puesta en duda por los primeros investigadores del manuscrito en el siglo XVIII. Mediante el análisis del lenguaje utilizado y las referencias geográficas se pensó en un autor aragonés, y Nicolás García Tapia lo atribuye a Pedro Juan de Lastanosa, que fue «maquinario de Felipe II» Los cuatrocientos cuarenta dibujos, de muy buena calidad y gran minuciosidad, complementan la precisa descripción de los procesos técnicos. Las máquinas e ingenios van acompañados de su despiece, lo que permite apreciar los detalles de su funcionamiento.

europeana:record.dc:title: Introduction to latin
Introductiones latinae
europeana:record.dc:creator: Nebrija, Antonio de (1444-1522)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Filología
europeana:record.dc:description: Written and lavishly illustrated for the master of Alcántara Juan de Zúñiga, son of the second Count of Plasencia, with side notes in the first part, in different handwriting. On p. 1, is a full page miniature that represents the Master and other people listening to explanations by the author. On p. 2, a border with the Zúñiga coat of arms held by naked children. Capital letters in burnished gold and grey ink. The illuminator might have belonged to the workshop of Juan de Carrión, one of the most important workshops in Castile in the second half of the century.

Escrito y miniado para el maestre de Alcántara D. Juan de Zúñiga, hijo del segundo Conde de Plasencia, con Notas marginales en la primera parte, de distinta letra. En h. 1, miniatura a página entera que representa al Maestre y a otras personas oyendo las explicaciones del autor. En h. 2, orla con el escudo de Zúñiga sostenido por niños desnudos. Capitales en oro bruñido y tinta gris. El iluminador pudiera pertenecer al taller de Juan de Carrión, uno de los más importantes del ámbito castellano en la segunda mitad del siglo.

europeana:record.dc:title: Chasoslovets
Часословец
europeana:record.dc:creator: Jacob Kraikov
europeana:record.dc:subject: 230 Christian theology;090 Manuscripts & rare books
europeana:record.dc:description: "Chasoslovets" is a work of the first Bulgarian printer Jacov (Jacob) Kraikov. This is the first book, that he has printed in the biggest Slavic printing-house in Venice, which he rented in 1566. This collection of prayers, eulogies, saints’ vitaes and apocrypha successfully functioned as a daily handbook for priests on the one hand, while on the other it satisfy the ordinary reader’s need of knowledge and enlightenment. The selection of font, typing, paging and the rich artful decoration (more than 30 engravings) are evidence of the typographic proficiency of Jacob Kraikov. Today, Jacob's edition is a bibliographical rarity. Copies of this book are kept in several European libraries – the Vatican Library, the British Library, the Ecclesiastical Museum (Belgrade), the Matica srbska (Novi Sad) etc. In Bulgaria copies of "Chasoslovets" are owned by the National Library in Sofia, the Ivan Vazov National Regional Library in Plovdiv and the National Historical Museum.

„Часословец” е дело на първия български печатар Яков Крайков. Това е първата книга, която той отпечатва в наетата от него през 1566 г. най-голяма славянска кирилска печатница за сърби и българи във Венеция. Със своето съдържание (всекидневни молитви, сказания и жития, свързани с годишните празници и др.) тя успешно изпълнява функцията на всекидневно пособие за свещениците от една страна, а от друга – задоволява нуждата на обикновения читател от знания и просвещение. Подборът на шрифта, наборът на текста и неговото страниране, както и богатата художествена украса (повече от 30 гравюри) в „Часословец”-а са доказателство за типографската опитност на Яков Крайков. Днес Якововото издание е библиографска рядкост. Екземпляри от него се съхраняват в няколко европейски библиотеки – РНБ (Санкт Петербург), Библиотеката на Ватикана, Библиотеката на Британския музей (Лондон), Църковния музей (Белград), Матица србска (Нови Сад ) и др. В България екземпляри от „Часословец”-а са притежание на Националната библиотека” Св.св. Кирил и Методий” (София), Народната библиотека „Ив. Вазов” (Пловдив) и Националния исторически музей.
europeana:record.dc:source: SS Cyril and Methodius National Library.
Natsionalna biblioteka Sv.sv. Kiril i Metodii

europeana:record.dc:title: De materia medica
Pedacio Dioscorides anazarbeo, Acerca de la materia medicinal y de los venenos mortiferos
europeana:record.dc:creator: Dioscórides
europeana:record.dc:subject: Materia médica
europeana:record.dc:description: Dioscorides, a 1st century Greek doctor, wrote a treatise on pharmaceutical botany. Translated into Arabic in the 10th century under Abderramán III, and later into Latin in the Toledo Translation School, the first edition in Latin was by Antonio de Nebrija in 1518. In Antwerp in 1555, the publisher Juan Latio published this translation into Castilian by the doctor Andrés Laguna, physician to Pope Julius III, who, during his trips to Rome, could consult different codices. The work continued to be published until the mid-18th century. For this edition Laguna added drawings designed by himself, engraved in wood into the fibre. In total there are more than six hundred images of plants and animals. Their names are given in several languages. This copy, of high technical quality, was printed on vellum and illuminated in order to make a gift of it to Philip II, who was then still a Prince.

Dioscórides, médico griego del siglo I, escribió un tratado de botánica farmacéutica. Traducida al árabe en el siglo X, bajo Abderramán III y más tarde al latín en la Escuela de Traductores de Toledo, la primera impresión en latín fue la de Antonio de Nebrija, en 1518. El editor Juan Latio publica en Amberes en 1555 esta traducción en castellano, realizada por el doctor Andrés Laguna, médico del papa Julio III, quien, en sus viajes a Roma, pudo consultar diversos códices. La obra continuó editándose hasta mediados del XVIII. Laguna añadió para esta edición dibujos diseñados por él mismo, grabados en madera a la fibra. Son en total más de seiscientas imágenes de plantas y animales. Se indican los nombres en varias lenguas. Este ejemplar, de gran calidad técnica, se imprimió en vitela y se iluminó para regalárselo a Felipe II, todavía príncipe.
europeana:record.dc:publisher: En Anuers en casa de Iuan Latio

europeana:record.dc:title: Martyrdom of the Holy Queen Shushanik
წამებაჲ წმიდისა შუშანიკისი დედოფლისაჲ
europeana:record.dc:creator: Tsurtaveli, Jacob
europeana:record.dc:description:
The Martyrdom of the Holy Queen Shushanik is the first extant piece of Georgian literature. Purported to have been written between 476 and 483, the earliest surviving manuscript dates from the 10th century. The author is Iakob Tsurtaveli (Jacob of Tsurtavi), a contemporary and participant of the events described in this hagiographic novel.
The novel describes the martyrdom of Saint Shushanik, an Armenian noblewoman, at the hand of her spouse, bidaxae (high prince) Varsken, who had renounced Christianity and embraced Zoroastrianism. Shushanik, whose father was the sparapet (military leader) of the Christians in Armenia, refused to follow him, and died as a martyr after years of imprisonment and tortures.
europeana:record.dc:source: The National Parliamentary Library of Georgia

europeana:record.dc:title: Ferenc Kölcsey collected works
Kölcsey Ferenc összes művei
europeana:record.dc:creator: Kölcsey Ferenc
europeana:record.dc:subject: Magyar irodalom;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Kölcsey, the author of the Hungarian national anthem was a poet, critic, politician and orator at the same time, and the outstanding creative artist of the Reform Age. The three volumes encompass his literary career and mirror its phases through his prose works, poems, political writings and rhetoric speeches. Firstly, we can read his poems, of which the most significant is the Hymnus (1823), which became the Hungarian national anthem. His other notable poems are Huszt, the Tyrant and the bitter, accusatory Zrinyi's Song, and his later Zrinyi's Second Song. His translations mainly form Greek and French, follow the lyrical works. In the second volume, we can find drama fragments and narratives. The oeuvre is further enhanced by the Political Speeches and the Parliamentary Speeches, his publicistic works, and his extensive correspondence with contemporary poets, politicians and thinkers, which provides insight into the politics and society of his time.

Kölcsey Ferenc a magyar himnusz írója egyszerre volt költő, kritikus, politikus és szónok, a reformkor irodalmának kimagasló alkotója. A munkásságát átfogó három kötet ennek a gazdag pályának az állomásait érzékíti meg, prózai munkáinak, költeményeinek, politikai ihletésű írásainak és szónoklatainak tükrében. A hatalmas oeuvre-ből először a költemények olvashatók. Lírájának kiemelkedő darabja a Hymnus, amely 1823-ban született, ugyan ebben az évben írta a Zsarnok című költeményét is, majd a hazafiúi keserűség és vád egyik legjellemzőbb darabját, a Zrínyi dalát, Zrínyi második énekét, valamint a Huszt is. Műfordításai követik a lírai darabokat (főként görögből és franciából fordított), majd drámatöredékek és elbeszélések olvashatók a második kötetben. Az életmű jelentős írásai még a Politikai beszédek, Országgyűlési felszólalások, maradandó értékű publicisztikát, politikai irodalmat is művelt. Végezetül a kortárs költőkhöz, politikusokhoz és gondolkodókhoz (Kazinczy Ferenchez, Szemere Pálhoz, Döbrentei Gábor, Wesselényi Miklós) írt levelei olvashatók, amelyek tökéletesen leképezik Kölcsey korának politikai, társadalmi viszonyait.

europeana:record.dc:title: Danica. Almanac for 1829.
Даница. Забавник за годину 1829. Год. 4
europeana:record.dc:creator: Караџић, Вук Стефановић - уредник - аутор - издавач
europeana:record.dc:subject: 800 - Literature
europeana:record.dc:description: Serbian almanac Danica had a lot of attention in the European philological circles. Danica influenced the initiation of many other annuals. Founded and edited by Vuk Karadzic.
Српски алманах Даница имао је значајан одјек у европским филолошким круговима. Утицала на појаву многих годишњака. Оснивач и уредник Вук Караџић.

europeana:record.dc:title: Al-Bukhari's "The Correct"
Sahih al-Bukhari or Al-Jami' as-Sahih
europeana:record.dc:creator: Muhammad ibn Isma'il al-Bukhari (d.256 AH / 870 AD)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 200 Religion;200 Religion
europeana:record.dc:description: This work is the Bulgarian National Library's earliest example of Arabic copy. Incomplete and fragmentary, the manuscript contains text from 'Bab Qawl an-Nabi li'l-ansar in Bab Manaqib al-ansar' to the end of 'Kitab an-Nikah'. The manuscript is described in Adnan Darwish's 'Fihris al-makhtutat al-'arabiyyah al-mahfuzah fi Dar al-Kutub ... fi Sufiyah ... Al-Juz' I', p. 209 and in Stoyanka Kenderova's 'Catalogue of Arabic Manuscripts'...№ 29

Най-ранният ръкопис на арабски език, съхраняван в Българската национална библиотека. Непълен и фрагментарно запазен препис. Ръкописът съдържа текст от "Баб Каул ан-Наби ли-л-ансар" към "Баб Манакиб ал-ансар" до края на "Китаб ан-Никах". Съдържа 109 листа с размери 175 х 256-258 мм; 25 реда на страница; Ръкописът е преписан през 407 г. по Хиджра или 1017 г. по Христа върху източна по произход хартия; черно мастило; рубрикиран текст; четливо писмо Несхи с елементи на Куфи; на л. 1а писмото есхи е обикновено; бележки на л. 1а; Ръкописът е отразен в два каталога: на Аднан Даруиш, издаден в Дамаск, 1969; и на Стоянка Кендерова, издаден в Лондон, 1995 г.
europeana:record.dc:source: St. Cyril and St. Methodius National Library
Natsionalna biblioteka Sv. Sv. Kiril i Metodii

europeana:record.dc:title: Dictionarium Trium Lingvarum In usum Studiosae Iuventutis...
europeana:record.dc:creator: Sirvydas, Konstantinas
europeana:record.dc:subject: 410 Linguistics
europeana:record.dc:description: The book is the first Lithuanian dictionary. This is a trilingual Polish-Latin-Lithuanian dictionary, first published approx. in 1620. This is the third edition of the dictionary and the oldest one which survived. There were five editions of the dictionary totally (in approx. 1620, 1631, 1642, 1677, 1713). Author of the dictionary was Lithuanian Jesuit Konstantinas Sirvydas (1578/1581-1631) - a religious writer, philosopher, Lithuanian philologist. Edition of 1642 was compiled according to the dictionary of Polish dramatist and philologist Grzegorz Knapski and is very different from the first edition. There are about 10,000 Lithuanian words in this edition, dictionary is rich in synonyms, neologisms. The edition was prepared and the preface was written by Jonas Jaknavičius. The Rector of Vilnius University Jonas Gruževskis agreed to publish it. Until the end of the nineteenth century, it was the only printed dictionary of the Lithuanian language in Lithuania. The dictionary is stored at Vilnius University Library.

Ši knyga – pirmasis lietuvių kalbos žodynas. Tai trikalbis lenkų–lotynų–lietuvių kalbų žodynas, pirmą kartą išleistas apie 1620 metus. Čia pristatomas trečiasis veikalo leidimas (seniausias išlikęs), o iš viso knyga leista penkis kartus (apie 1620, 1631, 1642, 1677, 1713). Žodyno autorius – jėzuitas Konstantinas Sirvydas (1578/1581–1631) – religinis rašytojas, filosofas, lietuvių filologas. 1642 metų leidimas sudarytas pagal lenkų dramaturgo ir filologo Grigaliaus Knapskio žodyną, smarkiai skiriasi nuo pirmojo leidimo. Lietuviškų žodžių jame yra apie 10 000, gausu sinonimų, naujadarų. Šį leidimą parengė ir lotynišką pratarmę parašė Jonas Jaknavičius, o išleisti sutiko Vilniaus universiteto rektorius Jonas Gruževskis. Čia pristatomas žodyno egzempliorius saugomas Vilniaus universiteto bibliotekoje.

europeana:record.dc:title: Horizonte bėga šernai
europeana:record.dc:creator: Aputis, Juozas
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Juozas Aputis (1936-2010) is a famous XX century Lithuanian prosaic. The renaissance of Lithuanian short story genre during the 7th-8th decades of XX century is linked with his name. A modern form of a short story, delicate psychology, originality of temper and situation, plenty of associative images, lyric world-view, the essay stylistics, harmony of daily life and the deep structures of reality in shorts stories by J. Aputis was a new and very interesting direction of searches for a reader.

Juozas Aputis (1936-2010) – žymus XX a. lietuvių prozininkas. Su jo vardu siejamas lietuviškos novelės atgimimas 7-8 dešimtmečiais. Iki tol vyravusią epinę buitinę prozą jis pastūmėjo į būtiškąją plotmę. Tai ryškiai matyti čia pristatomame novelių rinkinyje „Horizonte bėga šernai“.Moderni novelės forma, subtilus psichologiškumas, nuotaikos ir situacijų autentiškumas, asociatyvių vaizdų gausa, lyrinė pasaulėjauta, eseistinė stilistika, kasdieniškumo ir giliųjų tikrovės struktūrų dermė J. Apučio novelėse buvo nauja ir skaitytojui labai įdomi ieškojimo kryptis.
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: Poems 1
Песме 1
europeana:record.dc:creator: Радичевић, Бранко
europeana:record.dc:subject: 800 - Literature
europeana:record.dc:description: Branko Radicevic (Slavonski Brod, 1824 - Vienna, 1853) - one of the most important poets of the Serbian Romanticism. As the follower of Vuk Karadzic, he was one of the first poets, writing in Serbian vernacular. The first volume of his Poems has been published in 1847, the turning year in Serbian literature and culture in general. It was the first collection of the modern Serbian lyric poetry.

Бранко Радичевић (Славонски Брод, 1824 - Беч, 1853), један од најважнијих песника српског романтизма. Као присталица Вука Караџића први је почео да пева на народном језику. Први том Песама објављен је 1847. године која је прекретничка у српској књижевности и култури. Прва збирка модерне српске лирике.

europeana:record.dc:title: Sultan's Hatti-Sherif
Султанскиј хатишериф
europeana:record.dc:creator: b.a.
europeana:record.dc:subject: 340 - Law
europeana:record.dc:description: The highest legal act in Turkey, meaning the autonomy for Serbia, given by Turkey. This Hatti-Sherif is also known as the "Turkish Constitution".
Највиши правни акт у Турској, означава добијање аутономије коју Турска даје Србији. Овај хатишериф познатији је као "Турски устав".

europeana:record.dc:title: The Polish Parisian : A Comedy in Three Acts
Paryzanin polski : komedya we trzech aktach
europeana:record.dc:creator: Bohomolec, Franciszek (1720-1784)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Franciszek Bohomolec (1720-1784) was a Polish Jesuit priest, teacher, editor, translator, writer, foremost comedy writer and reformer of the Jesuit Theater in the Age of Enlightenment. The comedies written by Bohomolec have been performed on the stage of the Warsaw Collegium Nobilium since 1753. They treated subjects related to the sociological and moral changes in Polish society. In the middle of the 18th century, novelties from Europe gained greatly in popularity in Poland. Bohomolec, as a pedagogue, ridiculed fashionable ladies and gentlemen in his plays who rejected anything that was Polish and superficially adopted the models of foreign culture, specifically French. An example of the above mentioned phenomenon is the comedy "The Polish Parisian", in which a young master comes back to his hometown after a five-year stay in Paris.

Franciszek Bohomolec (1720-1784) to polski jezuita, nauczyciel, redaktor, tłumacz i publicysta. Przede wszystkim jednak komediopisarz i reformator jezuickiego teatru oświeceniowego. Komedie pisane przez Bohomolca były wystawiane na scenie warszawskiego Collegium Nobilium od 1753 roku. Poruszały tematykę związaną z przemianami obyczajowymi w polskim społeczeństwie. W połowie XVIII wieku modne stały się w Polsce europejskie nowinki. Bohomolec jako pedagog ośmieszał w swoich sztukach modne damy i kawalerów, którzy odżegnywali się od wszystkiego co polskie i w sposób powierzchowny przejmowali wzory obcej kultury, głównie francuskiej. Przykładem jest komedia "Paryżanin polski", w której młody panicz powraca do rodzinnego dworu po pięcioletnim pobycie w Paryżu.
europeana:record.dc:publisher: W Warszawie : w Drukarni Nadworney J.K.Mci.

europeana:record.dc:title: The Ray of Microcosm
Луча Микрокозма
europeana:record.dc:creator: Петровић Његош, Петар
europeana:record.dc:subject: 800 - Literature
europeana:record.dc:description: Cosmogonic-religious epic.
Космогонијско-религиозни еп.

europeana:record.dc:title: Convolute of 7 editions from the end of the 16th – beginning of the 17th c. №5. Primer (Nauka ku Chitanyu i Rozumenyu Pisma Slovenskogo). Vilno, 1596.
Конволют ХVІ-ХVІІ. № 5. Наука ку читаню и розуменю писма словенского. Вилно, 1596
europeana:record.dc:creator: Lavrentij Zizanij
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books;000 Generalities
europeana:record.dc:description: An early Slavonic cyrillic primer (№5 of 7 items bound together) the author of which is Lavrentij Zizanij, a famous writer, scholar and teacher at Lviv Dormition Brotherhood School. In fact, that is the first printed Ukrainian primer.

Ранен славянски кирилски печатен буквар (№ 5 от 7 издания подвързани заедно), чийто автор е Лаврентий Зизаний – известен писател, учен и преподавател в Лвовската братска школа. В действителност, това е първият печатен украински буквар.
europeana:record.dc:source: St. Cyril and St. Methodius National Library
Natsionalna biblioteka Sv. Sv. Kiril i Metodii

europeana:record.dc:title: The art of navigating
Arte de navegar en que se contienen todas las reglas, declaraciones, secretos y auisos a q la buena navegacio son necessarios, y se deue saber
europeana:record.dc:creator: Medina, Pedro de
europeana:record.dc:subject: Navegación
europeana:record.dc:description: El Arte de navegar (The Art of Navigating) achieved immediate success, rapidly spreading across Europe. It was translated into French, Italian, German, English and Dutch, reaching a total of twenty-seven editions. Since its appearance, it became a training manual for pilots not only in Spain, but also in Europe. The Biblioteca Nacional keeps as pieces of great value, copies of the Spanish, French and Italian editions. It was addressed at teaching the pilots of the Casa de Contratación (House of Trade) who were going to navigate to the Indies. The cosmographer Pedro de Medina lived for the greatest part of his life in Seville, where he taught the art of navigation as a cosmographer attached to the Casa de Contratación. He sailed on various occasions as a scientist and not as a sailor, to put the theories and teachings on navigation he presented in his "manuals" into practice.

El Arte de navegar tuvo un éxito inmediato, difundiéndose rápidamente por toda Europa. Se tradujo al francés, italiano, alemán, inglés y holandés, llegando a alcanzar más de veintisiete ediciones. Desde su aparición se convirtió en un manual de formación para pilotos no sólo en España, sino también en Europa. La Biblioteca Nacional conserva, como piezas de gran valor, ejemplares de las ediciones española, francesa e italiana. Estaba destinada a la enseñanza de los pilotos de la Casa de Contratación que iban a navegar hacia las Indias. El cosmógrafo Pedro de Medina residió la mayor parte de su vida en Sevilla donde se dedicó a la enseñanza de la náutica como cosmógrafo adscrito a la Casa de Contratación. Navegó en varias ocasiones como científico y no como marino, para poner en práctica las teorías y enseñanzas sobre la navegación que exponía en sus «manuales».

europeana:record.dc:title: The War for the Serbian Language and Orthography
Рат за српски језик и правопис
europeana:record.dc:creator: Даничић, Ђура
europeana:record.dc:subject: 400 - Language
europeana:record.dc:description: This book contributed a lot to the victory of Vuk Karadzic reform by its concept and language comprehension.
Књига која је својим језичким схватањима допринела победи Вукове реформе.

europeana:record.dc:title: al-Buni’s Commentary upon the Opening Sura`s Pray
Sharh du‘a al-Fatiha li-l-Buni
europeana:record.dc:creator: Ahmad Ibn ‘Ali Ibn Yusuf al-Buni (d. 622/1225)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 200 Religion
europeana:record.dc:description: This text forms the second work in a rare compendium of 18 prayers and texts. It is a commentary upon the Opening sura [Q.1] and its using in a every day praying. It was written by Sidi Ahmad Ibn ‘Ali Ibn Yusuf al-Buni (d. 622/1225), an islamic theologian, mystic and magician, who was born in Tunisia and worked in Egypt. He wrote around 40 Arabic books on Islamic esoterica and magic having d special facility with the theology of talismanic configurations of the Names of Allah and of Coranic verses. Although the source of the text is not mentioned in the codex, it is thought to be a part of the tenth chapter of Buni`s well known work 'The book of the Sun of Gnosis and the Subtleties of Elevated things' that is one of the great Arabic books of magic and spiritualism.

Съчинението е второ поред в рядко преписван сборник от средата на ХІ/ХVІІ в., включващ 18 молитви и четива. Според заглавието в ръкописа, негов автор е Ахмад ибн Али ибн Юсуф ал-Буни (поч. 622/1225) - ислямски теолог и мистик, роден в Алжир, който е работил и починал в Египет. Написал е около 40 езотерични съчинения, посветени на теологията и на значенията на Прекрасните имена на Аллах и стиховете на Корана, както и на използването им като талисмани и апотропейни заклинания. Коментарът е съвсем кратък и е върху първата сура (глава) от Корана и четенето й в ежедневните молитви. Източникът на текста не е споменат в преписа. Възможно е да е част от известния труд на ал-Буни "Книга за Слънцето на познанието и тънкостите на възвишеното",в чиято десета глава са изложени тайните на сура "ал-Фатиха" и нейните качества като молитва.
europeana:record.dc:source: St. Cyril and St. Methodius National Library
Natsionalna biblioteka Sv. Sv. Kiril i Metodii

europeana:record.dc:title: The Mother: An Unsavory Play In Two Acts and an Epilogue
Matka. Niesmaczna sztuka w 2 aktach z epilogiem
europeana:record.dc:creator: Witkiewicz Stanisław Ignacy (1885-1939)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Stanislaw Ignacy Witkiewicz (1885-1939), a.k.a. "Witkacy" was born in Warsaw in 1885. He was a versatile author, being at once a writer, painter, philosopher, and art theoretician. On September 18, 1939, he committed suicide in the town of Jeziory in the Polesie region. He was the creator of the theory of pure form in art. Witkiewicz wrote avant-garde dramas, in which appeared random subjects, deformation, lack of chronology in the plot and in the logical consequence of scenes. He opposed realism and naturalism, which led to rejecting the laws of psychology, biology and ethics. The aim of Witkacy’s art was to evoke metaphysical feelings in the viewer, who could experience a sense of being separated from the rest of the world as well as the uniqueness of his own existence. The drama, “The Mother: An Unsavory Play In Two Acts and an Epilogue” was written in 1924. As far as its narrative structure is concerned, the play is a parody of the psychological family drama. In the drama, the author applies techniques used later on in The Theatre of the Absurd.

Stanisław Ignacy Witkiewicz (1885-1939), pseudonim Witkacy, urodził się w 1885 roku w Warszawie. Był twórcą wszechstronnym: pisarzem, malarzem, filozofem, teoretykiem sztuki. Popełnił samobójstwo 18 września 1939 w Jeziorach w dawnym województwie poleskim. Był twórcą teorii Czystej Formy w sztuce. Tworzył awangardowe dramaty, w których pojawiała się przypadkowa tematyka, deformacja, brak chronologii w fabule oraz logicznego następstwa scen. Zerwanie z realizmem i naturalizmem prowadziło do odrzucenie praw psychologii, biologii i etyki. Celem sztuki Witkacego było wywołanie u odbiorcy "uczucia metafizycznego". Dzięki temu mógł on doświadczyć poczucia odrębności wobec reszty świata i wyjątkowości własnego istnienia. Dramat "Matka: niesmaczna sztuka w 2 aktach" z epilogiem napisany został w 1924 r. W warstwie fabularnej sztuka jest parodią psychologicznego dramatu rodzinnego. Autor stosuje też zabiegi wykorzystywane później w teatrze absurdu.

europeana:record.dc:title: Szeszes pasakas...
europeana:record.dc:creator: Stanevičius, Simonas Tadas
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: "Šešios pasakos..." (Six Fairy Tales) by the first professional Lithuanian philologist Simonas Stanevičius (1799-1848) is an original work and very significant for the foundation of secular Lithuanian literature. The book comprised an ode and six fables. There are also six fables of Donelaitis printed in the book. Lithuanian foreword of the book is important for literary critics and poetry. Book is stored at Vilnius University Library.

Pirmojo lietuvių filologo profesionalo Simono Stanevičiaus (1799-1848) leidinys „Šešios pasakos“ – originali kūryba, reikšminga pasaulietinės lietuvių literatūros atsiradimui. Knygą sudaro viena odė ir šešios pasakėčios. Čia taip pat išspausdintos ir šešios Kristijono Donelaičio pasakėčios. Lietuviškai parašyta pratarmė svarbi literatūros kritikai bei poetikai. Knyga saugoma Vilniaus universiteto bibliotekoje.

europeana:record.dc:title: In the air and on the sand...
Levegőben... homokon...
europeana:record.dc:creator: Almásy László
europeana:record.dc:subject: Utazási irodalom;910 Geography and travel
europeana:record.dc:description: “Even not so long ago on the map of Africa, where the 26th line of longitude crosses the Tropic of Cancer, there was a huge white spot.” Cartographers filled in the gap by putting “Libyan Desert” there in big capital letters. If the Sahara is divided into three sections, the westernmost part is the Libyan Desert. The borders of Egypt, Sudan and Italian Tripoli run along the virtual lines of latitude and longitude. In reality however, “only sand is bordering rock, while nothing is bordering infinity,” as the author says in the foreword to his book as an expert and partly explorer of this desert, whom cinemagoers know from “The English Patient”. The film and reality have in common the fact that Count Almásy also suffered a plane crash, but he survived and discovered areas of the desert (the third valley of the mythical Zarzura oasis) and found cave drawings in Mount Uveinat in the south of the Libyan Desert. The fascinating stories in the book give an authentic picture of the man and his personality. His 1935 report of the “Magyarabs” is outstanding, describing the Arabic tribe on an island in the Nile that claims to be of Hungarian origin and believes that their ancestors were settled in Africa in the 16th century by the Turkish Sultan Suliman.

„Afrika térképén még a közelmúltban, ott, ahol a huszonhatodik hosszúsági fok szeli a Ráktérítőt, hatalmas fehér folt éktelenkedett. A térképrajzolók az üres helyet úgy töltötték be, hogy nagy betűkkel beleírták "Libyai Sivatag". Ha a Szaharát három részre osztjuk, a Libyai-sivatag a nyugati harmadrész. A hosszúsági és szélességi fokok képzelt vonalán futnak végig Egyiptom, Szudán és az olasz Tripolis határai. A valóságban ott azonban csak a homok határos a sziklával, a semmi a végtelenséggel.” írja könyve előszavában a szerző, aki ennek a sivatagnak alapos ismerője, részben felfedezője volt, és akit a filmkedvelő közönség „Angol Beteg” –ként ismert meg. A film és a valóság annyiban közös, hogy Almásy is szenvedett repülőbalesetet, de ő túlélte és ő is fedezett fel sivatagi területet (a legendákból ismert Zarzura oázis harmadik völgyét) és talált barlangrajzokat, a Líbiai-sivatag déli-részén fekvő Uveinat-hegységben. A történetek közül kiemelendő 1935-ös tudósítása a magyarabokról, egy Nílus-szigeti törzsről, amely magyar eredetűnek tartja magát és úgy tudja, hogy őseit még a XVI. században telepítette oda Szolimán török szultán.

europeana:record.dc:title: Map of islands of the world
Islario general de todas las islas del mundo
europeana:record.dc:creator: Santa Cruz, Alonso de (1505-1567)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Islas
europeana:record.dc:description: The Islario (map of islands) is the masterpiece of the Sevillian cosmographer Alonso de Santa Cruz. It was started at the time of Emperor Charles V and was finished in that of his son Philip II, to whom it is dedicated. The Islario was the first time paper was used instead of parchment, which was the most common material for this type of chart. The trace of the maps is more functional, taking less care over the aesthetics than medieval Portolans. This atlas is made up of one hundred and eleven maps that represent the islands and peninsulas of the world, and show all the discoveries made from the 15th century to the mid 16th century... It is highly likely that the Islario General was part of one of an unfinished Universal Geography by Santa Cruz. Alonso de Santa Cruz (1505-1567), cosmographer from the school of Seville, was one of the most representative figures of the Casa de Contratación (House of Trade). It includes an interesting collection of 111 maps of islands, coloured in ink wash.

El Islario es la obra magna del cosmógrafo sevillano Alonso de Santa Cruz. Se inició en época del emperador Carlos V y se terminó en la de su hijo Felipe II, a quien está dedicada. En el Islario se utiliza por primera vez el papel en lugar del pergamino, que era el soporte más común para este tipo de cartas. El trazado de los mapas es más funcional, cuidando menos la estética que en los portulanos medievales. El atlas está compuesto por ciento once mapas que representan las islas y penínsulas del mundo y muestran todos los descubrimientos realizados desde el siglo XV hasta mediados del XVI... Es muy probable que el Islario general fuera parte de una Geografía Universal que Santa Cruz no llegó a terminar. Alonso de Santa Cruz (1505-1567), cosmógrafo de la escuela sevillana, fue una de las figuras más representativas de la Casa de Contratación. Incluye una interesante colección de 111 mapas de islas, coloreados a la aguada

europeana:record.dc:title: The Spanish Parnassus: mount divided in two summits, with the nine Castilian muses, where poems are kept
El Parnasso Español : monte en dos cumbres dividido, con las nueve musas castellanas, donde se contienen poesias
europeana:record.dc:creator: Quevedo, Francisco de (1580-1645)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Literatura
europeana:record.dc:description: José Antonio González de Salas, a friend of Francisco de Quevedo, concerned about collecting his works, took the poems of the poet to print in 1648, in an edition he himself commented. It was González de Salas who conceived and justified the images; six muses plus the frontispiece, etched using a strong acid and burin, that would illustrate the first edition. González de Salas died in 1651 and could not contemplate the three remaining muses. The muses, drawn by Alonso Cano, were engraved by Juan de Noort and Herman Panneels, a Dutchman and Fleming based in Madrid, and one by Alonso Cano himself. They would have to wait until 1670 to be able to read all the poems published in Las tres musas últimas castellanas (The last three Castilian muses). Second part of the Parnaso español (Spanish Parnassus), an edition that included poems that were not written by Quevedo.

José Antonio González de Salas, amigo de Francisco de Quevedo, preocupado por recopilar sus poesías, llevó a la imprenta los poemas del poeta en una edición de 1648 comentada por él.
