In an artistic generalization, the "Latvju dainas" show the material, social and spiritual life and characterize the national peculiarities, the people’s philosophy, ethical and aesthetical beliefs. The collection contains 217 996 folk songs, as well as descriptions for family customs, seasonal customs and plays. A major contribution to the "Latvju dainas" was made by Krišjānis Barons (1835–1923), a folklorist, publicist and writer. His work was the foundation for the development of folkloristics as a field of academic study. Barons developed the classification system for "Latvju dainas", sorted the songs and introduced the principle of the cluster of songs in Latvian folkloristics, namely the choice of a particular version as the principal, with the rest of the similar versions grouped around it. Barons also edited the texts, attempting to restore the possible oldest rendition of the songs. The songs are sorted according to the course of life of a person, his or her work and social relationships. There are 10 main chapters in the publication: 1. On songs and singing; 2. The course of life of an individual, social life of family and relatives; 3. Human economic activities, occupations, trades and crafts; 4. Position in society in general, classes of people; 5. The international situation, protection of the fatherland and the country against external enemies; 6. Annual festivities and holidays; 7. Mythical songs. Latvian Pantheon. Impersonation and worship of natural objects and natural phenomena; 8. Habits and superstitions; 9. Miscellaneous; 10. Mischievous songs. The 10 chapters are arranged in 6 volumes. Volume 1 was originally published in sections (1-10); Volume 3 has 3 parts. Each volume includes a list of the folk song collectors and narrators. Volume 5 includes a detailed overview of the areas, their population and number of folk songs collected, complete with maps. The abstract of the introduction is translated in German, tables of content — in Russian and German.

„Latvju dainas” (6 sēj., 1894-1915) ir viens no plašākajiem tautas dziesmu izdevumiem pasaulē. Mākslinieciskā vispārinājumā „Latvju dainas” atklāj tautas materiālo, sociālo un garīgo dzīvi, raksturo nacionālas īpatnības, tautas dzīves filozofiju, ētiskos un estētiskos uzskatus. Krājums ietver 217 996 tautas dziesmas, kā arī ģimenes, gadskārtu ieražu un rotaļu aprakstus. Liela nozīme „Latvju dainu” tapšanā ir folkloristam, publicistam un rakstniekam Krišjānim Baronam (1835–1923). Viņa veikums lika pamatus folkloristikas kā zinātnes nozares attīstībai Latvijā. Barons izstrādājis „Latvju dainu” klasifikācijas sistēmu, izkārtojis dziesmas un ieviesis latviešu folkloristikā dziesmu cera principu – viena teksta izvēli par galveno, ap kuru tiek grupēti no tā nedaudz atšķirīgie varianti. Barons arī rediģējis tekstus, cenšoties restaurēt to iespējamo senāko veidu. Tautas dziesmu kārtojuma pamatā ir cilvēka mūža ritējums, viņa darbs un sadzīves attiecības. Izdevumā tautas dziesmas grupētas 10 pamatnodaļās: 1. Par dziesmām un dziedāšanu; 2. Cilvēka mūža ritums, ģimenes un radu sadzīve; 3. Cilvēka darbība saimnieciskā ziņā, dažādi darba arodi; 4. Plašāks sabiedriskais stāvoklis un ļaužu šķiras; 5. Starptautiskais stāvoklis, tēvzemes un valsts apsargāšana un aizstāvēšana pret ārējiem ienaidniekiem; 6. Gada svētki un svinamas dienas; 7. Mītiskas dziesmas. Debess draudze. Dabas priekšmetu un dabas parādību personifikācija un dievināšana; 8. Ieražas un māņi; 9. Šis tas; 10. Nerātnās dziesmas. 10 nodaļas ir izkārtotas 6 sējumos. 1. sējums sākotnēji iznāca burtnīcās (1. - 10. burtnīcai); 3. sējumam ir 3 daļas. Katram sējumam pievienots tautas dziesmu vācēju un teicēju saraksts. 5. sējumā publicēts pārskats un kartes ar ziņām par teritorijām, iedzīvotāju un sakrāto tautas dziesmu skaitu. Ievada kopsavilkums tulkots vācu valodā, satura rādītāji – krievu un vācu valodā.

europeana:record.dc:description: "Latvju dainas" (Latvian Folk Songs) (6 volumes, 1894-1915) is one of the most extensive folk song collections in the world. In an artistic generalization, the "Latvju dainas" show the material, social and spiritual life and characterize the national peculiarities, the people’s philosophy, ethical and aesthetical beliefs. The collection contains 217 996 folk songs, as well as descriptions for family customs, seasonal customs and plays. Barons also edited the texts, attempting to restore the possible oldest rendition of the songs. The songs are sorted according to the course of life of a person, his or her work and social relationships. There are 10 main chapters in the publication: 1. On songs and singing; 2. The course of life of an individual, social life of family and relatives; 3. Human economic activities, occupations, trades and crafts; 4. Position in society in general, classes of people; 5. The international situation, protection of the fatherland and the country against external enemies; 6. Annual festivities and holidays; 7. Mythical songs. Latvian Pantheon. Impersonation and worship of natural objects and natural phenomena; 8. Habits and superstitions; 9. Miscellaneous; 10. Mischievous songs. The 10 chapters are arranged in 6 volumes. Volume 1 was originally published in sections (1-10); Volume 3 has 3 parts. Each volume includes a list of the folk song collectors and narrators. Volume 5 includes a detailed overview of the areas, their population and number of folk songs collected, complete with maps. The abstract of the introduction is translated in German, tables of content — in Russian and German.

Mītiskas dziesmas. Debess draudze. Dabas priekšmetu un dabas parādību personifikācija un dievināšana; 8. Ieražas un māņi; 9. Šis tas; 10. Nerātnās dziesmas. 10 nodaļas ir izkārtotas 6 sējumos. 1. sējums sākotnēji iznāca burtnīcās (1. - 10. burtnīcai); 3. sējumam ir 3 daļas. Katram sējumam pievienots tautas dziesmu vācēju un teicēju saraksts. 5. sējumā publicēts pārskats un kartes ar ziņām par teritorijām, iedzīvotāju un sakrāto tautas dziesmu skaitu. Ievada kopsavilkums tulkots vācu valodā, satura rādītāji – krievu un vācu valodā.

Mākslinieciskā vispārinājumā „Latvju dainas” atklāj tautas materiālo, sociālo un garīgo dzīvi, raksturo nacionālas īpatnības, tautas dzīves filozofiju, ētiskos un estētiskos uzskatus. Krājums ietver 217 996 tautas dziesmas, kā arī ģimenes, gadskārtu ieražu un rotaļu aprakstus. Liela nozīme „Latvju dainu” tapšanā ir folkloristam, publicistam un rakstniekam Krišjānim Baronam (1835–1923). Viņa veikums lika pamatus folkloristikas kā zinātnes nozares attīstībai Latvijā. Barons izstrādājis „Latvju dainu” klasifikācijas sistēmu, izkārtojis dziesmas un ieviesis latviešu folkloristikā dziesmu cera principu – viena teksta izvēli par galveno, ap kuru tiek grupēti no tā nedaudz atšķirīgie varianti. Barons arī rediģējis tekstus, cenšoties restaurēt to iespējamo senāko veidu. Tautas dziesmu kārtojuma pamatā ir cilvēka mūža ritējums, viņa darbs un sadzīves attiecības. Izdevumā tautas dziesmas grupētas 10 pamatnodaļās: 1. Par dziesmām un dziedāšanu; 2. Cilvēka mūža ritums, ģimenes un radu sadzīve; 3. Cilvēka darbība saimnieciskā ziņā, dažādi darba arodi; 4. Plašāks sabiedriskais stāvoklis un ļaužu šķiras; 5. Starptautiskais stāvoklis, tēvzemes un valsts apsargāšana un aizstāvēšana pret ārējiem ienaidniekiem; 6. Gada svētki un svinamas dienas; 7. Mītiskas dziesmas. Debess draudze. Dabas priekšmetu un dabas parādību personifikācija un dievināšana; 8. Ieražas un māņi; 9. Šis tas; 10. Nerātnās dziesmas. 10 nodaļas ir izkārtotas 6 sējumos. 1. sējums sākotnēji iznāca burtnīcās (1. - 10. burtnīcai); 3. sējumam ir 3 daļas. Katram sējumam pievienots tautas dziesmu vācēju un teicēju saraksts. 5. sējumā publicēts pārskats un kartes ar ziņām par teritorijām, iedzīvotāju un sakrāto tautas dziesmu skaitu. Ievada kopsavilkums tulkots vācu valodā, satura rādītāji – krievu un vācu valodā.

europeana:record.dc:title: Latvian Folk Songs. Vol. 4
Latvju dainas. 4. sēj.
europeana:record.dc:creator: Barons, Krišjānis
europeana:record.dc:subject: 390 Customs, etiquette, folklore
europeana:record.dc:description: "Latvju dainas" (Latvian Folk Songs) (6 volumes, 1894-1915) is one of the most extensive folk song collections in the world. In an artistic generalization, the "Latvju dainas" show the material, social and spiritual life and characterize the national peculiarities, the people’s philosophy, ethical and aesthetical beliefs. The collection contains 217 996 folk songs, as well as descriptions for family customs, seasonal customs and plays. A major contribution to the "Latvju dainas" was made by Krišjānis Barons (1835–1923), a folklorist, publicist and writer. His work was the foundation for the development of folkloristics as a field of academic study. Barons developed the classification system for "Latvju dainas", sorted the songs and introduced the principle of the cluster of songs in Latvian folkloristics, namely the choice of a particular version as the principal, with the rest of the similar versions grouped around it. Barons also edited the texts, attempting to restore the possible oldest rendition of the songs. The songs are sorted according to the course of life of a person, his or her work and social relationships. There are 10 main chapters in the publication: 1. On songs and singing; 2. The course of life of an individual, social life of family and relatives; 3. Human economic activities, occupations, trades and crafts; 4. Position in society in general, classes of people; 5. The international situation, protection of the fatherland and the country against external enemies; 6. Annual festivities and holidays; 7. Mythical songs. Latvian Pantheon. Impersonation and worship of natural objects and natural phenomena; 8. Habits and superstitions; 9. Miscellaneous; 10. Mischievous songs. The 10 chapters are arranged in 6 volumes. Volume 1 was originally published in sections (1-10); Volume 3 has 3 parts. Each volume includes a list of the folk song collectors and narrators. Volume 5 includes a detailed overview of the areas, their population and number of folk songs collected, complete with maps. The abstract of the introduction is translated in German, tables of content — in Russian and German.

europeana:record.dc:title: Bearslayer: hero of the Latvian people: a popular epoch
Lāčplēsis: latvju tautas varonis: tautas epus
europeana:record.dc:creator: Pumpurs, Andrejs
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: "Lāčplēsis" (Bearslayer, 1888) by Andrejs Pumpurs (1842–1902), more than 4700 lines long, has acquired the status of Latvian popular epoch. "Lāčplēsis" is based on a number of folklore legends and the Finnish and Estonian epochs, but its meaning stems from the ideas of the New Latvians (a movement which emerged and was active in 1850-60ies; it was a movement of progressive Latvian intellectuals, who strived for the recognition and protection of Latvian national identity) and the motif of the "legendary ancient days" of Garlībs Merķelis (1769–1850, a German Lutheran priest, writer, publicist, one of the most notable representatives of the ideas of The Enlightment in the Baltic region). The beginning of the epoch contemplates on the lost paradise — the idyllic life of the ancient Latvians. A Pantheon of Pagan deities is presented, based on the principles of the Ancient Greek plays. "Lāčplēsis" belongs to the classic mythological heroes – a human brought up by a she-bear, therefore he has bear-like strength. According to the pattern of the myth, Lāčplēsis has to perform a number of labours: a fight with a bear, an encounter with a variety of evil forces, a study of old wisdoms, and journey to the end of the world. At the war with the German crusaders, Lāčplēsis fights in a duel with the Dark Knight, and both fall to their deaths from a cliff into river Daugava. The ending of the epoch is optimistic – a time will come when Lāčplēsis will emerge victorious, and bring back the happy days of freedom. In this work, the author has skilfully linked the historic struggle of Latvians against German crusaders in the 13th century with the budding efforts in the 19th century aimed at building a national awareness and, eventually, an independent Latvia. The motifs of the epoch have been used in Latvian literature, arts and music. The epoch is translated in many languages.

Andreja Pumpura (1842–1902) vairāk nekā 4700 rindu garais dzejojums "Lāčplēsis" (1888) ieguvis latviešu tautas eposa nozīmi. "Lāčplēša" sižeta pamatā ir vairākas folkloras teiksmas un somu un igauņu eposi, bet jēdzieniski tas saistīts ar jaunlatviešu (jaunlatviešu kustība radās un pastāvēja 19. gadsimta 50. - 60. gados; tā bija latviešu progresīvās inteliģences kustība, kas galvenokārt cīnījās par latviešu nacionālās identitātes apzināšanu un saglabāšanu) idejām un Garlība Merķeļa (1769–1850, vācu luterāņu mācītājs, rakstnieks, publicists, viens no spilgtākajiem apgaismības ideju pārstāvjiem Baltijā) teiksmainās senatnes motīviem. Eposa sākumā apcerēta zaudētā paradīze, senlatviešu idilliskais dzīves ritējums. Darbojas arī pēc sengrieķu parauga veidotais dievu panteons. Lāčplēsis piederīgs klasisko mitoloģisko varoņu plejādei – cilvēks, kuru zīdījusi lācene, tāpēc viņam ir lāča spēks. Saskaņā ar mīta shēmu Lāčplēsim jāiziet pārbaudījumu cikls: viņš cīnās ar lāci, sastopas ar dažādiem tumsas spēkiem, apgūst zinības un ceļo uz pasaules malu. Karā ar vāciešiem Lāčplēsis cīnās divkaujā ar Tumšo bruņinieku, abi iegāžas no klints Daugavā un noslīkst. Taču dzejojuma izskaņa ir optimistiska – reiz pienāks brīdis, kad Lāčplēsis savu pretinieku pieveiks, un zaudētā paradīze atgriezīsies. Ar šo darbu autoram izdevies meistarīgi sasaistīt vēsturiskās 13. gadsimta latviešu cīņas pret vācu iebrucējiem ar 19. gadsimta tautas etniskā apliecinājuma un valstiskās atbrīvošanās centieniem. Eposa motīvi izmantoti latviešu literatūrā, tēlotājā mākslā un mūzikā. Eposs tulkots daudzās pasaules valodās.

Nerātnās dziesmas. 10 nodaļas ir izkārtotas 6 sējumos. 1. sējums sākotnēji iznāca burtnīcās (1. - 10. burtnīcai); 3. sējumam ir 3 daļas. Katram sējumam pievienots tautas dziesmu vācēju un teicēju saraksts. 5. sējumā publicēts pārskats un kartes ar ziņām par teritorijām, iedzīvotāju un sakrāto tautas dziesmu skaitu. Ievada kopsavilkums tulkots vācu valodā, satura rādītāji – krievu un vācu valodā.

europeana:record.dc:title: Latvian Folk Songs. Vol. 1, Pt. 1
Latvju dainas. 1. sēj. 1. burtnīca
europeana:record.dc:creator: Barons, Krišjānis
europeana:record.dc:subject: 390 Customs, etiquette, folklore
europeana:record.dc:description: "Latvju dainas" (Latvian Folk Songs) (6 volumes, 1894-1915) is one of the most extensive folk song collections in the world. In an artistic generalization, the "Latvju dainas" show the material, social and spiritual life and characterize the national peculiarities, the people’s philosophy, ethical and aesthetical beliefs. The collection contains 217 996 folk songs, as well as descriptions for family customs, seasonal customs and plays. A major contribution to the "Latvju dainas" was made by Krišjānis Barons (1835–1923), a folklorist, publicist and writer. His work was the foundation for the development of folkloristics as a field of academic study. Barons developed the classification system for "Latvju dainas", sorted the songs and introduced the principle of the cluster of songs in Latvian folkloristics, namely the choice of a particular version as the principal, with the rest of the similar versions grouped around it. Barons also edited the texts, attempting to restore the possible oldest rendition of the songs. The songs are sorted according to the course of life of a person, his or her work and social relationships. There are 10 main chapters in the publication: 1. On songs and singing; 2. The course of life of an individual, social life of family and relatives; 3. Human economic activities, occupations, trades and crafts; 4. Position in society in general, classes of people; 5. The international situation, protection of the fatherland and the country against external enemies; 6. Annual festivities and holidays; 7. Mythical songs. Latvian Pantheon. Impersonation and worship of natural objects and natural phenomena; 8. Habits and superstitions; 9. Miscellaneous; 10. Mischievous songs. The 10 chapters are arranged in 6 volumes. Volume 1 was originally published in sections (1-10); Volume 3 has 3 parts. Each volume includes a list of the folk song collectors and narrators. Volume 5 includes a detailed overview of the areas, their population and number of folk songs collected, complete with maps. The abstract of the introduction is translated in German, tables of content — in Russian and German.

„Latvju dainas” (6 sēj., 1894-1915) ir viens no plašākajiem tautas dziesmu izdevumiem pasaulē. Mākslinieciskā vispārinājumā „Latvju dainas” atklāj tautas materiālo, sociālo un garīgo dzīvi, raksturo nacionālas īpatnības, tautas dzīves filozofiju, ētiskos un estētiskos uzskatus. Krājums ietver 217 996 tautas dziesmas, kā arī ģimenes, gadskārtu ieražu un rotaļu aprakstus. Liela nozīme „Latvju dainu” tapšanā ir folkloristam, publicistam un rakstniekam Krišjānim Baronam (1835–1923). Viņa veikums lika pamatus folkloristikas kā zinātnes nozares attīstībai Latvijā. Barons izstrādājis „Latvju dainu” klasifikācijas sistēmu, izkārtojis dziesmas un ieviesis latviešu folkloristikā dziesmu cera principu – viena teksta izvēli par galveno, ap kuru tiek grupēti no tā nedaudz atšķirīgie varianti. Barons arī rediģējis tekstus, cenšoties restaurēt to iespējamo senāko veidu. Tautas dziesmu kārtojuma pamatā ir cilvēka mūža ritējums, viņa darbs un sadzīves attiecības. Izdevumā tautas dziesmas grupētas 10 pamatnodaļās: 1. Par dziesmām un dziedāšanu; 2. Cilvēka mūža ritums, ģimenes un radu sadzīve; 3. Cilvēka darbība saimnieciskā ziņā, dažādi darba arodi; 4. Plašāks sabiedriskais stāvoklis un ļaužu šķiras; 5. Starptautiskais stāvoklis, tēvzemes un valsts apsargāšana un aizstāvēšana pret ārējiem ienaidniekiem; 6. Gada svētki un svinamas dienas; 7. Mītiskas dziesmas. Debess draudze. Dabas priekšmetu un dabas parādību personifikācija un dievināšana; 8. Ieražas un māņi; 9. Šis tas; 10. Nerātnās dziesmas. 10 nodaļas ir izkārtotas 6 sējumos. 1. sējums sākotnēji iznāca burtnīcās (1. - 10. burtnīcai); 3. sējumam ir 3 daļas. Katram sējumam pievienots tautas dziesmu vācēju un teicēju saraksts. 5. sējumā publicēts pārskats un kartes ar ziņām par teritorijām, iedzīvotāju un sakrāto tautas dziesmu skaitu. Ievada kopsavilkums tulkots vācu valodā, satura rādītāji – krievu un vācu valodā.

europeana:record.dc:title: From the Works of Count István Széchenyi
Gróf Széchenyi István munkáiból
europeana:record.dc:creator: Széchenyi István (﻿1791-1860)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Történelem;940 General history of Europe
europeana:record.dc:description: István Széchenyi (1791-1860) was a politician and writer in the Reform Era and the Batthyány Government’s Minister of Transport and Labour. His intention was to use the experience he had gained in Western European countries in the service of reforming Hungary. As part of his efforts he founded the Hungarian Academy of Sciences, the National Casino and the Hungarian National Economic Association, introduced horse racing and made recommendations for making the Danube navigable, established steam shipping on Lake Balaton, contributed to the establishment of the Roller Mill and Trade Bank in Pest, and in 1842 he had an active part in concluding the contract for the construction of the Chain Bridge. Although Széchenyi strongly opposed Kossuth’s political direction and style, Kossuth called him the “Greatest Hungarian.” Széchenyi’s three main political writings stand out among the pieces in the volume: the Hitel (Credit), the Világ (World/Light) and the Stádium (Stage). In the Hitel, Széchenyi overviewed the Hungarian economy, exposed the causes of backwardness and mapped out the main tasks ahead, primarily the easing of the credit situation and the liberation of serfs. In the capitalist transformation, he attributed the leading role to the aristocracy. In his second work, Világ, he addressed issues of eliminating serfdom as well as the nobility’s privileges. In Stádium, he then summarized his reform plans in twelve points.

Széchenyi István reformkori politikus, író, a Batthyány-kormány közlekedés- és közmunkaügyi minisztere volt. Az európai polgári államokban szerzett tapasztalatait Magyarország megreformálására kívánta hasznosítani. Megalapította a Magyar Tudományos Akadémiát, a Nemzeti Kaszinót, a Magyar Országos Gazdasági Egyesületet, meghonosította a lóversenyt, javaslatot tett a Duna hajózhatóvá tételére, létrehozta a balatoni gőzhajózást, részt vett a pesti Hengermalom és Kereskedelmi Bank megalapításában, 1842-ben tevékeny szerepe volt a Lánchíd megépítésére vonatkozó szerződés megkötésében. Kossuth őt nevezte a „legnagyobb magyar”-nak, annak ellenére, hogy Széchenyi élesen fellépett Kossuth politikai szereplésének irányával és stílusával szemben. A két kötetben található munkák közül kiemelkedik Széchenyi három fő műve, a Hitel, Világ és a Stádium. A reformmozgalom programját képező művében, a Hitelben Széchenyi feltérképezte a magyar gazdaságot, megvilágította az elmaradottság okait, és felvázolta a főbb tennivalókat, legfőképpen a hitelviszonyok javítását és a jobbágyok felszabadítását. Mindezek végrehajtásában elsősorban az arisztokratákra számított, akiknek a polgári átalakulásban vezető szerepet szánt. A jobbágyrendszer megszűntetése mellett a nemesi előjogok eltörlésének szükségességével is foglalkozott Világ című művében. A Stádiumban pedig reformterveit 12 pontban foglalta össze.

europeana:record.dc:title: Aluda Ketelauri
ალუდა ქეთელაური
europeana:record.dc:creator: Vazha-Pshavela
europeana:record.dc:description: Vazha-Pshavela (July 26, 1861-July 10, 1915) is the pen-name of the Georgian poet and writer Luka P. Razikashvili, a classic of the new Georgian literature. In his best epic works Vazha-Pshavela raised the problems of the interrelations of man and society and man and nature and resolved the problems of love and duty to the people. The narrative poems Aluda Ketelauri and The Guest and the Host depict the conflict between the individual and the temi (the peasant commune): the heroes oppose certain obsolete laws of the peasant commune. These people of strong spirit and their sense of their own worth and thirst for freedom are dear to the poet.
europeana:record.dc:source: The National Parliamentary Library of Georgia

europeana:record.dc:title: The Satyre, or the native man
Satyr iliti Divyi csovik u vershe Slavoncem
europeana:record.dc:creator: Relković, Matija Antun
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Satir iliti divji čovik' is a satyrical, narrative poem written in homage to the beauty of the Slavonian land. In 11 cantos, author Matija Antun Relković (1732–1798) attacks the poor treatment of Slavonian famers, blaming the arrival of the Ottomans for a change in attitude to their status. As a physiocrat, Relković considered land as the only wealth and employs the character of the Satyre, from Greek mythology, to persuade the Slavonians to return to farming. Published in Dresden in 1762, the first edition was well received and proved highly successful. In the second edition, Relković introduced the character of the Slavonian farmer, who uses the Satyre's advice to turn his life around. Croatian literary historians were critical of the merits of the Satyre, acknowledging his contribution to the process of enlightment, but finding no literary quality.

Satir iliti divji čovik satirično-narativni spjev u 11 pjevanja objavljen je u Dresdenu 1762. Riječ je o skromnoj knjižici sa 82 nepaginirane stranice u kojoj Matija Antun Relković (1732.–1798.) opisuje ljepotu slavonske zemlje i zapuštenost slavonskoga seljaka, za koju krivi običaje za koje drži da su nastali pod turskim utjecajem. Uvodi u spjev antičko mitološko biće, Satira, koji Slavonce savjetuje kako valja obrađivati zemlju. Prvo izdanje imalo je puno uspjeha, a i u polemici o djelu prevladavali su pozitivni odjeci. U drugom izdanju Relković je uveo lik slavonskoga seljaka koji Satiru pripovijeda kako je prihvatio njegove kritike i unaprijedio svoj rad i život. Hrvatski književni povjesničari strogo su sudili o Satiru: prizvali su mu važnost u procesu prosvjećivanja, ali književne ljepote u njemu nisu nalazili. Relković je prirodu, posebice svoju rodnu Slavoniju, promatrao kao fiziokrat, tj. držao je zemlju jedinim bogatstvom, a poljodjelstvo najplemenitijim i najzdravijim zanimanjem.
europeana:record.dc:source: Nacionalna i sveučilišna knjižnica u Zagrebu
europeana:record.dc:rights: Nacionalna i sveučilišna knjižnica u Zagrebu

europeana:record.dc:title: The tears of the prodigal son
Suse sina rasmetnoga gospodina Giva Frana Gundulichia, vlastelina Dubrouackoga
europeana:record.dc:creator: Gundulić, Ivan
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Suze sina Razmetnoga' (The tears of the prodigal son) proves a powerful reflection of one man's newly found Christian beliefs. Author Ivan Gundulić (1589–1638) published the work in Venice in 1622, having publicly denounced the love poems and plays of his youth a year earlier. Rather than using the popular style of translating and paraphrasing the Bible, Gundulić treats the theme as a personal confession. In the prodigal son's speech, three voices resonate: the son's; the poet's and the reader's. The poem was written in eight and six-stanza verse, the meter used by Gundulić's contemporaries and followers. A single copy of the first edition is preserved at the National library in Paris. The work was later reprinted in Venice in 1670 and 1703, and Dubrovnik in 1828 and 1838.

Ivan Gundulić (1589.–1638.) svoje je kršćansko uvjerenje snažno , sustavno i dotjerano predstavio u djelu Suze sina razmetnoga, objavljenom u Veneciji 1622., javno obznanivši godinu dana ranije u Pjesnima kralja Davida (1621.) da se odriče ”poroda od tmina”, tj. svojih mladenačkih ljubavnih pjesama i melodrama. Namjesto prepjeva i parafraza, koji su dotada bili uobičajeni, Gundulić biblijsku temu obrađuje kao osobnu ispovijest. U govoru izgubljenoga sina odjekuju tri glasa: sinovljev, pjesnikov i čitateljev, jer čitatelj s pjesnikom izgovara pjesmu i svoju osobnu ispovijed. U trima plačevima (Sagrješenje, Spoznanje, Skrušenje) prikazao je put grješnika od grijeha do obraćenja. Djelo je ispjevano u osmercima i sestinama, pa su taj pjesnički oblik onda rabili Gundulićevi suvremenici i nastavljači. Samo jedan primjerak prvoga izdanja sačuvan je u fondu pariške Nacionalne knjižnice. Djelo je poslije tiskano u Mlecima 1670. i 1703. te u Dubrovniku 1828. i 1838.
europeana:record.dc:publisher: In Venetia, si vende da Bortolo Occhi
europeana:record.dc:source: Nacionalna i sveučilišna knjižnica u Zagrebu
europeana:record.dc:rights: Nacionalna i sveučilišna knjižnica u Zagrebu

europeana:record.dc:title: The Guest and the Host
სტუმარ-მასპინძელი
europeana:record.dc:creator: Vazha-Pshavela
europeana:record.dc:description: Vazha-Pshavela (July 26, 1861-July 10, 1915) is the pen-name of the Georgian poet and writer Luka P. Razikashvili, a classic of the new Georgian literature. In his best epic works Vazha-Pshavela raised the problems of the interrelations of man and society and man and nature and resolved the problems of love and duty to the people. The narrative poems Aluda Ketelauri and The Guest and the Host depict the conflict between the individual and the temi (the peasant commune): the heroes oppose certain obsolete laws of the peasant commune. These people of strong spirit and their sense of their own worth and thirst for freedom are dear to the poet.
europeana:record.dc:source: The National Parliamentary Library of Georgia

europeana:record.dc:title: A Fawn's Tale
შვლის ნუკრის ნაამბობი
europeana:record.dc:description: Vazha-Pshavela (July 26, 1861-July 10, 1915) is the pen-name of the Georgian poet and writer Luka P. Razikashvili, a classic of the new Georgian literature. A Fawn's Tale is a heart-breaking story about a little fawn whose mother was killed by a hunter.
europeana:record.dc:source: The National Parliamentary Library of Georgia

europeana:record.dc:title: Materials of Latvian Folk Music: Vol. 2
Latvju tautas mūzikas materiāli. 2. grāmata
europeana:record.dc:creator: Jurjāns, Andrejs
europeana:record.dc:subject: 780 Music
europeana:record.dc:description: Andrejs Jurjāns (also Jurjānu Andrejs; 1856–1922), composer, folklorist, organ-player, conductor and music critic, is the founder of Latvian musicology. He was the first to systematize, classify and perform study Latvian folk music as an entirety, and to comment it and to make a historic classification of folk songs. The importance of "Latvju tautas mūzikas materiāli", compiled by Jurjānu Andrejs and published over 1894-1926 in 6 sections, parallels that of K. Barons’s "Latvju dainas". His work had a major influence on the further development of Latvian professional and folk music, as well as on the revival of the traditional Latvian folk music and folklore in Latvia in late 20th century. By this work, Jurjānu Andrejs established a theoretical framework for a new approach in the harmonization of folk songs. A total of 5999 folklore items (melodies of folk songs) collected by Jurjānu Andrejs and his associates are kept at the Institute of Ethnography and Folklore of the Academy of Science of Latvia.

Komponists, folklorists, ērģelnieks, diriģents un mūzikas kritiķis Andrejs Jurjāns (arī Jurjānu Andrejs, 1856–1922) ir latviešu muzikoloģijas pamatlicējs. Viņš ir pirmais, kurš sistematizējis, klasificējis un kompleksi pētījis latviešu tautas mūziku, komentējis to un veidojis tautasdziesmu vēsturisko klasifikāciju. Jurjānu Andreja „Latvju tautas mūzikas materiāli”, kas no 1894. līdz 1926. gadam iznākuši 6 burtnīcās, ir līdzvērtīgi K. Barona „Latvju dainām”. Izdevumam ir bijusi liela ietekme gan uz tālāko latviešu profesionālās, gan tautas mūzikas attīstību, gan vēlāk – uz jauno folkloras kustību Latvijā 20. gs. beigās. Ar šo darbu Jurjānu Andrejs radījis arī teorētisku pamatu jaunai pieejai tautasdziesmu harmonizēšanā. Latvijas Zinātņu akadēmijas Etnogrāfijas un folkloras institūtā glabājas 5999 folkloras vienības (tautas dziesmu melodijas), ko savācis Jurjānu Andrejs un viņa līdzgaitnieki.

europeana:record.dc:title: Materials of Latvian Folk Music: Vol. 4
Latvju tautas mūzikas materiāli. 4. grāmata
europeana:record.dc:creator: Jurjāns, Andrejs
europeana:record.dc:subject: 780 Music

Latvju tautas mūzikas materiāli. 5. grāmata

Latvju tautas mūzikas materiāli. 6. grāmata

Viņš ir pirmais, kurš sistematizējis, klasificējis un kompleksi pētījis latviešu tautas mūziku, komentējis to un veidojis tautasdziesmu vēsturisko klasifikāciju. Jurjānu Andreja „Latvju tautas mūzikas materiāli”, kas no 1894. līdz 1926. gadam iznākuši 6 burtnīcās, ir līdzvērtīgi K. Barona „Latvju dainām”. Izdevumam ir bijusi liela ietekme gan uz tālāko latviešu profesionālās, gan tautas mūzikas attīstību, gan vēlāk – uz jauno folkloras kustību Latvijā 20. gs. beigās. Ar šo darbu Jurjānu Andrejs radījis arī teorētisku pamatu jaunai pieejai tautasdziesmu harmonizēšanā. Latvijas Zinātņu akadēmijas Etnogrāfijas un folkloras institūtā glabājas 5999 folkloras vienības (tautas dziesmu melodijas), ko savācis Jurjānu Andrejs un viņa līdzgaitnieki.

europeana:record.dc:title: Times of the Land-Surveyors: story
Mērnieku laiki: stāsts
europeana:record.dc:creator: Kaudzīte, Reinis; Kaudzīte, Matīss
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: "Mērnieku laiki" (Times of the Land-Surveyors, 1879) is the first novel written in Latvian; its authors were two teachers, brothers Reinis (1839–1920) and Matīss (1848-1926) Kaudzīte. The influence of the novel on Latvian literature has been compared to that of "Don Quixote" by Cervantes on Spanish literature. The plot of "Mērnieku laiki" is based on the events during land surveys in late 19th century; however, the novel has a particularly multilayered plot, intertwining the land surveys and the related intrigues, a tragic love story, relations between individual farms and two parishes and plot devices borrowed from crime novels and pulp fiction works, namely a murder and the abduction of the head surveyor. The novel portrays all contemporary classes and psychological types and includes both comic and tragic elements. The illustrations of Latvian artist Eduards Brencēns (1885-1929) helped to increase the popularity of the novel significantly; therefore, the first illustrated edition of "Mērnieku laiki", published in 1913, was selected for the collection of "Reading Europe".

"Mērnieku laiki" (1879) ir pirmais latviešu valodā sarakstītais romāns; tā autori ir divi skolotāji brāļi Reinis (1839–1920) un Matīss (1848-1926) Kaudzītes. Romāna ietekmi uz latviešu literatūru mēdz salīdzināt ar to iespaidu, kādu uz spāņu literatūru atstājis Servantesa "Dons Kihots". Brāļu Kaudzīšu darba "Mērnieku laiki" pamatā ir vēstījuma par zemes iemērīšanu 19. gs. 2. pusē, taču romānam ir izteikti polifonisks sižets, tajā vienkopus savijas zemes iemērīšana un ar to saistītās intrigas, traģisks mīlestības stāsts, attiecības starp atsevišķām zemnieku saimniecībām un diviem novadiem, kā arī no bulvāru romāniem aizgūta detektīvintriga ar slepkavību un galvenā mērnieka nolaupīšanu. Romānā pārstāvēti visi tā laika sabiedrības slāņi un psiholoģiskie tipi, ietverti gan komēdijas, gan traģēdijas elementi. Īpašu popularitāti arī citās valstīs romānam palīdzējušas iegūt latviešu mākslinieka Eduarda Brencēna (1885-1929) ilustrācijas, tādēļ "Reading Europe" kolekcijai izvēlēts pirmais ilustrētais "Mērnieku laiku" izdevums, kas nāca klajā 1913. gadā.

europeana:record.dc:title: The Swiss Family Robinson Vol 1.
Der Schweizersche Robinson, oder der schiffbrüchige Schweizer-Prediger und seine Familie : ein lehrreiches Buch für Kinder und Kinder-Freunde zu Stadt und Land
europeana:record.dc:creator: Wyss, Johann David
europeana:record.dc:subject: 830 Literatures of Germanic languages
europeana:record.dc:description: First edition of this classic children's story. the SNL holds 23 translations in its collections
L'édition originale de ce classique de la littérature enfantine; 23 traductions sont présentes dans nos collections
Erstausgabe des Kinderbuchklassikers, 23 Übersetzungen sind in unserer Sammlung vorhanden

europeana:record.dc:title: Mrs Marie Grubbe
Fru Marie Grubbe. Interieurer fra det syttende aarhundrede
europeana:record.dc:creator: J. P. Jacobsen
europeana:record.dc:subject: 830 Literatures of Germanic languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Marie Grubb' was one of only two novels written by Danish writer J. P Jacobsen. The novel tells tale of the rise and fall of a noblewoman in the 1600s, who sacrifices her position and wealth in pursuit of happiness. Thought to be based on an authentic account, Holberg, Blicher and Hans Christian Andersen had all previously written about the rebellious Marie. The novel highlights the changing attitudes towards women in 17th century society and the shifting relationships between men and women. Jakobsen's portrait of Grubbe is all the more remarkable for the time as he highlights the thoughts and actions of a liberated woman. European writers like Rilke, Thomas Mann and T.E. Lawrence were all inspired by the Danish writer, who died at the age of 38 leaving behind only two novels and a handful of short stories and poems. The Danish Literature Canon Committee has prepared and published the reprinted texts from the Ministry of Culture’s magazine Kulturkontakten January 2006. The English translation is by Vibeke Cranfield

"Festens Pragt og Toner, Mændenes Hyldest og Beundring, hun skred hen derover som var det et Skarlagenstæppe, bredt ud for hendes Fod at træde paa." Marie Grubbe er fortællingen om en adelig pige fra 1600-tallet, der når til tops ved hoffet i København og siden ender som udslidt færgekone. Marie er en oprører, der bryder ud, først af det kuldslåede hjem hos faderen på herregården Tjele, siden af et celebert, men goldt ægteskab, der har givet hende al den ydre pragt, som den stolte og ærgerrige hovedperson ellers ikke er blind for. Marie former sit liv efter sin egen vilje, og den kommer til udtryk gennem hendes seksualitet. Alligevel er det ikke bare historien om en femme fatale og hendes skiftende mænd. Det er snarere beretningen om et ensomt menneske, der trodser sine omgivelser i forsøget på at finde sit indre jeg, og betaler prisen for det.
Det er en autentisk historie, der fortælles. Tidligere havde Holberg, Blicher og H.C. Andersen skrevet om den rebelske Marie. Men selv om J.P. Jacobsen vender blikket bagud, er det en roman, der peger fremad. Europæiske forfattere som Rilke, Thomas Mann og T.E. Lawrence blev inspireret af den danske forfatter, der døde som 38-årig og kun efterlod sig to romaner samt en håndfuld noveller og digte.
Portrættet af Marie Grubbe indvarsler en ny tids ændrede forhold mellem mænd og kvinder. Maries følelser blotlægges i sansenære punktnedslag adskilt af episke spring, som løsrevne mosaiksten, der tilsammen antyder en livshistorie. Jacobsen er på én gang illusionsløs og intenst medlevende i sin skildring af en frigjort kvindes ubændighed og vildfarelser, og det hele sker i sproget: en bevidsthedsstrømmende, atmosfæremættet og detaljerig prosa, der låner træk fra barokken, såvel i dialogen som i ambitionen om at drive den lyriske beskrivelse til at indfange de mindste indtryk og bevægelser i et rastløst, lidenskabeligt sind.
Kilde: Kanonudvalget for Litteratur. Udvalgets begrundelser for valg af tekster i Litteraturkanon er optrykt i et særnummer af Kulturministeriets magasinet Kulturkontakten januar 2006
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Kbh.: Det Danske Sprog- og Litteraturselskab og Borgens Forlag
europeana:record.dc:source: Society for Danish Language and Literature, partner of The Royal Library: The National Library of Denmark and Copenhagen University Library
Det Danske Sprog- og Litteraturselskab i samarbejde med Det Kongelige Bibliotek: Nationalbibliotek og Københavns Universitetsbibliotek

europeana:record.dc:title: The Pearl Fisher
Pērļu zvejnieks
europeana:record.dc:creator: Poruks, Jānis
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: The long story "Pērļu zvejnieks" (The Pearl Fisher, 1895) by Latvian prosaist and poet Jānis Poruks (1871–1911) is considered the first manifesto of romanticism in Latvian literature. With this work he broke the stereotype of Latvian prose being a depicter for rural life and introduced the trends characteristic of schools of thought and directions of literature prevailing in Western Europe in late 19th and early 20th century. Ansis Vairogs, the protagonist of the story, is a typical romantic hero – a lonesome maximalist, platonic lover, introverted and focused on spiritual values. Vairogs’ journey has a tragic ending – unable to adapt to the "alien world" he falls ill in Dresden and dies. The tragic message of the story is based on the typical juxtapositions of romantic literature: reality/illusion and material/spiritual. The title of the story is symbolic - it denotes both the attempts of the naive young man to find pearls in the nearby river, and the search for gems (pearls) within him. The "Pērļu zvejnieks" embraces the trends of German romantic prose and the ideas of Nietzsche; a big part of work consists of reflective dialogues, contemplations of Wagner, Goethe, and musical reminiscences. The book is designed by artist Eduards Vītols (1877-1954).

Latviešu prozaiķa un dzejnieka Jāņa Poruka (1871–1911) garo stāstu "Pērļu zvejnieks" (1895) uzskata par pirmo romantisma manifestu latviešu literatūrā. Ar šo darbu viņš lauza stereotipu par latviešu prozu kā lauku dzīves aprakstītāju un ienesa latviešu literatūrā 19. un 20.gs. mijā valdošo Rietumeiropas garīgo un literāro strāvojumu elpu. Stāsta galvenais varonis Ansis Vairogs ir tipisks romantiskais varonis – vientuļš maksimālists, platonisks mīlētājs, kurš koncentrējas uz savas dvēseles dzīvi. Vairoga ceļojums noslēdzas traģiski – būdams nepiemērots "svešajai pasaulei", viņš Drēzdenē saslimst un mirst. Traģikas pamatā ir romantisma literatūrai raksturīgie pretstatījumi īstenība/ilūzija un garīgais/materiālais. Stāsta virsraksts ir simbolisks – tas apzīmē gan naivā jaunekļa mēģinājumus atrast pērles piemājas upītē, gan arī pērļu meklēšanu sevī. "Pērļu zvejniekā" saskatāmas vācu romantiskās prozas atbalsis un Nīčes ideju ietekme; liela vieta atvēlēta reflektējošiem dialogiem, apcerēm par Vāgneru, Gēti, kā arī muzikālām reminiscencēm. Grāmatas māksliniecisko ietērpu veidojis Eduards Vītols (1877-1954).

europeana:record.dc:title: On the Reform of the Republic (four volumes)
O poprawie Rzeczypospolitej księgi czwóre
europeana:record.dc:creator: Modrzewski, Andrzej Frycz (ca 1503-1572)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 320 Political science;350 Public administration
europeana:record.dc:description: Andrzej Frycz Modrzewski (ca 1503-1572) was a Polish author and writer of the Renaissance period. His life's work, "Commentariorum de Republica emendanda libri quinque", was published in Kraków in 1551, but this edition contained only three volumes: On customs, On laws and On war. Due to censorship, the volumes "On Church" and "On school" were not included. The entire work was published in Basel in 1554. The work was read and praised throughout renaissance Europe and translated into German and Spanish. Cyprian Bazylik translated it into Polish and published it (excluding the volume “On Church”) under the title "On the Reform of the Republic" – used to this day. The work forms a collection of personal reflections on the subject of statehood and its workings, encouraging rethinking of the most fundamental moral, legal, educational and church issues. Modrzewski advocated a state based on just laws and judiciary with a powerful king subjected to the rule of law.

Andrzej Frycz Modrzewski (ca 1503-1572) – polski twórca i pisarz polityczny okresu renesansu. Dzieło życia Modrzewskiego "Commentariorum de Republica emendanda libri quinque", ukazało się w Krakowie w 1551 roku, ale edycja ta obejmowała tylko trzy księgi: "O obyczajach", "O prawach" i "O wojnie". Na skutek ingerencji cenzury pominięto księgi: "O Kościele" i "O szkole". Całość ukazała się w Bazylei w roku 1554. Dzieło było czytane i chwalone w całej renesansowej Europie, doczekało się przekładu na język niemiecki, hiszpański. Na język polski przetłumaczył je Cyprian Bazylik i wydał (z pominięciem księgi "O Kościele") pod tytułem "O poprawie Rzeczypospolitej" - do dziś najczęściej używanym. Stanowi ono zbiór autorskich, osobistych refleksji na temat państwa, jego funkcjonowania, zachęcających do przemyślenia fundamentalnych problemów moralno-obyczajowych, prawnych, kościelnych i edukacyjnych. Modrzewski orędował na rzecz państwa opartego na sprawiedliwych prawach i sądach; opowiadał się za silną władzą królewską, podporządkowaną jednak prawu.
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Drukowano w Losku : w drukarni ... Jana Kiszki ... : nakładem tegoż ... woiewody polocskiego [i.e. Mikołaja Dorohostajskiego] ... : przez Iana Karcana

europeana:record.dc:title: I Played, I Danced: a night of devils in five acts
Spēleju, dancoju: velnu nakts piecos cēlienos
europeana:record.dc:creator: Rainis, Jānis
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Rainis (born Jānis Pliekšāns, 1865–1929) is one of the most important Latvian writers, poets and playwrights of all time, a public figure and politician, arrested and deported to Russia for his political views in late 19th century (1897-1903). Rainis expressed his active political position during the 1905 revolution. In order to escape repeated prosecution, he left Latvia and settled in Switzerland. He returned in Latvia in 1920. In Switzerland, he wrote many of his important works, including the play "Spēlēju, dancoju" (I Played, I Danced, 1915, published in 1919). This is the most peculiar of the dramas written by the poet, stemming from the poesy of symbolism. The plot is partially based on the legend of Orpheus and Eurydice and Latvian folklore. Tots, the protagonist of the play, is a musician, minstrel, who has to bring back his lover Lelde (a symbol of Latvia) from the Underworld, where she is made a servant of Kungs (transl. Master). The play emphasizes the importance of the mental strength and of the arts as the source of this strength, during significant historical turbulences (play was written during the World War I).

Rainis (īstajā vārdā – Jānis Pliekšāns, 1865–1929) ir viens no ievērojamākajiem latviešu literātiem, dzejnieks un dramaturgs, sabiedrisks un politisks darbinieks, kas par saviem politiskajiem uzskatiem 19.gs.beigās tika apcietināts un izsūtīts uz Krieviju (1897-1903). Rainis aktīvu politisko nostāju pauda arī 1905.gada revolūcijas laikā, lai izvairītos no atkārtota apcietinājuma, viņš emigrēja uz Šveici un Latvijā atgriezās tikai 1920.g. Šveices periodā tapuši daudzi nozīmīgi Raiņa darbi, tostarp luga "Spēlēju, dancoju" (1915, publicēta 1919). Tā ir savdabīgākā no dzejnieka drāmām un sakņojas simbolisma poētikā. Sižets no vienas puses apspēlē Orfeja un Eiridīkes tēmu, bet no otras – latviešu folkloras motīvus. Lugas galvenais varonis Tots ir muzikants, spēlmanis, kuram no mirušo valstības un Kunga varas jāatbrīvo iemīļotā Lelde (arī Latvijas simbols). Lugā izcelta garīgā spēka un mākslas kā šī spēka avota nozīme lielu vēsturisku satricinājumu laikos (lugas tapšanas laikā – I pasaules karš).

europeana:record.dc:title: Distant Moods in a Blue Evening: poems by Rainis
Tālas noskaņas zilā vakarā : Raiņa dzejas
europeana:record.dc:creator: Rainis, Jānis
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Rainis (born Jānis Pliekšāns, 1865–1929) is one of the most important Latvian writers, poets and playwrights of all time, a public figure and politician. "Tālas noskaņas zilā vakarā" (Distant Moods in a Blue Evening, 1903) is the first collection of poems by Rainis and includes the poems composed during his deportation in Slobodsk, Russia (in late 19th century, Rainis was arrested and deported (1897-1903) to Russia for his political views). The collection is based on a juxtaposition of the old, immoral, cruel, mundane world as opposed to idealism and opportunities for individual and social fulfilment. The collection is an innovation in Latvian poetry; the cycles of poems form a rigid internal dramaturgy, the collection starts with an introductory poem, followed by seven chapters united by to their theme and mood, reaching a climax in the last chapter and concluding with the prophetic poem "Pastarā diena" (Judgment Day). Utilising the forces of nature as symbols, metaphors and allegories, the collection is a bright portrayal of the contemporary sentiments in the society, namely, the wish for a social and political change, therefore, along with love poems, sharp satiric poems were included.

Rainis (īstajā vārdā – Jānis Pliekšāns, 1865–1929) ir viens no ievērojamākajiem latviešu literātiem, dzejnieks un dramaturgs, sabiedrisks un politisks darbinieks. "Tālas noskaņas zilā vakarā" (1903) ir Raiņa pirmais dzejoļu krājums, kurā iekļauti izsūtījumā Slobodskā sacerētie dzejoļi (par saviem politiskajiem uzskatiem 19.gs.beigās Rainis tika apcietināts un izsūtīts uz Krieviju (1897-1903)). Krājuma pamatā ir pretstatījums – vecā, amorālā, nežēlīgā, ikdienišķā pasaule pretstatā ideāliem, personības realizācijas iespējām ne tikai individuāli, bet arī sabiedriski. Krājums ir novatorisks latviešu lirikā – dzejoļu cikli veido stingru iekšējo dramaturģiju; tas sākas ar ievaddzejoli, kam seko septiņas tematiski un emocionāli vienotas nodaļas, sasniedzot kulmināciju pēdējā nodaļā un noslēdzoties ar pravietisko dzejoli "Pastarā diena". Ar dabas spēku simboliku, metaforām un alegorijām krājumā spilgti pausts tā laika sabiedrības noskaņojums, vēlme pēc sociālām un politiskām pārmaiņām, tādēļ līdzās izjustai mīlas lirikai ir asi satīriski dzejoļi.

europeana:record.dc:title: The Fire and the Night: an old song in new sounds
Uguns un nakts: sena dziesma - jaunas skaņas
europeana:record.dc:creator: Rainis, Jānis
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Rainis (born Jānis Pliekšāns, 1865–1929) is one of the most important Latvian writers, poets and playwrights of all time, a public figure and politician. The play "Uguns un nakts" (The Fire and the Night, 1905, published as a separate issue in 1907) is the most notable example of symbolism in Latvian literature. It is based on the epoch "Lāčplēsis" (1888) by Andrejs Pumpurs (1842–1902). Rainis borrowed both the plot of "Lāčplēsis", adding new episodes and deepening the ideological dimension, and its system of characters. The characters and symbolism of the play offer strong contrasts: Lāčplēsis (strength of the nation and its yearning towards freedom), Laimdota (a symbol for Latvia), leaders of Latvian peoples; evil powers – the Black Knight, German crusaders, traitors of the people Kangars and Līkcepure. Spīdola, the impersonation of freedom, development and change, is the most controversial character. Use of symbols in "Uguns un nakts" is both extensive and multifaceted: it embraces the plot of the legend, historic events of Latvia (13th century, revolution of 1905), ideas of the social and political freedom of Latvia, and the eternal struggle between light and darkness.

Rainis (īstajā vārdā – Jānis Pliekšāns, 1865–1929) ir viens no ievērojamākajiem latviešu literātiem, dzejnieks un dramaturgs, sabiedrisks un politisks darbinieks. Luga "Uguns un nakts" (1905, publicēta atsevišķā izdevumā 1907)) ir ievērojamākais simbolisma paraugs latviešu literatūrā. Tās pamatā ir Andreja Pumpura (1842–1902) eposs "Lāčplēsis" (1888). Rainis pārņēmis gan "Lāčplēša" sižetu, papildinot to ar jaunām epizodēm un padziļinot idejisko dimensiju, gan tēlu sistēmu. Lugas tēli un simbolika veido spilgtus pretstatus: Lāčplēsis (tautas spēks un brīvības alkas), Laimdota (Latvijas simbols), latviešu virsaiši; tumsas spēki – Melnais bruņinieks, vācu iekarotāji, tautas nodevēji Kangars un Līkcepure. Lugas pretrunīgākais tēls ir Spīdola, brīvības, attīstības un pārmaiņu personificējums. "Uguns un nakts" simbolika ir ietilpīga un daudzplākšņaina: tajā iekļaujas gan teiksmas sižets, gan Latvijas vēstures notikumi (13. gadsimta notikumi, 1905. gada revolūcija), gan idejas par Latvijas sociālo un politisko brīvību, gan mūžīgā gaismas un tumsas pretstatu cīņa.

europeana:record.dc:title: Leonard and Gertrude : a book for the poor Vol. 1
Lienhard und Gertrud : ein Buch für das Volk Vol. 1
europeana:record.dc:creator: Pestalozzi, Johann Heinrich
europeana:record.dc:subject: 370 Education
europeana:record.dc:description: This novel of the countryside by the reforming pedagogue Pestalozzi is about village corruption and the possibility of its removal by enlightened government. The work was a pan-European success
Ce roman paysan du pédagogue réformateur Pestalozzi traite de corruption villageoise et des possibilités de l'éradiquer par l'exercice d'un pouvoir éclairé. L'ouvrage fut un succès européen
Dieser Bauernroman des Reformpädagogen Pestalozzi handelt von dörflicher Korruption und der Möglichkeit ihrer Beseitigung durch eine aufgeklärte Obrigkeit. Das Werk war ein europaweiter Erfolg

europeana:record.dc:title: Sowing the Storm: poems
Vētras sēja: dzejas
europeana:record.dc:creator: Rainis, Jānis
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Rainis (born Jānis Pliekšāns, 1865–1929) is one of the most important Latvian writers, poets and playwrights of all time, a public figure and politician, arrested and deported to Russia for his political views in late 19th century (1897-1903). Rainis expressed his active political position during the 1905 revolution. In order to escape repeated prosecution, he left Latvia and settled in Switzerland. He returned in Latvia in 1920. The collection of poems "Vētras sēja" (Sowing the Storm, 1905) was written before his expatriation as a bright poetic testimony to the events and sensations of 1905, vibrant, full of hope of the social and political independence of Latvia. Cover is designed by the artist Eduards Vītols (1877-1954).

Rainis (īstajā vārdā – Jānis Pliekšāns, 1865–1929) ir viens no ievērojamākajiem latviešu literātiem, dzejnieks un dramaturgs, sabiedrisks un politisks darbinieks, kas par saviem politiskajiem uzskatiem 19.gs.beigās tika apcietināts un izsūtīts uz Krieviju (1897-1903). Rainis aktīvu politisko nostāju pauda arī 1905.gada revolūcijas laikā, tādēļ lai izvairītos no atkārtota apcietinājuma, viņš emigrēja uz Šveici un Latvijā atgriezās tikai 1920.g. Dzejoļu krājums "Vētras sēja" (1905) ir tapis pirms emigrēšanas kā spilgta poētiska liecība 1905. gada notikumiem un izjūtām, tas ir pilns dinamisma, cerībām par latviešu tautas sociālo un politisko neatkarību. Grāmatas vāku zīmējis mākslinieks Eduards Vītols (1877-1954).
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Cēsis, 1905. apg. u. rakstos eesp. J. Osols

europeana:record.dc:title: Old Hungarian Language Relics 4.
Régi magyar nyelvemlékek 4.
europeana:record.dc:creator: Magyar Tudós Társaság
europeana:record.dc:subject: Nyelvészet;410 Linguistics
europeana:record.dc:description: The General Assembly of the Hungarian Scholars’ Society decided in September 1832 to start publishing the main medieval language relics of the Hungarian language. According to the decision, Gábor Döbrentei was entrusted with issuing “such old and interesting manuscripts in any subject.” This led to the five volumes of the “Old Hungarian Language Relics” from1838 to 1888. The first volume contains one of the most important documents to this day, the “Funeral Oration”, as well as translations of some books of the Old Testament. The second volume contains the prayer book (1513) of Beningna Magyar, Pál Kinizsi’s wife and “miscellaneous old Hungarian documents” from 1342-1599. The third volume comprises the so-called Tatros copy (1466) and some more miscellaneous texts from the decades between 1540 and 1600. The fourth and fifth volumes have our 16th century codices (e.g. Winkler and Jordánszky Codices). Thus the five-volume collection introduces important language relics, authentically documenting the history of the Hungarian language and also giving an insight into the efforts, standards and methods of 19th century Hungarian linguistic science.

A Magyar Tudós Társaság közgyűlése 1832 szeptemberében határozatot hozott, hogy elkezdik nyomtatásban közreadni a magyar nyelv akkor ismert legfontosabb középkori nyelvemlékeit. A határozat értelmében az „illy régi, akármely tárgyú, de nyelvi tekintetből érdekes kéziratok” kiadásával Döbrentei Gábort bízták meg, így jelent meg 1838 és 1888 között a Régi magyar nyelvemlékek öt kötete. Az első kötet tartalmazza a máig legfontosabbak egyikét, a Halotti beszédet és némely ótestamentumi könyvek fordításait; a második kötet Kinizsi Pálné Magyar Benigna imádságos könyvét (1513) és 1342-1599 között keletkezett „vegyes tárgyú régi magyar iratokat”. A harmadik kötetben olvasható az ún. Tatrosi másolat (1466) és ugyancsak vegyes tartalmú iratok szövegei az 1540-1600 közötti évtizedekből. A negyedik és ötödik kötetben XVI. századi között kódexeink (pl. Winkler-, Jordánszky-kódex) találhatók. Az ötkötetes szöveggyűjteményből egyfelől megismerhetők a magyar nyelv történetét hiteles dokumentáló fontos nyelvemlékek, másfelől fölmérhető, milyen törekvések mentén, milyen színvonalon, milyen tudományos metódussal dolgozott a XIX. század magyar nyelvtudománya, nyelvtörténete.

europeana:record.dc:title: A Topographic Description of Riga. Pt.1
Топографическое описание города Риги . Ч.1
europeana:record.dc:creator: Гун, Отто
europeana:record.dc:subject: 910 Geography and travel
europeana:record.dc:description: The 1798 study "Топографическое описание города Риги", (A Topographic Description of Riga, Pt. 1-2, St.Petersburg, 1804) by Otto Wilheim Huhn, (1764-1832), a Riga-based doctor and local historian contains complete and detailed information about Riga and its surroundings, the social life in the city, a breakdown of population by nationality and a description of the life as it was in late 18th century. The study pays particular attention to the state of health of the population and the city’s healthcare system. The book is complemented by tables of statistical figures and painted illustrations (townscapes, drawings of residential and public structures, etc.).

1798. gadā sarakstītajā Rīgas ārsta un novadpētnieka Oto Vilhelma Hūna (Huhn, Otto Wilheim (1764-1832) ) pētījumā "Топографическое описание города Риги", ( ч.1-2, Санктпетербург, 1804) atrodamas pilnīgas un vispusīgas ziņas par Rīgu un tās apkārtni, pilsētas sabiedrisko dzīvi, iedzīvotāju nacionālo sastāvu un dzīves veidu 18. gadsimta beigās. Īpaša vērība veltīta iedzīvotāju veselības stāvoklim un veselības aizsardzības organizēšanai pilsētā. Grāmatu papildina statistikas tabulas un ar roku krāsotas ilustrācijas (pilsētas skati, dzīvojamo un sabiedrisko ēku rasējumi u.c.).

europeana:record.dc:title: A Topographic Description of Riga. Pt.2
Топографическое описание города Риги . Ч.2
europeana:record.dc:creator: Гун, Отто
europeana:record.dc:subject: 910 Geography and travel
europeana:record.dc:description: The 1798 study "Топографическое описание города Риги", (A Topographic Description of Riga, Pt. 1-2, St.Petersburg, 1804) by Otto Wilheim Huhn, (1764-1832), a Riga-based doctor and local historian contains complete and detailed information about Riga and its surroundings, the social life in the city, a breakdown of population by nationality and a description of the life as it was in late 18th century. europeana:record.dc:title: The prisoner of Chillon - In German
Der Gefangene von Chillon
europeana:record.dc:creator: Byron, George Gordon Byron, Baron
europeana:record.dc:subject: English poetry
europeana:record.dc:description: With the Prisoner of Chillon (1816) the English poet Lord Byron (1788-1824) turned the Castle of Chillon into a long-term popular tourist attraction
Avec son Prisonnier de Chillon (1816), le poète anglais Lord Byron (1788-1824) a fait du château de Chillon une attraction touristique encore populaire de nos jours
The Prisoner of Chillon (1816) des englischen Dichters Baron Byron (1788-1824) verschaffte dem Schloss Chillon einen anhaltenden touristischen Zuspruch

europeana:record.dc:title: On education
Hagþenkir
europeana:record.dc:creator: Jón Ólafsson
europeana:record.dc:subject: 370 Education
europeana:record.dc:description: Hagþenkir is the title of a handwritten essay, written in 1737 by Jón Ólafsson from Grunnavík (1705 – 1779). Jón was a known scholar and worked closely with Árni Magnússon, the famous manuscript collector in the beginning of the eighteenth century. Jón lived in Copenhagen for the most part of his life where he wrote various essays but very few of them were published during his life. Hagþenkir was for an example not published until 1996. The main purpose of Hagþenkir was to educate and enlighten the people of Iceland on the raising of children, the value of education and good practice in general in order to pave the way for progress in Iceland after harsh times in the beginning of the eighteenth century.
europeana:record.dc:source: National and University Library of Iceland

europeana:record.dc:title: Terp skausmu į garbę, poēma isz dabartiniu laiku
europeana:record.dc:creator: Maironis
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Jonas Mačiulis-Maironis (1862-1932) is the most prominent XX-XXI century Lithuanian poet. Maironis created a lyric poem genre in Lithuanian literature. "Terp skausmų į garbę" is the first attempt of this genre.

Jonas Mačiulis-Maironis (1862–1932) – iškiliausias XIX a. pab. – XX a. pr. lietuvių poetas. Maironis sukūrė lietuvių literatūroje lyrinės poemos žanrą. Čia eksponuojamas pirmasis šio žanro bandymas „Tarp skausmų į garbę“ (1895; geriausiai šios poemos modelis realizuotas vėlesniame pristatomo kūrinio variante „Jaunoji Lietuva“, išspausdintame 1907 m.).
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Tilzēje, spausta kasztu E. Jagamasto, O. von Mauderodės sp.
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: The New Testament
Нови завјет Господа нашега Исуса Христа
europeana:record.dc:creator: Караџић, Вук Стефановић
europeana:record.dc:subject: 200 - Religion
europeana:record.dc:description: The first New Testament translation into Serbian vernacular.
Први превод Новог завета на народни српски језик.

europeana:record.dc:title: The Little Serbian Grammar
Мала српска граматика
europeana:record.dc:creator: Даничић, Ђура
europeana:record.dc:subject: 400 - Language
europeana:record.dc:description: Djuro Danicic (Djuro Popovic) (Novi Sad, 1825 - Zagreb, 1882) - one of the most famous Serbian philologist, also professor. The book was the first grammar of the Serbian language after the Vuk Karadzic reform.
Ђуро Даничић (Ђуро Поповић, Нови Сад, 1825 - Загреб, 1882), један од најзнаменитијих српских филолога, професор. Прва вуковска граматика српског језика.

europeana:record.dc:title: Riga and Its Buildings: Vol.1
Riga und seine Bauten: Bd. 1
europeana:record.dc:creator: Rigaschen Technischen Verein und Rigaschen Architekten-Verein
europeana:record.dc:subject: 690 Buildings;720 Architecture
europeana:record.dc:description: The collection "Riga und seine Bauten" (History of Riga and its Buildings) was published by the Riga Technical Association and the Fellowship of Architects of Riga. The introduction gives a short geographical characteristic of Riga and an overview of the history of the city until early 20th century. It is followed by a description of the most important buildings of the Riga utility and transportation system: port, docks, bridges, streets, tramway rail network, water supply equipment. The most important public, cultural and educational buildings are also extensively described, e.g. churches (the Dome, St. Peter’s Church, etc.), buildings of merchant and craftsmen’s organizations (the Great Guild and the Little Guild, The House of the Blackheads), court and administrative buildings, educational institutions, buildings of exchanges, banks, hospitals, shelters, theatres (such as the German Theatre, now the National Opera) and associations, sports structures, residential houses for rent, as well as parks and monuments. The articles were written by well known architects of the time, such as W. Neumann, A. Reinbergs, H. Hartmann, P. Mandelstam, H. Mehlbart, G. Kuphaldt and engineers B. Doss, A. Agthe, A. Tobien, A. Pabst and others. The collection is lavishly illustrated with pictures and plans of buildings. The publication not only gives information of the history of construction of each building, but also about the history of the resident organization until 20th century.

Krājuma "Riga und seine Bauten" (Rīgas ēku vēsture) izdevēji ir Rīgas Tehniskā biedrība un Rīgas Arhitektu biedrība. Ievadā dots īss Rīgas ģeogrāfiskais raksturojums un pārskats par pilsētas vēsturi līdz 20. gs. sākumam. Tālāk aprakstītas Rīgas komunālās un transporta sistēmas nozīmīgākās būves: osta, doki, tilti, ielas, tramvaja sliežu tikls, ūdensapgādes iekārtas. Plašāka uzmanība ir pievērsta svarīgākajām sabiedriskajām, kultūras un izglītības būvēm: baznīcām (Doma, Pētera u.c.), tirgotāju un amatnieku apvienību namiem (Lielajai un Mazajai ģildei, Melngalvju namam), tiesu un pārvaldes ēkām, mācību iestādēm, biržām, bankām, slimnīcām, patversmēm, teātru (piem., Vācu teātra, tagadējās Nacionālās operas) un biedrību ēkām, sporta būvēm un īres namiem, kā arī parkiem un pieminekļiem. Rakstu autoru vidū ir pazīstami tā laika arhitekti: V. Neimanis (W. Neumann), A. Reinbergs, H. Hartmanis (H.Hartmann), P. Mandelštams (P.Mandelstam), H. Mēlbarts (H.Mehlbart), G. Kūfalts (G.Kuphaldt) un inženieri B. Doss, A. Agte (A.Agthe), A. Tobīns (A.Tobien), A. Pābsts u.c. Krājums ir bagātigi ilustrēts ar ēku attēliem un plāniem. Izdevums sniedz informāciju ne tikai par katras ēkas celtniecības vēsturi, bet arī par tajā mītošās organizācijas vēsturi līdz 20.gs.

europeana:record.dc:title: O początkach narodu i języka litewskiego rozprawa
europeana:record.dc:creator: Bogušas, Ksaveras Pranciškus
europeana:record.dc:subject: 940 General history of Europe
europeana:record.dc:description: The book of Jesuit Ksaveras Pranciškus Bogušas (1746-1820) "O początkach narodu i języka litewskiego rozprawa" (About the origin of Lithuanian nation and language) is an important study for Lithuanian culture written in Polish. For a long time it was a popular source of the Lithuanian nation and language. In this work Lithuanians are derived from an ancient Germanic tribe Heruli. It is predicated that the Lithuanian language is a primary language rather than derived from other languages or its mixture. Lithuanian language and the nation itself are autonomous, and therefore equivalent and equal to other nations of the world.

Jėzuito Ksavero Pranciškaus Bogušo (1746-1820) knyga „O początkach narodu i języka litewskiego rozprawa“ („Apie lietuvių tautos ir kalbos kilmę“) – lietuvių kultūrai svarbi lenkų kalba parašyta studija, ilgą laiką buvusi populiarus žinių apie lietuvių tautą ir kalbą šaltinis. Lietuviai veikale kildinami iš senovės germanų genties herulių. Tvirtinama, kad lietuvių kalba yra pirminė, o ne kilusi iš kitos kalbos ar esanti jų mišinys. Lietuvių kalba bei pati tauta yra savarankiška, taigi lygiavertė ir lygiateisė su kitomis pasaulio tautomis.
europeana:record.dc:publisher: W Warszawie, w Drukarni Gazety Warszawskiey
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: Old Hungarian Language Relics 3.
Régi magyar nyelvemlékek 3.
europeana:record.dc:creator: Magyar Tudós Társaság
europeana:record.dc:subject: Nyelvészet;410 Linguistics
europeana:record.dc:description: The General Assembly of the Hungarian Scholars’ Society decided in September 1832 to start publishing the main medieval language relics of the Hungarian language. According to the decision, Gábor Döbrentei was entrusted with issuing “such old and interesting manuscripts in any subject.” This led to the five volumes of the “Old Hungarian Language Relics” from1838 to 1888. The first volume contains one of the most important documents to this day, the “Funeral Oration”, as well as translations of some books of the Old Testament. The second volume contains the prayer book (1513) of Beningna Magyar, Pál Kinizsi’s wife and “miscellaneous old Hungarian documents” from 1342-1599. The third volume comprises the so-called Tatros copy (1466) and some more miscellaneous texts from the decades between 1540 and 1600. The fourth and fifth volumes have our 16th century codices (e.g. Winkler and Jordánszky Codices). Thus the five-volume collection introduces important language relics, authentically documenting the history of the Hungarian language and also giving an insight into the efforts, standards and methods of 19th century Hungarian linguistic science.
