Vilniuje Mykolo Giedraičio lėšomis ir skirtas Žemaičių vyskupijai. Šis veikalas yra Jokūbo Ledesmos Katekizmo laisvas vertimas (tačiau ne iš ispaniško originalo, o iš lenkiško jo leidimo). Knygą sudaro dvi dalys – pats katekizmas ir apie išpažintį. Abi dalys su atskirais tituliniais puslapiais ir prakalbomis, tačiau, kaip ir lenkiško Ledesmos Katekizmo leidimo, jas į vieną knygą jungia bendra lankų numeracija. Daukšos Katekizme buvo ir dviejų giesmių vertimas – tai pirmosios lietuviškos giesmės, išspausdintos Lietuvos Didžiojoje Kunigaikštystėje. Katekizmo originalas saugomas Vilniaus universiteto bibliotekoje.

europeana:record.dc:title: Gospel
Evanghelie
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books
europeana:record.dc:description: The “Gospel” published in Chisinau in 1855 is a copy of the Gospel of Buda produced in 1812. The National Library of Moldova has the most comprehensive collection of gospels in the country (nine editions). All of them are distinguished by the manner of execution. The wood covers are overlaid with metal or well preserved purple and blue cloth. The metal (brass) is coated with silver or gold. Some of the books have ornamented locks. The ornaments represent the four evangelists and the figures of angels and saints. The edges of the most books are covered with gold and decorated with ornaments. The manuscript has been included in the Register of the National Programme “The Memory of Moldova”, section “Patrimonial documents of national importance stored in the territory of Moldova.

„Evanghelia” editată la Chişinău în anul 1855, este o copie a Evangheliei de la Buda din 1812. Biblioteca Naţională a Republicii Moldova deţine cea mai bogată colecţie de Evanghelii din republică (9 exemplare). Toate sunt remarcabile prin maniera executării. Copertele de lemn sunt îmbrăcate în metal sau acoperite cu uşurnic (ţesătură) vişiniu şi albastru. Metalul (alama) este argintat sau aurit. Unele exemplare au încuietori ornamentate. Ornamentele reprezintă chipurile celor patru evanghelişti şi figuri de îngeri şi sfinţi. Muchiile majorităţii cărţilor sunt suflate cu aur şi împodobite cu ornamente. Inclusă în Registrul Programului Naţional «Memoria Moldovei», compartimentul «Documente patrimoniale păstrate în teritoriul Republicii Moldova de importanţă naţională».
europeana:record.dc:publisher: National Library of the Republic of Moldova
europeana:record.dc:source: National Library of the Republic of Moldova

europeana:record.dc:title: Postilla Tatai esti Trumpas ir Prastas Ischguldimas Euangeliu...
europeana:record.dc:creator: Bretkūnas, Jonas
europeana:record.dc:subject: 240 Christian moral & devotional theology;230 Christian theology;220 Bible
europeana:record.dc:description: "Postilla" by Lutheran pastor Jonas Bretkūnas (Johannes Bretkius, also known as Bretke, 1536-1602) is the first printed collection of Lithuanian sermons, which includes almost 1000 pages of original and compiled texts. The work was of great significance to the development of Lithuanian standard language and formation of writing style. Book is rich in historical and social realities and written in lively language. In the dedication to the Duke of Prussia Georg Friedrich author regretted because of lack of writings in Lithuanian language and emphasized a need to have the Bible in Lithuanian language. “Postilla” is stored at Vilnius University Library.

Liuteronų kunigo Jono Bretkūno (1536–1602) „Postilė“ – pirmas spausdintas beveik 1000 puslapių apimties originalių ir kompiliuotų lietuviškų pamokslų rinkinys, turėjęs didelę reikšmę lietuvių bendrinės kalbos raidai, rašytinio stiliaus formavimuisi. Knyga gausi socialinių bei istorinių realijų, parašyta gyva kalba. Jos dedikacijoje Prūsijos kunigaikščiui Georgui Friedrichui autorius apgailestavo dėl lietuviškų raštų stokos, kėlė Biblijos lietuvių kalba reikalingumą. Šis dokumentas saugomas Vilniaus universiteto bibliotekoje.

europeana:record.dc:title: Kozonius ... unt gaylinga atprowijima Pagraba už tus Abywatelius, kuryi dyino pasykielima musu Ziames...
europeana:record.dc:creator: Karpavičius, Mykolas Pranciškus
europeana:record.dc:subject: 240 Christian moral & devotional theology
europeana:record.dc:description: This book is the most important publication in Lithuanian language, where the 1794 uprising against the occupiers is reflected. This is the translation of the mournful sermon told by Karpavičius on 20th of May, 1794 in St. Johns Church in Vilnius to commemorate the victims of the battles and defenders of capital Vilnius. The author Mykolas Pranciškus Karpavičius (pl. Michał Franciszek Karpowicz, 1744-1803) was the famous preacher of that time, professor of Vilnius University, Bishop of Wigry. He wrote and told sermons in Polish. Original of the book is stored at Vilnius University Library.

Ši knyga – reikšmingiausias spaudinys lietuvių kalba, kuriame atsispindi 1794 m. sukilimas prieš okupantus. Tai M.P. Karpavičiaus “Gedulinio pamokslo”, pasakyto 1794 m. gegužės 20 d. Vilniaus šv. Jonų bažnyčioje už žuvusius vaduojant sostinę Vilnių ir kitose kautynėse, vertimas. Knygos autorius Mykolas Pranciškus Karpavičius (1744–1803) – garsus to meto pamokslininkas, Vilniaus universiteto profesorius, Vygrių vyskupas, sakęs ir rašęs pamokslus lenkiškai. Leidinys saugomas Vilniaus universiteto bibliotekoje.

europeana:record.dc:title: Bible
İncil
europeana:record.dc:creator: Unknown
europeana:record.dc:subject: 220 Bible;090 Manuscripts & rare books
europeana:record.dc:description: It is writen with Greek alphabet on gazelle leather. Binding is wood covered with darkbrown leather. It is an old and rare copy. It is astimated that it was writen around 1000 A.D
Grek alfabesiyle ceylan derisi üzerine yazılmış, Tahta üzerine koyu kahverengi meşin kaplı bir cilt içindedir. Çok eski nadir bir nüshadır. Miladi 1000 yıllarında yazıldığı tahmin edilmektedir.

europeana:record.dc:title: Chronica Hungarorum
Chronica Hungarorum
europeana:record.dc:creator: Hess András
europeana:record.dc:subject: Történelem;940 General history of Europe
europeana:record.dc:description: The first book printed in Hungary came from András Hess's printing shop in Buda in 1473. Only prints in German-speaking lands, Italy, France and the Low Countries had preceded Hess's publication. Hess must have arrived in Hungary in 1471 and probably started working on the book also known as the “Buda Chronicle” in the summer of 1472, an undertaking which took him ten months. The “Chronicle of Hungarians” (Chronica Hungarorum) was created through merging several historical works. Its first part is a 14th century chronicle composition, which includes the Hun story and discusses Hungarian history from the original settlement to Charles Robert's rule. The second unit of the text in the “Buda Chronicle” contains the end of Charles Robert's rule, the events of the years 1335-1342 and a description of the king's funeral. The third unit gives the details of Louis the Great's story from his accession to the throne to his death (1342-1382). The fourth unit introduces data related to the monarchs and their family relations between 1382-1468 (the years between Louis the Great's death and Matthias Hunyadi's campaign in Moldova). The copy in the National Széchényi Library was purchased for the collection in 1843 by Archduke Joseph, the Palatine of Hungary.

Az első Magyarországon nyomtatott könyv Hess András budai műhelyében látott napvilágot 1473-ban. Hess kiadványát csak a német nyelvterületen, Itáliában, Franciaországban és Németalföldön készült nyomtatványok előzték meg. Hess 1471-ben érkezhetett hazánkba és 1472 nyarán kezdhette meg a Budai Krónika néven is ismert mű elkészítését. A munka tíz hónapig tartott. A Magyarok Krónikája (Chronica Hungarorum) több történeti mű összeolvasztása révén jött létre. Első része egy XIV. századi krónikakompozíció, amely a hun történetet is magába foglalva a magyarok történetét a honfoglalástól Károly Róbert uralkodásáig tárgyalja. A Budai Krónika második szövegegysége Károly Róbert uralkodásának végét, az 1335-1342 közötti korszak eseményeit, a király temetésének leírását tartalmazza. A harmadik egység Nagy Lajos király történetét taglalja trónralépte és halála között (1342-1382). A negyedik egység az 1382-1468 közötti időszak (Nagy Lajos halála és Hunyadi Mátyás moldvai hadjárata között eltelt évek) uralkodóival kapcsolatos adatokat és családi vonatkozásokat ismerteti. Az Országos Széchényi Könyvtár példányát 1843-ban József főherceg, Magyarország nádora vásárolta a gyűjteménynek.

europeana:record.dc:title: Altorius duchaunas arba Afierawone kwepencio altoriaus priesz majestota Diewa, tay ira madlitwas garbingas baznicioy szwętoy prygulencias
europeana:record.dc:subject: 240 Christian moral & devotional theology
europeana:record.dc:description: The prayer book "Altorius duchaunas" illustrates the Lithuanian Catholic tradition of prayer. Published in the first half of the eighteenth century, it became very popular and more editions were printed. Unfortunately, very few copies have survived and only one copy of the first edition is known to exist. Original of the book is stored at The Wroblewski Library of the Lithuanian Academy of Sciences.

Ši knyga iliustruoja lietuvių katalikų maldos tradiciją. Maldų knyga „Altorius duchaunas“ buvo pradėta leisti XVIII a. pirmojoje pusėje. Ji buvo labai populiari ir sulaukė ne vienos laidos. Tačiau mūsų dienas pasiekė labai mažai egzempliorių – kai kurie leidimai bibliografijoje žinomi tik iš šaltinių. Čia pateikiama knyga irgi kurį laiką buvo minima tik šaltiniuose. Dabar žinomas vienintelis išlikęs šios ankstyviausios laidos egzempliorius. Maldaknygė saugoma Lietuvos mokslų akademijos Vrublevskių bibliotekoje.
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Wilniuy, par storone ir kaszta J. Dziedzickiego
europeana:record.dc:source: The Wroblewski Library of the Lithuanian Academy of Sciences

europeana:record.dc:title: Dainos, oder Litthauische Volkslieder
europeana:record.dc:creator: Rėza, Liudvikas
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: The first scientific study of Lithuanian folklore songs entitled "Betrachtung über littauische Volkslieder" (Reflection on Lithuanian Folk Songs) was published in Königsberg in 1825. The songs proved so popular, they were reprinted and translated into English, Czech, Italian, Polish, Russian and German. Original of the book is stored at The Wroblewski Library of the Lithuanian Academy of Sciences.

Ši knyga yra pirmasis lietuvių tautosakos (dainų) rinkinys su moksliniu įvadiniu straipsniu „Betrachtung über littauische Volkslieder“ (Svarstymas apie lietuvių liaudies dainas). 1825 m. Karaliaučiuje išėjęs rinkinys sulaukė plataus atgarsio, jo dainos buvo perspausdinamos, verčiamos į anglų, čekų, italų, lenkų, rusų, vokiečių kalbas. Dokumentas saugomas Lietuvos mokslų akademijos Vrublevskių bibliotekoje.
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Königsberg, Druck und Verlag der Hartungschen Hofbuchdrukkerei
europeana:record.dc:source: The Wroblewski Library of the Lithuanian Academy of Sciences

europeana:record.dc:title: A Description of Kamchatka Semi-island. V.2
Описание Земли Камчатки. Т. 2
europeana:record.dc:creator: Крашенинников, Степан Петрович (1711-1755)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 550 Earth sciences;940 General history of Europe
europeana:record.dc:description: This early travel guide to Kamchatka paved the way for a completely new style of academic travel writing. Author Stepan P. Krasheninnikov (1711-1755) went with an expedition to Kamchatka peninsula in 1737. During his time there he gathered valuable information on the flora and fauna of the region as well as on its ethnography, history, natural settings, the indigenous population’s life and its language. On Krasheninnikov’s return to St. Petersburg in 1743, he set about recording his findings and experiences. The book comes complete with illustrations and proved popular for its attention to detail and use of supporting data.

Автор книги – сын солдата, получивший образование в Славяно-греко-латинской академии. В 1732 г. был направлен в Петербург для дальнейшего обучения в Академии наук и участия во 2-й Камчатской экспедиции. В эти годы Крашенинников собрал ценные материалы о растительном и животном мире Камчатки, этнографии и истории полуострова, его природных условиях, жизни и языке коренного населения. Вернувшись в Петербург (1743 г ), он начал готовить к печати материалы экспедиции, содержащие плоды комплексного обследования неизученного тогда региона. Книга С. П. Крашенинникова положила начало новому для русской книги жанру - публикации материалов научных путешествий по России. Самостоятельное научное и художественное значение имеют иллюстрации к книге, изготовленные и награвированные И.Э. Гриммелем и И.А. Соколовым по зарисовкам участника экспедиции И.Х. Беркгана. Книга включает карты, виды сибирских городов, изображения животного мира Камчатки, зарисовки этнографического характера. В мае 1755 г. в Академическую книжную лавку поступили 1288 экземпляров книги. Остальные 62 экземпляра пошли на бесплатную раздачу.

europeana:record.dc:title: Broma atwerta ing wiecznasti...
europeana:record.dc:creator: Olševskis, Mykolas
europeana:record.dc:subject: 240 Christian moral & devotional theology
europeana:record.dc:description: "Broma atverta ing viečnastį..." (The Gates Opened into Eternity) by Mykolas Olševskis (pl. Michael Olszewski (ca. 1712 – ca. 1779)) is popular eighteenth century religious moralistic book, "best-seller" of that time. There were seventeenth editions of that book until the nineteenth century. The book clearly reveals the Baroque world outlook and conception of death. The author intermingles Latin, Polish, and Lithuanian words, plays with unusual forms, seeks to surprise, and amaze the reader with strangeness. The stories were written in expressive baroque style and approach to fiction. The author Mykolas Olševskis was the monk of the Regular Canon Order, priest, and preacher, wrote in Lithuanian and Polish languages. Book is stored at Vilnius University Library.

Mykolo Olševskio (apie 1712–apie 1779) „Broma atverta ing viečnastį...“ – populiari XVIII a. religinės moralistikos knyga, tų laikų “bestseleris”, iki XIX a. vidurio susilaukęs septyniolikos leidimų. Knygoje ryškiai atsiskleidžia barokinė pasaulėvoka bei mirties samprata. Joje esančios pamokomos istorijos artėja prie beletristikos, parašytos ekspresyviu barokiniu stiliumi. Knygos autorius Mykolas Olševskis – regulinių kanauninkų ordino vienuolis, kunigas, pamokslininkas, rašęs lietuvių ir lenkų kalbomis. „Broma“ saugoma Vilniaus universiteto bibliotekoje.
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Wilniuy, Drukarnye J. K. M. Kunigu Franciszkonu

europeana:record.dc:title: Ewangelie polskie y litewskie...
europeana:record.dc:creator: Jaknavičius, Jonas
europeana:record.dc:subject: 220 Bible
europeana:record.dc:description: "Ewangelie polskie y litewskie..." by Jonas Jaknavičius (1589-1668) (first edition in 1647) is the first printed Catholic gospels in Lithuanian language. They have been reprinted many times as an important church texts of Vilnius diocese. The book reflects the period of seventeenth century Catholic Church reform, the creation of Lithuanian literary and growth of its importance in Europe. The author Jonas Jaknavičius was a Jesuit, who wrote books in Lithuanian, Polish, Latin, assisted Konstantinas Sirvydas in preparing Lithuanian books, organized religious societies and at various times led to several Jesuit schools. The book is stored at Vilnius University Library.

Jono Jaknavičiaus (1589–1668) „Ewangelie polskie y litewskie...“ (pirmas leidimas 1647) – pirmosios spausdintos katalikiškos evangelijos lietuvių kalba. Jos buvo daug kartų perleidžiamos kaip svarbūs Vilniaus vyskupijos bažnytiniai tekstai. Knyga atspindi XVII a. Katalikų bažnyčios reformų laikus ir lietuvių raštijos kūrimąsi bei jos reikšmės augimą Europoje. Knygos autorius Jonas Jaknavičius – jėzuitas, rašęs knygeles lietuvių, lenkų, lotynų kalbomis, padėjęs rengti lietuviškas knygas Konstantinui Sirvydui, steigęs religines draugijas, skirtingais laikotarpiais vadovavęs kelioms jėzuitų mokykloms. Šis knygos egzempliorius saugomas Vilniaus universiteto bibliotekoje.

europeana:record.dc:title: Foreign Policy of Russia in the early years of reign of Ekaterina the Great
Внешняя политика России в начале царствования Екатерины II
europeana:record.dc:creator: Чечулин, Николай Дмитриевич (1863-1927)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 940 General history of Europe
europeana:record.dc:description: A comprehensive review of Russian foreign policy following the death of Peter the Great and the accession of Catherine the Great. Author, historian, archeographer and collector Nikolay D. Chechulin (1863-1927) discusses the influence of Russia in Kurland, the alliance between Russia and Prussia (1764) and the formation of the North System between Russia, Prussia, England, Sweden, Denmark and Rzeczpospolita against France and Austria. He also discusses the Russo-Turkish War (1768-1774) and highlights the importance of the Russia-France alliance and its influence on the history of Europe as a whole.

Николай Дмитриевич Чечулин (1863-1927). — историк, археограф, коллекционер. Член-корреспондент Академии наук (1921). Обзор внешней политики России в период после смерти императора Петра I. Международное положение на момент прихода к власти императрицы Екатерины II (1762). Усиление русского влияния в Курляндии. Союзный договор между Россией и Пруссией (1764). Формирование Северной системы — союза России, Пруссии, Англии, Швеции, Дании и Речи Посполитой против Франции и Австрии. Отношения России с Турцией. Русско-турецкая война 1768—1774 гг. Первый раздел Польши (1772). Автор – сторонник союза России и Франции. «Сближение этих двух великих государств должно иметь чрезвычайно важное и благотворное значение для всей истории Европы».

europeana:record.dc:title: Daynas żemaycziu
europeana:record.dc:creator: Stanevičius, Simonas Tadas
europeana:record.dc:subject: Lithuanian folk songs;Lithuanian folk songs;Lithuanian folk songs;Lithuanian folk songs
europeana:record.dc:description: The book "Dainos žemaičių" was written by the first professional Lithuanian philologist Simonas Stanevičius (1799-1848). It is the second printed collection of Lithuanian folk songs. The first one was published by Liudvikas Rėza. "Dainos žemaičių" was the first Lithuanian folklore collection published in the Great Lithuania. The edition consists of 30 songs. In 1833 the melodies of these songs were published in Riga.

Pirmo profesionalaus lietuvių filologo Simono Stanevičiaus (1799–1848) knyga „Dainos žemaičių“ – antrasis (po Liudviko Rėzos) lietuviškų dainų rinkinys, kuris buvo pirmas lietuvių tautosakos rinkinys Didžiojoje Lietuvoje. Rinkinį sudaro 30 dainų. 1833 m. Rygoje buvo išspausdintos ir šių dainų melodijos.
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: A historical panorama of Saint-Petersburg and its surroundings; Saint-Petersburg
Историческая панорама Санкт-Петербурга и его окрестностей, Санкт-Петербург, ч. 10: Зимний дворец
europeana:record.dc:subject: 700 The Arts;740 Drawing & decorative arts;750 Painting & paintings (museums);940 General history of Europe
europeana:record.dc:description: The 10th volume of the 'The historical Panorama of Saint-Petersburg and its Surroundings' album is focused on the interiors of the Winter Palace. The Winter Palace, located on the Palace embankment of the Neva-river, was the official winter residence of Russian emperors from 1732 until the 2nd March 1917. It was then used as a session Chamber of the Russian Interim government and in 1918 was conveyed to the State Hermitage. The baroque Winter Palace building was designed and built in 1754-1765 by Francesco Bartolomeo Rastrelli. There are over 29 photographs of the palace interiors in this volume, with crucial and invaluable records of the palace interiors which were lost or changed after the Great October Revolution.

Санкт-Петербург – столица России в 1712 – 1918 гг., резиденция российских императоров. Исторический центр Санкт-Петербурга входит в Список культурного наследия ЮНЕСКО (World Heritage List). Зимний дворец на Дворцовой набережной Санкт-Петербурга - с 1732 по 2 марта 1917 г. официальная зимняя резиденция российских императоров. С июля по ноябрь 1917 г. служил местом заседаний Временного правительства. Здание было выстроено по проекту архитектора Франческо Бартоломео Растрелли (1700 – 1771, Francesco Bartolomeo Rastrelli) в 1754—1762 гг. в стиле барокко. В 1918 г. здание дворца передано Государственному Эрмитажу. Десятый выпуск серии альбомов «Историческая панорама Санкт-Петербурга и его окрестностей» содержит 29 фото-тинто-гравюр на отдельных листах, представляющих фасады и интерьеры Зимнего дворца. Особую ценность имеют изображения интерьеров, утраченных или измененных после революции 1917 г.

europeana:record.dc:title: The Un-Divine Comedy
Nie-boska komedyia
europeana:record.dc:creator: Krasiński, Zygmunt (1812-1859)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Zygmunt Krasiński (1812-1859) was a Romantic poet, playwright and novelist. One of his most famous works is "The Un-Divine Comedy". The drama was written probably in 1833 and published anonymously in Paris by the Pinard Printing House in 1835. "The Un-Divine" Comedy raises the problem of truth and falsity in art. According to Krasiński, a Romantic writer has to resist the temptation of sacrificing everything for art. The egoism and egocentrism of the main character lead to his failure not only as a husband and father, but also as a poet. The other important issue raised in the drama is the revolution and its dynamics. The vision of the revolution presented in "The Un-Divine" Comedy was influenced by historical observations made by the author: Krasiński witnessed the bloody suppression of the Canut Revolts in Lyon in 1831.

Zygmunt Krasiński (1812-1859) to romantyczny poeta, dramaturg i powieściopisarz. Jednym z jego najbardziej znanych dzieł jest "Nie-boska komedia". Dramat powstał prawdopodobnie w 1833 roku. Został wydany anonimowo w Paryżu w drukarni Pinarda w 1835 roku. "Nie-boska komedia" porusza problem prawdy i fałszu w sztuce. W koncepcji Krasińskiego romantyczny twórca musi oprzeć się pokusie poświęcenia wszystkiego dla sztuki. Egoizm i egocentryzm głównego bohatera sprawia, że ponosi on klęskę, nie tylko jako mąż i ojciec, ale także jako poeta. Drugim ważnym problemem opisanym w dramacie jest dynamika rewolucji. Wpływ na wizję rewolucji zaprezentowaną w "Nie-Boskiej komedii" miały obserwacje historyczne autora. Krasiński był np. świadkiem krwawo stłumionego powstania robotników w Lionie w 1831 roku.

europeana:record.dc:title: Synodikon (Sinodik ili Pomyannik), Russian edition from the Second Half of the XVIII c.
Синодик или Помянник . ХVІІІ в.
europeana:record.dc:creator: Leontij Bunin, at al.
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books;200 Religion;090 Manuscripts & rare books;200 Religion
europeana:record.dc:description: A book of single-leaf cooper engravings (Lubok), printed on the facing pages of the folia. Hand-coloured in red, green and ochre. Some of the engravings are made by Leontij Bunin – a famous Russian engraver at the end of the XVII c. The copy opens with a handwritten historical note from the year 1866 which comments interesting facts from the Age of The Bulgarian Revival.

Книгата се състои от медни гравюри, отпечатани от едната страна на листа (лубок) през втората половина на ХVІІІ в. Изображенията са оцветени ръчно в червено, зелено и охра. Някои от гравюрите са дело на Леонтий Бунин – известен руски гравьор от края на ХVІІ в. Екземплярът съдържа ценна приписка за събитие от 1866 г., което отразява важни факти от епохата на Българското възраждане.
europeana:record.dc:source: St. Cyril and St. Methodius National Library
Natsionalna biblioteka Sv. Sv. Kiril i Metodii

europeana:record.dc:title: Seven Poems and a Fragment
europeana:record.dc:creator: Yeats, William Butler
europeana:record.dc:subject: 820 English & Old English literatures
europeana:record.dc:description: The National Library of Ireland has the world's largest collection of material related to the poet William Butler Yeats, including Seven Poems and a Fragment, published by the Cuala Press. Seven Poems is one of a number of books of poetry which eventually evolved into Yeats' great work The Tower, which was published in 1928. This copy is inscribed by the poet's sister, Elizabeth (Lolly) Yeats, to her uncle Samuel Gordon, as a gift at Christmas 1923, and came to the National Library through the generosity of the Yeats family. In June 2002, they donated the personal book collection of WB Yeats to the Library, just as they had donated his manuscript material over many years.

europeana:record.dc:title: Coins and weights in Russia before the end of the XVIII c.
Монета и вес в России до конца XVIII столетия
europeana:record.dc:creator: Прозоровский, Дмитрий Иванович (1820-1894)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 940 General history of Europe
europeana:record.dc:description: This major work from famous Russian archeologist, Dmitry Prozorovsky, is dedicated to Russian monetary metrology from its inception until the end of the 18th century. The work was highly regarded by many Russian scientists, including K. Bestuzhev-Ryumin and N. Kostomarov. Prozorovsky's work is supported by illustrations and tables and there is a inscription dedicated to P. Petrov on the front page of the original book.

Фундаментальный труд известного русского археолога, посвящен русской монетной метрологии с древнейших времен до конца 18-го века. Работа была высоко оценена К.Н. Бестужевым-Рюминым и Н.И. Костомаровым и другими учеными. Издание снабжено иллюстрациями, указателями имен и предметов, таблицами. На титульном листе оригинала воспроизводимой книги дарственная надпись автора П.Н. Петрову.
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Санкт-Петербург, издание Императорскаго археологическаго о-ва, (тип. и лит. А. Траншеля)

europeana:record.dc:title: Vladimir, Suzdal, Pereslavl-Zalesskiy : old relics and monuments
Владимир, Суздаль, Переславль-Залесский : [Путеводитель по памятникам старины]
europeana:record.dc:creator: Георгиевский, Василий Тимофеевич (1861-1923)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 720 Architecture;700 The Arts;200 Religion
europeana:record.dc:description: This book uncovers the history of some of the most important examples of ancient religious architecture and art works, from the towns and cities of the Vladimir-Suzdal’ principality. There are detailed descriptions of the Uspensky and Dmitrievsky cathedrals as well as Uspensky Knyaginin nunnery in Vladimir-town, Bogolyubov friary and Pokrov-on-Nerl-river church in Bogolyubovo, Holy Mother birth cathedral and Spaso-Efimiev friary and Pokrov nunnery in Suzdal. The descriptions of historical interiors of churches and cathedrals are of considerable interest because they were almost completely destroyed during Soviet times.

В книге рассказывается об истории и важнейших памятниках архитектуры и иконописания древних городов Владимиро-Суздальского княжества: Владимира, Суздаля, Переславля-Залесского. Подробно описывается Успенский и Дмитриевский соборы и Успенский Княгинин женский монастырь во Владимире; мужской Боголюбов монастырь и церковь Покрова на Нерли в Боголюбово; собор Рождества Пресвятой Богородицы и Спасо-Евфимиев мужской и Покровский женский монастыри в Суздале; Спасо-Преображенский собор, мужские Никитский и Троицкий Данилов и женский Феодоровский монастыри в Переславле-Залесском. Большую ценность представляют описания исторических интерьеров храмов описываемых городов и их ризниц, в значительной степени разрушенных в советское время.
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Санкт-Петербург, Ком. для устройства празднования трехсотлетия царствования дома Романовых

europeana:record.dc:title: History of the island of Cyprus from the English occupation until today vol.1
Ιστορία της Νήσου Κύπρου απο της αγγλικής κατοχής μέχρι σήμερον, μετά εισαγωγής περιλαμβάνουσης βραχείαν περιγραφήν της όλης ιστορίας αυτής, Τόμος Α'
europeana:record.dc:creator: Ζαννέτος, Φίλιος
europeana:record.dc:subject: 950 General history of Asia, Far East
europeana:record.dc:description: This extensive work by Filios Zannetos (1863-1933) covers the history of Cyprus from the ancient period to the first decade of the 20th century. While the historian, doctor and politician's work covered five volumes, only the first three were ever published.

Φίλιος Ζαννέτος (1863-1933), Ιστορικός, γιατρός και πολιτευτής.Πεντάτομο έργο, του οποίου εκδόθηκαν μόνο οι πρώτοι τρεις τόμοι. Καλύπτει την ιστορία της Κύπρου από τους αρχαίους χρόνους μέχρι το την πρώτη δεκαετία του 20ού αιώνα.

europeana:record.dc:title: Grammatica Litvanica...
europeana:record.dc:creator: Kleinas, Danielius
europeana:record.dc:subject: 410 Linguistics
europeana:record.dc:description: "Grammatica Litvanica..." by Lutheran pastor Danielius Kleinas (Daniel Klein, 1609-1666) is considered the first printed Lithuanian grammar. Author of the book is the most famous at that time Lithuanian philology specialist in Prussia. In addition to the grammar presented here, Kleinas in 1654 published a shorter Lithuanian grammar in German. "Grammatica Litvanica" was intended for Lithuanian language teachers. The author proved that, like other languages, Lithuanian has a coherent grammatical system, and discussed issues of codification of morphology and syntax. Kleinas’s grammar must have substituted for a textbook of Lithuanian and helped to prepare religious works. One of the weaknesses mentioned is that Lithuanian language has many dialects and it is quite inconstant language, where the same words in different regions use different terms. Original is stored at Vilnius University Library.

Evangelikų liuteronų kunigo Danieliaus Kleino (1609–1666) „Grammatica Litvanica...“ laikoma pirmąja spausdinta lietuvių kalbos gramatika. Knygos autorius – žymiausias to meto Prūsijos lituanistas. Be čia pristatomos gramatikos, D. Kleinas 1654 metais išleido ir trumpesnę lietuvių kalbos gramatiką vokiečių kalba. „Grammatica Litvanica“ skirta lietuvių kalbos mokytojams. Joje pirmą kartą sistemingai aprašyta lietuvių kalbos gramatinė sandara, nustatytos pastovesnės bendrinės kalbos normos, paremtos vakarų aukštaičių tarme. Įrodoma, kad lietuvių kalba turi darnią gramatinę sistemą, tačiau vienu iš minusų laikoma tai, kad lietuvių kalba turi daug tarmių ir esanti nenusistovėjusi kalba, kur tie patys žodžiai skirtingose regionuose vartojami kita prasme. Knyga saugoma Vilniaus universiteto bibliotekoje.
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Regiomonti, Typis et sumptibus Johannis Reusneri

europeana:record.dc:title: Please Sir!
Tanár úr kérem
europeana:record.dc:creator: Karinthy Frigyes (﻿1887-1938)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Magyar irodalom;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Frigyes Karinthy is known as the best and most popular humorous writer in Hungarian literature. In reality, however, he was a philosopher, the consistent follower of 18th century Enlightenment and 20th century scientific humanism, who was excited by and interested in everything. He conveyed his views through novels, short stories and humorous writings. Please Sir! is a collection of short stories and sketches written at the beginning of his career, a recollection of school day memories. Generations grew up reading it, laughing about the answers of the bad pupil, about the musing of the latecomer, the daydreams of the pupil in the terrible sports lesson. Throughout generations, common phrases from the book became maxims e.g. „I sell my book”, „hanging from the apparatus”, „we split our sides with laughing”. Unfortunately, Please Sir is rather known as entertaining literature for young people, though it has a serious message as well.

A magyar irodalomban Karinthy Frigyes a leghíresebb, legnépszerűbb, a legtöbbször olvasott, idézett, emlegetett humorista - holott tulajdonképpen filozófus volt. Egy izgatott, minden iránt érdeklődő filozófus, a XVIII. század felvilágosodásának legkövetkezetesebb és legtudatosabb utóda, a század tudományos igényű humanizmusának képviselője, aki bölcseleti életművet nem hagyott maga után, hanem kitűnő regényekben, gyönyörű novellákban, de nemegyszer mulatságos humoreszkekben fejezte ki különféle nézeteit és életfilozófiáját. Irodalmi munkásságának korai szakaszában írta meg diákkori emlékeinek kitűnő novella és karcolatgyűjteményét, a Tanár úr kérem-et, amely tizenöt humoreszk füzére. Életművének egyik legzseniálisabb, népszerűsége mellett is egyik legtitokzatosabb műve, a Tanár úr kérem. Nemzedékek nőttek fel rajta, kacagtak harsogva a rossz tanuló felelésén, az iskolából elkéső diák morfondírozásán, a tornaóra szörnyűségeit átélő álmain, nemzedékeknek vált szállóigéjévé az "eladom a könyvem", a "lógok a szeren", a "röhög az egész osztály". Általában azonban gyermekolvasmány maradt, pedig ez a kötet elsősorban és igazából mégiscsak valódi, felnőtteknek is szóló irodalom.

europeana:record.dc:title: Phantom Visions on the Horizon of Mood
Ködképek a kedély láthatárán
europeana:record.dc:creator: Kemény Zsigmond (﻿1814-1875)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Magyar irodalom;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Zsigmond Kemény is one of the most problematic figures among the classic writers of Hungarian literature. His view and oeuvre is a blend of backward conservative thoughts and advanced ideas. His pessimism is in accord with general disillusionment which characterized the period after the failure of the revolutions in 1849. In the Phantom Visions on the Horizon of Mood (1853) the main characters confront themselves and their own ideals, and inevitably become the victims of the dark forces of their fate.

A magyar irodalom klasszikusaink sorában Kemény Zsigmond az egyik legproblematikusabb alak. Szemléletében és életművében a maradi, visszahúzó eszmék és az előremutató, haladó vonások keverednek. Lényegében beletartozik abba a pesszimista világáradatba, amely 1849-ban, a forradalmak bukása utáni időszak általános kiábrándultságát jellemezte. Ez a pesszimista realizmus ihleti és jellemzi Kemény Zsigmond munkáit. A Ködképek a kedély láthatárán (1853) című regényének mindkét főhőse szembekerül önmagával és eszméivel, mígnem áldozatává válnak helyzetüknek, amelybe önhibájukon kívül, a sors kényszerítő ereje által kerültek.

europeana:record.dc:title: Husband and Woman
Férj és nő
europeana:record.dc:creator: Kemény Zsigmond (﻿1814-1875)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Magyar irodalom;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Zsigmond Kemény is one of the most problematic figures among the classic writers of Hungarian literature. His view and oeuvre is a blend of backward conservative thoughts and advanced ideas. His pessimism is in accord with general disillusionment which characterized the period after the failure of the revolutions in 1849. His works, including his novel the Husband and Woman published in 1852, are characterized by pessimistic realism, from romantic traditions towards realism. The protagonists of the novel are the members of the Norbert family, whose genre picture-like depiction is innovative in Hungarian literature. Through the confrontation of the noble and bourgeois characters the stark contrast between their respective egotism and Biedermeier intimacy is shown, concluding with the victory of the ordinary over extraordinary.

A magyar irodalom klasszikusaink sorában Kemény Zsigmond az egyik legproblematikusabb alak. Szemléletében és életművében a maradi, visszahúzó eszmék és az előremutató, haladó vonások keverednek. Lényegében beletartozik abba a pesszimista világáradatba, amely 1849-ban, a forradalmak bukása utáni időszak általános kiábrándultságát jellemezte. Ez a pesszimista realizmus ihleti és jellemzi Kemény Zsigmond munkáit, így az 1852-ben született a Férj és nő című regényét, amelyben a romantikus hagyományt már a realizmus irányába fejlesztette. A regény főszereplői a Norbert család tagjai, akiknek életképszerű ábrázolása újszerű a magyar irodalomban. Az ő sorsukon keresztül a nemesi család és a polgári hősök szembesítése során kerül markáns ellentétbe a felfokozott énkultusz és a meghitt, ámde igencsak kisszerű biedermeier bensőség. A férj és a nő „ütköztetése” a köznapi győzelmét jelenti a rendkívüli felett.

europeana:record.dc:title: Sign Language
Jelbeszéd
europeana:record.dc:creator: Karinthy Frigyes (﻿1887-1938)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Magyar irodalom;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Even as an adult, Karinthy retained the child-like ability of populating an uneventful world by his immense fantasy. He was able to record unbelievably intense experiences in a perfectly inanimate space. One of the early short stories in the Sign Language takes place in the sea bottom, featuring the drowned passengers of a sunken ship. The plot is not their past but their eternal present in the depth of the sea. Another short story records the visions of a pilot hurtling down, the last pictures that his shattered brain produces. In still another story, a young scientist is blown into space by atomic attraction, and experiences the giddy flight while in reality the deadly radium ray has paralysed his heart. The point of all his short stories is the question which the actual reality is: the factual one which can be observed from outside or the unprovable reality experienced from inside.

Karinthy felnőtt korára is megőrizte a gyermeki képességet, azt ugyanis, hogy határtalan fantáziája révén képes volt benépesíteni az olykor eseménytelen világot: hallatlanul intenzív élményeket tudott rögzíteni tökéletesen élettelen térben. A Jelbeszéd (ciklusai: Esik a hó; Ballada a néma férfiakról; Találkozás egy fiatalemberrel; Két hajó; Gyilkosok; Harun al Rasid; Hasműtét; Nevető betegek) egyik korai novellája a tenger fenekén játszódik, hősei egy elsüllyedt hajó vízbe fúlt utasai; - a cselekmény nem a múltjuk, nem - az örök jelenük, a tenger mélyén. Egy másik novella - egy lezuhant pilóta vízióit rögzíti, a szétroncsolt agyban lepergő utolsó képeket. Egy harmadik elbeszélésben egy fiatal tudóst a világűrbe repít a hallatlan erejű atomi vonzás, és ő átéli a szédítő repülést, pedig valójában a szívét bénította meg az alattomos rádiumsugár. Valójában? - a Karinthy-novella mindig lebegteti a döntést, hogy melyik az igazi valóság: az-e, amit a külső szemlélő lát, a kézzel fogható, vagy az, amelyet a szubjektum megtapasztal, és amelynek az igazsága nem ellenőrizhető.

europeana:record.dc:title: Young Lady at the Window : An Old Love Story
Panienka z okienka : starodawny romansik
europeana:record.dc:creator: Deotyma (1834 – 1908)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Deotyma, whose real name was Jadwiga Łuszczewska (1834 – 1908), was a poet, novelist, and famous improviser. The Warsaw elite of the second part of the 19th century used to meet in her literary salon. Deotyma forbade her guests to speak on two subjects only: erotic and patriotic. Her most famous novel "Young Lady in the Window" (today read by young readers) is often reprinted and was even made into an opera as well as a film. The action of the book takes place in 17th Century Gdańsk and tells the tale of a love of Kazimierz, a Polish soldier in the navy, for Hedwig, a girl saved from Turkish captivity and raised by a rich artisan in Gdańsk. While trying to win her hand in marriage, Kazimierz gets himself into all kinds of trouble but also reveals a secret which links him to his beloved’s family in an unusual way.

Deotyma, wł. Jadwiga Łuszczewska (1834 – 1908), to poetka, powieściopisarka, słynna improwizatorka. W jej literackim salonie spotykała się warszawska elita II połowy XIX wieku.; Deotyma swoim gościom zabroniła poruszania dwóch tematów: erotycznego i patriotycznego. Jej najpopularniejsza powieść "Panienka z okienka" (do dziś czytana przez małoletnich czytelników) ciągle jest wznawiana, doczekała się przeróbki na operę i została sfilmowana. Akcja książki rozgrywa się w siedemnastowiecznym Gdańsku, a opowiada o miłości Kazimierza, żołnierza polskiej floty wojennej, do Hedwigi – dziewczyny uratowanej w dzieciństwie z tureckiej niewoli i wychowanej przez bogatego gdańskiego rzemieślnika. Próbując zdobyć jej rękę, Kazimierz nie tylko wdaje się w liczne awantury, ale także wyjaśnia tajemnicę, która w niezwykły sposób łączy go z rodziną ukochanej.

europeana:record.dc:title: Menaion for June-August with Synaxarion from the second half of the 13th c.
Миней с пролози за юни-август от втората половина на ХІІІ в.
europeana:record.dc:creator: unknown
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books;200 Religion
europeana:record.dc:description: This parchment manuscript of the Menaion originates from the second half of the 13th century. It is the This parchment manuscript of the Menaion for June-August with Synaxarion is datable to the second half of the 13th century. The beginning and the end of the codex are missing. Nevertheless its importance is determined by the fact that it is the earliest known manuscript which includes the service of St. Ioakim Osogovski (Joachim of Osogovo), hermit and founder of the monastery known as Sarandapor. His cult, celebrated on 16 August, was popular in Bulgaria and on the Balkans in the Middle Ages and the time of National Revival.

Пергаментният ръкописен Миней с пролози за юни-август се датира от втората половина на ХІІІ век. Началото и краят на кодекса липсват. Това е най-ранният известен ръкопис, съдържащ службата за св. Йоаким Осоговски, отшелник и основател на манастира Сарандапор. Неговата памет, чествана на 16 август, е популярна в България и на Балканския полуостров в Средновековието и по време на Възраждането.
europeana:record.dc:source: St. Cyril and St. Methodius National Library
Natsionalna biblioteka Sv. Sv. Kiril i Metodii

europeana:record.dc:title: Song of the Wheatfields
Ének a búzamezőkről
europeana:record.dc:creator: Móra Ferenc (﻿1879-1934)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Magyar irodalom;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Ferenc Móra, who was a writer, journalist, library and museum director, became one of the most popular Hungarian authors still in his lifetime. He rose to fame partly through his excellent works for young readers. His chief work is the novel entitled Song of the Wheatfields (1927) which can be likened to a heroic epic without heroes about the joys and sorrows of Hungarian village life, written with a strong lyrical touch and with intricate elaboration of characters. The novel revolves around the tragedies of First World War, yet not of those of the soldiers fighting at the front lines, but of those remaining at home in the hinterland. His characters living in remote farmsteads are only guided in the labyrinth of life by their innate human wisdom. The tragical turns have a ballad-like, rather than romantic, colouring, which makes the novel a unique contribution to Hungarian fiction.

Az író, újságíró, könyvtár- és múzeumigazgató Móra Ferenc már életében is a legnépszerűbb magyar szerzők közé tartozott, ifjúsági műveivel is nagy népszerűségnek örvend mind a mai napig. Főműve az 1927-ben megjelent Ének a búzamezőkről – a legszebb magyar regények egyike –, amely a magyar falu örömeinek és bánatainak lírai finomságú, kitűnő lélekrajzzal formált, hősök nélküli hőskölteménye. A regény komor témája az első világháború, de nem a harctereken sínylődő katonákról szól elsősorban, hanem azokról a tragédiákról, amelyek a hátországban játszódnak le. Csodálatosan megrajzolt emberi jellemei a tanyavilág egyszerű életét élik, amelyben az egyszerű parasztembert a maga bölcsessége átsegíti az élet útvesztőin. A történetet tragikus, mégis csodálatos bájjal írta meg a szerző, a tragikus fordulatokat nem romantikus színezéssel, hanem balladás árnyalatokkal jeleníti meg, ami különös helyet jelöl ki a műnek a magyar regényirodalom térképén.

europeana:record.dc:title: A Letter of a Landowner to a Certain Friend from Another District
List ziemianina do pewnego przyiaciela z inszego woiewodztwa
europeana:record.dc:creator: Poniatowski, Stanisław (1675-1762)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 320 Political science
europeana:record.dc:description: Stanisław Poniatowski (1675-1762) was a politician whose performance of important governmental functions led to the growing power of the Poniatowski family. He was the father of the last King of Poland, Stanisław II August Poniatowski (1732-1798). "Letter from a Landowner..." contained a comprehensive programme for the country's reparation, which suggested increasing the size of the army, introducing Treasury and judiciary reforms, amending the regulations concerning parliament as well as regional assemblies and limiting the Liberum veto, which was a parliamentary device in the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth allowing any member of the Sejm to force an immediate end to the current session and nullify all legislation already passed at it. "Letter of a Landowner..." also proposed reforming the economic system (introducing mercantilism and the development of industry).

Stanisław Poniatowski (1675-1762) - polityk pełniący ważne funkcje państwowe, twórca potęgi rodu Poniatowskich, ojciec ostatniego króla Polski - Stanisława Augusta Poniatowskiego (1732-1798). "List ziemianina…" zawierał wszechstronny program naprawy państwa polskiego. W programie autor proponuje zwiększenie liczebności armii, przeprowadzenie reform skarbu i sądownictwa, zmianę regulaminu sejmu i sejmików, ograniczenie Liberum veto (zasada ustrojowa dająca prawo każdemu z posłów biorących w obradach sejmu do zerwania i unieważnienia podjętych uchwał). Postuluje też generalną reformę systemu ekonomicznego i gospodarczego (wprowadzenie polityki merkantylistycznej, rozwój przemysłu).

europeana:record.dc:title: Russian army history, iss. 1
История русской армии, вып. 1.
europeana:record.dc:creator: Михеев, Сергей Петрович (1869-?)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 920 Biography, genealogy, insignia;940 General history of Europe
europeana:record.dc:description: The conception of the Russian regular army during Peter the Great's reign is revealed in this historical account of Russian warfare during the first half of the 18th century. As well as the arrival of the regular army, there are also accounts of the remarkable battles at Narvatown (1700), Lesnaya village (1708) and Poltava city (1709). The later editions of the book also highlight the condition of the Russian army post Peter the Great, with examples from the triumphant Kunersdorf battle (1759) fought under Friedrikh the Second during the Septenary War (1756-1763).

Первый выпуск посвящен истории создания русской регулярной армии в эпоху Петра I и ее наиболее значимым сражениям в первой половине XVIII в.: под Нарвой (1700), у д. Лесной (1708) и под Полтавой (1709). В двух последних очерках делается краткий обзор состояния русской армии при преемниках Петра I и описывается победоносное Кунерсдорфское сражение (1759) русских войск под командованием графа Салтыкова с армией прусского короля Фридриха II в ходе Семилетней войны (1756-1763).
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Москва, издание С. Михеева и А. Казачкова

europeana:record.dc:title: Political correspondence of Ekaterina the Great, the Russian Empress. Part 3 (1764-1766)
Политическая переписка императрицы Екатерины II. Ч. 3. 1764-1766г.
europeana:record.dc:subject: 320 Political science;920 Biography, genealogy, insignia;940 General history of Europe
europeana:record.dc:description: Part 3. (1764-1766). The volume was issued by F. Buller with the assistance of magister V. Uliyanitskiy.
Часть 3-ая (годы с 1764 по 1766). Том издан бароном Ф.А.Бюлером, при содействии магистра В.А.Уляницкаго

europeana:record.dc:title: Kypriaka : geography, history and language of the island of Cyprus from ancient times until today, vol.2
Τα κυπριακά ήτοι γεωγραφία, ιστορία και γλώσσα της νήσου Κύπρου από των αρχαιοτάτων χρόνων μέχρι σήμερον. τόμος Β', η εν Κύπρω γλώσσα
europeana:record.dc:creator: Σακελλάριος, Αθανάσιος
europeana:record.dc:subject: 950 General history of Asia, Far East
europeana:record.dc:description: Athanasios Sakellarios (1826-1901), a Greek educator and writer, laid the foundations of Cypriot folklore research. His two books represent an extensive account of Cypriot language, archaeology, local customs and geography.

Αθανάσιος Σακελλάριος (1826-1901), Ελλαδίτης εκπαιδευτικός και συγγραφέας. Έθεσε τα θεμέλια της κυπριακής λαογραφικής έρευνας. Τα βιβλία του περιλαμβάνουν τη μελέτη της γεωγραφίας, ιστορίας, λαογραφίας και γλώσσα της Κύπρου.

europeana:record.dc:title: The Life and Adventures. 1
Живот и прикљученија. 1
europeana:record.dc:creator: Обрадовић, Доситеј
europeana:record.dc:subject: 800 - Literature
europeana:record.dc:description: Dositej Obradovic (Ciacova, Romania, around 1739 - Belgrade, 1811) - Serbian author, philosopher, illuminator, minister of education. This work is the leading book of the Serbian Age of Enlightenment.
Доситеј (Димитрије) Обрадовић (Чаково, Румунија, око 1739 - Београд, 1811), књижевник, просветитељ, министар просвете. Књига је водеће дело српског просветитељства.

europeana:record.dc:title: Kypriaka : geography, history and language of the island of Cyprus from ancient times until today vol.1
Τα κυπριακά ήτοι , πραγματεία περί γεωγραφίας, αρχαιολογίας, στατιστικής, ιστορίας, μυθολογίας και διαλέκτου της Κύπρου, τόμος Α'
europeana:record.dc:creator: Σακελλάριος Αθανάσιος Α.
europeana:record.dc:subject: 950 General history of Asia, Far East
europeana:record.dc:description: Athanasios Sakellarios (1826-1901), a Greek educator and writer, laid the foundations of Cypriot folklore research. His two books represent an extensive account of Cypriot language, archaeology, local customs and geography.

Αθανάσιος Σακελλάριος (1826-1901), Ελλαδίτης εκπαιδευτικός και συγγραφέας. Έθεσε τα θεμέλια της κυπριακής λαογραφικής έρευνας. Τα βιβλία του περιλαμβάνουν τη μελέτη της γεωγραφίας, ιστορίας, λαογραφίας και γλώσσα της Κύπρου.

europeana:record.dc:title: A List of Russian war ships since 1668 to 1860
Список русских военных судов с 1668 по 1860 год
europeana:record.dc:creator: Веселаго, Феодосий Федорович (1817-1895)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 030 General encyclopedic works;600 General technology;620 Engineering & allied operations
europeana:record.dc:description: Feodosiy F. Veselago's (1817-1895) study of Russian fleet history is considered to be the one of the most valuable guides to this area of Russian history. The navy historian and a navy navigators corps general, has compiled a list of over 3300 Russian navy vessels beginning with the father of the Russian fleet – the famous Peter the Great’s boat. Names and titles of vessels, number of cannons, tonnage, principal dimensions, the time when vessels were keel-laid and put afloat, names of designers, peculiarities of vessel constructions and the noticeable accidents during the service life of the vessels, are all recorded in this comprehensive guide to naval history.

Феодосий Фёдорович Веселаго (27 марта (8 апреля) 1817 года — 17 (29) октября 1895 года) — русский историк военно-морского флота, генерал корпуса флотских штурманов. Он начинается с родоначальника русского флота - знаменитого ботика Петра I. В десяти графах "Списка" помещены следующие сведения: название и ранг судна, число орудий, водоизмещение, главные размерения, время закладки и время спуска на воду, место постройки, имя строителя, особенности конструкции и замечательные случаи в течение службы судна, время и место ремонта, слома или гибели. Этот труд, заключающий в себе достоверные сведения более чем о 3300 судах, до сих пор остается лучшим справочником для всех, кто занимается историей отечественного судостроения.

europeana:record.dc:title: Essays on old Russian art of building
Очерки по истории древнерусскаго зодчества академика архитектуры В. В. Суслова
europeana:record.dc:creator: Суслов, Владимир Васильевич (1859-1921)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 720 Architecture;200 Religion
europeana:record.dc:description: This book by famous Russian architect and historian, V.V Suslov is a study of the country's church architecture from the 17th to th 18th centuries. Published by kind permission of the Imperial Academy of Arts, it places special attention on the use of the three-bladed shape in ancient Russian churches including the cathedrals of the Moscow Kremlin, Zvenigorod, Big Novgorod, and Pskov. With the aide of five sketches, the author explores the use and enduring appeal of this unique architectural style. South Russia's little studied wooden memorials are also a mention for their place in the country's architectural history.

Исследование известного русского архитектора и историка архитектуры, академика (с 1886) В.В.Суслова (1857-1921) посвящено изучению памятников церковного зодчества России XII-XVIII вв. Книга была издана с разрешения Императорской Академии Художеств, состоит из пяти самостоятельных очерков. Внимание В.В. Суслова привлекают трехлопастная форма покрытия древнерусских церквей, встречающаяся в храмах Московского Кремля, Звенигорода, Великого Новгорода, Пскова и др. городах страны, а также слабо изученные в конце XIX в. памятники деревянного зодчества в Южной России. Объектом его изучения стали церкви XVII-XVIII вв. Области Войска Донского, малороссийских казаков и Галиции, которые, несмотря на разные регионы страны и время постройки, были построены, по мнению исследователя, в едином архитектурном стиле.

europeana:record.dc:title: Description of all the folks living in Russia as well as their life traditions, habits, clothes and other memorablenesses. Part 2;: The Tartars
Описание всех в Российском государстве обитающих народов, также их житейских обрядов, вер, обыкновений, жилищ, одежд и прочих достопамятностей. Часть вторая. О народах татарскаго племени
europeana:record.dc:creator: Георги, Иван Иванович 1729-1802
europeana:record.dc:subject: 900 Geography & History;940 General history of Europe
europeana:record.dc:description: The structure of this book is based upon the historical-linguistical and geographical principle of the classification of folk customs. The Russian edition has gravures placed in the text of the book, in the German version the gravures are attached separately with references to the text. Descriptions of the clothes of different folk groups are also provided.

Структура книги соответствует историко-лингвистическому и и географическому принципу классификации сказок и сказаний. Руссское издание снабжено гравюрами, которые расположены в тексте книги. В немецком варианте гравюры напечатаны отдельны и снабжены ссылками на тест издания. Одежда различных народов представлена описаниях.
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Санкт-Петербург, При артиллерийском и инженерном шляхетном Кадетском корпусе И.К. Шнором

europeana:record.dc:title: Description of all the folks living in th Russia as well as their life traditions, habits, clothes and other memorablenesses. Part 1: Suomi folk
Описание всех в Российском государстве обитающих народов, также их житейских обрядов, вер, обыкновений, жилищ, одежд и прочих достопамятностей. Часть первая. О народах финскаго племени
europeana:record.dc:creator: Георги, Иван Иванович 1729-1802
europeana:record.dc:subject: 940 General history of Europe;900 Geography & History
europeana:record.dc:description: The structure of this book is based upon the historical-linguistical and geographical principle of the classification of folk customs. The Russian edition has gravures placed in the text of the book, in the German version the gravures are attached separately with references to the text. Descriptions of the clothes of different folk groups are also provided.

Структура издания И.Г. Георги основана на историко-лингвистическом принципе классификации народов в сочетании с географическим. В русском издании гравюры помещены по ходу повествования среди листов текста, в немецком варианте они напечатаны отдельным приложением, а в самой книге имеется их перечень. Сведения об одежде присутствуют в описаниях большинства народов.
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Санкт-Петербург, При артиллерийском и инженерном шляхетном Кадетском корпусе И.К. Шнором

europeana:record.dc:title: Russian orthodox church history
История русской церкви
europeana:record.dc:creator: Филарет (Гумилевский, Дмитрий Григорьевич; 1805-1866)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 270 Christian church history
europeana:record.dc:description: An abridged version of the 'Russian Church History' was firstly published in 1859 before being republished many times by the order of the Holiest Synod. The Eminent Filaret (Dmitry Grigorievitch Gumilevskiy, 1805-1866), a Russian theologian and a church historian, taught the 'Russian Church History'. His views took the same orthodox-monarchical position as Russian political historians, Nikolay Karamzin and Nikolay Ustryalov.

Филарет (в миру Гумилевский Дмитрий Григорьевич) (1805—1866), богослов и историк Церкви. Историю Русской церкви преосвященный Филарет излагал с тех же православно-монархических позиций, с которых излагали политическую историю России Н. М. Карамзин и Н. Г. Устрялов. В сокращенном виде «История русской церкви» впервые была издана в 1859 и потом, как учебник, много раз издавалась по определению Св. Синода.

europeana:record.dc:title: A historical panorama of Saint-Petersburg and its surroundings, part 3
Историческая панорама Санкт-Петербурга и его окрестностей, ч.3: Петербург эпохи Александра I и Николая I, 1801-1855 г.
europeana:record.dc:subject: 700 The Arts;720 Architecture;730 Plastic arts, sculpture
europeana:record.dc:description: The third part of “A Historical Panorama of St. Petersburg and its Surroundings” album set is devoted to the city's classical and empire style epoch statues and architecture. The album includes work from Giacomo Antonio Domenico Quarenghi (Guarenghi) (1744 – 1817), Jean-François Thomas de Thomon(1760 – 1813), Andrey Voronikhin (1759 – 1814) and Carlo di Giovanni Rossi (1775 – 1849). There are 40 photogravures of famous architectural and sculptural features of St. Petersburg, as well as classical style furniture.

Санкт-Петербург – столица России в 1712 – 1918 гг., резиденция российских императоров. Исторический центр Санкт-Петербурга входит в Список культурного наследия ЮНЕСКО. Третий выпуск серии альбомов «Историческая панорама Санкт-Петербурга и его окрестностей» посвящен архитектуре и скульптуре эпохе классицизма и ампира. Рассмотрено творчество следующих известных архитекторов: Джакомо Кваренги (1744 – 1817, Giacomo Antonio Domenico Quarenghi (Guarenghi); Жан Тома де Томон (1760 – 1813, Jean-François Thomas de Thomon); Андрей Воронихин (1759 – 1814); Карл Росси (1775 – 1849, Carlo di Giovanni Rossi); Огюст Монферран (1786 - 1858, Henri Louis Auguste Ricard de Montferrand); Андреян Захаров (1761 – 1811); Василий Стасов (1769 – 1848), скульптора Петра Клодта (1805 – 1867, Peter Clodt von Jürgensburg) Издание содержит 40 фото-тинто-гравюр на отдельных листах, изображающих наиболее известные архитектурные и скульптурные ансамбли Санкт-Петербурга, а также художественную мебель периода классицизма.

europeana:record.dc:title: Walking in the Winds
Käik tuultesse
europeana:record.dc:creator: Marie Under, Märt Laarman
europeana:record.dc:subject: Estonian, fiction, poems, woodcut;Estonian, fiction, poems, woodcut
europeana:record.dc:description: This bibliophilic woodcut book by the graphic artist Märt Laarman (1896-1979)was created in homage to 15th century block books. These early woodcut books were meticulously arranged with each page printed from a different block, with engraved illustrations and text. Laarman's version includes the poem 'Walking in the Winds' by the poet Marie Under (1883-1980). Only 130 copies were ever produced. Copies 1-60 were printed on Japanese paper (torinoko kozu) and copies 61-130 on antique handmade paper produced by Zanders. Copy number 20 is signed by the authors.

Graafik Märt Laarmani (1896-1979) valmistatud puulõikeline bibliofiilne raamat poetess Marie Underi (1883-1980) luuletusega "Käik tuultesse". Väljaanne meenutab välimuselt 15. sajandi plokkraamatuid, kus iga lehekülg trükiti eri puulõikeklotsilt ning graveeritud on nii illustratsioonid kui ka tekst. Nummerdatud väljaande trükiarv on 130 eksemplari. Neist eksemparid 1-60 on trükitud jaapani paberile (torinoko kozu), 61-130 Zandersi antiikkäsipaberile.
Eksemplar number 20, autorite signeeritud.

europeana:record.dc:title: Apologia
Apologia
europeana:record.dc:creator: Dávid Ferenc (﻿1510?-1579)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Vallás;240 Christian moral & devotional theology
europeana:record.dc:description: Ferenc Dávid was a Transylvanian Nontrinitarian and Unitarian preacher, the founder of the Unitarian Church of Transylvania. His Apologia consists of three parts: describes the verbal debate of Ferenc Dávid and Gáspár Heltai with the slightly Unitarian Francesco Stancaro, describes the 59 propositions of the Transylvanian Lutherans, finally answers the charges of Stancaro. The only copy of Dávid’s work is in the National Széchényi Library since 1912.

Dávid Ferenc az erdélyi unitárius egyház megalapítója és első püspöke. Apologia című munkája három részből áll: bemutatja Dávid Ferencnek és Heltai Gáspárnak az unitárius irányba hajló Francesco Stancaróval 1557-ben folytatott szóbeli vitáját, az erdélyi evangélikusoknak Krisztus istenségére és közbenjáró tisztére vonatkozó ötvenkilenc tételét, végül Stancaro vádjaira válaszol. A mű egyetlen példánya 1912-ben került az Országos Széchényi Könyvtárba.

europeana:record.dc:title: The Estonian Book 1535-1935 : historical review, numerical summaries, reproductions
Eesti raamat 1535-1935 : arengulooline ülevaade, arvulised kokkuvõtted, reproduktsioonid
europeana:record.dc:creator: Richard Antik
europeana:record.dc:subject: Estonian, book history;Estonian, book history
europeana:record.dc:description: The Estonian Book' (1535-1935) was produced to mark the 400th anniversary of the first publication in the Estonian language. The work by Richard Antik, published in 1936, provides an historical overview of the original Estonian book. It contains numerous illustrations, among them fragments of images from the original book and a catechism by Wanradt-Koell. Over 675 paginated de luxe and 225 ordinary copies of the book were made. This is copy number 574.

1935. aastal tähistati 400 aasta möödumist esimese eestikeelse raamatu ilmumisest. Sündmust märkis ka Richard Antiku "Eesti raamat 1535-1935", mis ilmus 1936. aastal. See on arengulooline ülevaade eesti raamatu ajaloost, mis sisaldab rohkesti illustratsioone, sealhulgas ka vanimast fragmentidena säilinud eestikeelse tekstiga raamatust, Wanradt-Koelli katekismusest. Raamatust on tehtud 675 nummerdatud luksuseksemplari ja 225 lihteksemplari.
Eksemplar number 574.

europeana:record.dc:title: János Rimay collected poems
Rimay János összes költeménye
europeana:record.dc:creator: Rimay János
europeana:record.dc:subject: Magyar irodalom;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: A contemporary and fellow-poet of Bálint Balassi, he followed his master in poetical forms, and became the advocate of Christian penitence and Stoical virtues. His whole oeuvre was based on Neostoical thought and on the intensive correspondence with his contemporaries. In his carefully constructed works, epics and lyrics, the epical traditions of Homer and Virgil and the influence of Balassi exist harmonically side by side. His style was characterised by the complex imagery of mannerism, his works are interwoven with philosophical thoughts. He considered the poetry of Balassi the tradition to be followed in Hungarian literature, and on his track he endeavoured to refine the Hungarian poetic language. He created an allegorical and mythological poetry with complex imagery, the originality of which was underlined by his refined rhymes. He gives voice to the principles of Horace and Epictetus, combined with Christian values, celebrating the `golden mean`. Posterity was mostly preoccupied with his poems to God.

Balassi Bálint kor- és költőtársa, majd irodalmi eszményének és emlékének továbbörökítője. Újsztoikus eszmei alapokra és a kortársakkal fönntartott intenzív szellemi kapcsolatokra épült a munkássága, egész verselő művészete. Gondosan szerkesztett műveiben harmonikusan elegyedik az epikum és a líra, a homéroszi-vergiliusi eposz-hagyomány, Balassi hatása. Formai tekintetben is mesterét követte, de azt erősen átstilizálva a keresztény bűnbánat és a sztoikus erények képviselőjévé vált. Stílusát a manierizmus bonyolult képalkotása jellemzi, miközben filozofikus gondolatokat sző műveibe. Balassi költészetét tekintette a magyar irodalom követendő hagyományának, eszményének, és ezen a nyomvonalon törekedett a magyar nyelv költői alkalmazásának tökéletesítésére. A Balassi-utánzásból erősen allegorikus, mitologikus, összetett képalkotású költészetet növesztett, amelyet rafinált rímtechnika is egyénít. A sztoicizmus, Epiktétosz ás Horatius elveit szólaltatja meg magyarul – keresztény értékekkel és életbölcsességekkel együtt, amellyel az „arany középutat” dicsőíti. Az utókor kivált istenes költészetére reflektált.

europeana:record.dc:title: The Book of Hungarian Fishing
A Magyar halászat könyve
europeana:record.dc:creator: Herman Ottó
europeana:record.dc:subject: Néprajz;390 Customs, etiquette, folklore
europeana:record.dc:description: As one of the last Hungarian polyhistors, Ottó Herman left to us a wide-ranging academic heritage, the most lasting of which is his contribution to ornithology and ethnography. One of his most important works “The Book of Hungarian Fishing”, a monograph in two volumes. Fortunately, he concentrated not only on fish but also on the man catching fish. Thus he addressed all possible aspects of fish and fishing: their relations with society, the origins and archaeological remains of fishing, fishing methods and the language of fishing and fishermen’s lives. His field work was supplemented by well organized data collection and careful philological research. This is why the book is a treasure trove of Hungarian ethnography as well.

Herman Ottó az utolsó magyar polihisztorok egyikeként szerteágazó tudományos életművet hagyott hátra. Legnagyobb léptékű műve A Magyar halászat könyve című kétkötetes monográfia. Szerencsénkre nem csak a halakra, hanem a halat fogó emberre is kíváncsi volt, feldolgozta a hal és a halászat minden elképzelhető témakörét: ember és társadalom viszonyát a halhoz, a halfogás eredetét, régészeti emlékeit, a halfogás módszereit, eszközeit valamint a halak biológiáját, a hal és a halászélet nyelvkincsét. A terepmunkát jól szervezett anyaggyűjtés és gondos filológiai kutatás egészítette ki. Munkája során a történelmi Magyarország szinte valamennyi folyó- és állóvizét felkereste, így vált műve a magyar néprajztudománynak is kincsesbányájává.

europeana:record.dc:title: Mihály Vörösmarty collected poems
Vörösmarty Mihály összes költeményei
europeana:record.dc:creator: Vörösmarty Mihály
europeana:record.dc:subject: Magyar irodalom;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: The poetry of Vörösmarty became a poetical standard still in his lifetime. His fame was established by the Flight of Zalán, which is a national epic about the conquest of the country and a characteristic piece of the lyrics of the Reform Age. It represents Vörösmarty’s intent of awakening the nation and his simultaneous gloom, enthusiasm and resignation. His narrative poems and dramatic pieces amalgamate elements of historical parables and fairy tales. His epigrams recall the historical past while addressing the questions of the Reform Age. His patriotic poems (Appeal) are the most enduring, while his odes and philosophical poems (Thoughts in the Library) and his love poems (To a Dreamer) are also significant. The most impactful representative of Romanticism, he portrays extreme heroes and situations in his works. In his later poetry, he expresses his immense grief felt on the failure of the War of Independence with cosmic images.

Vörösmarty költészete már a költő életében mindenki számára klasszikus példa volt. Hírnevét a Zalán futása alapozta meg, amely a honfoglalás eposza, a reformkori magyar líra egyik igen jellegzetes darabja. Már ez az alkotás mutatta a teljes életmű ama jellegzetességét, hogy nemzetébresztő szándék és borongás, rajongás és lemondás egyszerre van jelen. Eposzaiban, elbeszélő költeményeiben, színműveiben ott kavarog a történelmi példázat (A búvár Kund) és a tündérmese (Csongor és Tünde). Epigrammái a múltat idézik, miközben a reformkor törekvéseit szolgálják. Hazafias lírája (Szózat) a legmaradandóbb, miközben nagy lélegzetű ódákat, filozófiai töltetű verseket (Gondolatok a könyvtárban) és szerelmes darabokat egyként írt (A merengőhöz). A romantika egyik legnagyobb hatású képviselője, darabjaiban végzetes helyzeteket és végletes hősöket jelenít meg. Kései költészetében kozmikus képekkel érzékelteti a forradalom és szabadságharc bukása fölött érzett fájdalmát, a szabadság elvesztésének tragikumát, és szinte emberiség léptékű víziókat, mitikus verseket alkot a reményvesztettségről és a nemzethalálról.

europeana:record.dc:title: The Life of Great Hungarians
Nagy magyarok élete
europeana:record.dc:creator: Benedek Elek
europeana:record.dc:subject: Történelem;940 General history of Europe
europeana:record.dc:description: Elek Benedek started working on his great enterprise of creating a biographical collection of the luminaries of Hungarian history and culture in 1905. It was during this time that he left off journalism in favour of his true inclinations as a fiction writer. His literary stance is characterised by turning away from the disenchanting world of the turn of the century and looking back into the past to find good examples for the edification of his favourite audience: children and young people. This is also why he uses romantical and idealized character delineation and an elevated style. He chose figures of historical significance and moral integrity: models of faithfulness (Kelemen Mikes); will power (Sándor Kőrösi Csoma, the finder of the land of origin of the Magyars); unbreakable will (Miklós Wesselényi), love of the country (Ferenc Kölcsey) and persistent efforts for making the country flourish (István Széchenyi).

Benedek Elek 1905-ben kezdett bele nagyszabású vállalkozásába, a magyar történelem és szellemi múlt nagyjainak életrajzi gyűjteménye megalkotásába. Miután fölhagyott az újságírással, engedett alkata elrendelésének, valódi írói hajlamának és "visszanéző író" lett; elfordult a századelő kiábrándító világától és a múltat vizsgálta, hogy példaképeket mutathasson föl legkedvesebb olvasóinak, a gyerekeknek, a fiataloknak. Ez magyarázza portréinak romantikus stílusát, érzelmességét, idealizáló módszerét. Olyan alakokat választott ki a nemzet történelméből, akik nem csupán históriai jelentőségűek, de emberi karakterük is megörökítésre méltó. Az ő felfogásában a nemzet hajdani nagyságai nagyszerű jellemvonások megtestesítői is - a válogatásban szereplők közül Mikes Kelemen a hűség példaképe, az őshazát kutató Kőrösi Csoma Sándor az akarat bajnoka, Wesselényi Miklóst a törhetetlen akarat, Kölcsey Ferencet a testi gyengeséget legyőző hazaszeretet, Széchenyi Istvánt a nemzet felvirágoztatásának szívós és céltudatos szolgálata jellemzi. Benedek Elek művével az ifjúságot kívánta nevelni, stílusa ezért a példaképteremtő szándékhoz illően emelkedett.

europeana:record.dc:title: The Experienced Vintner
Искусниј подрумар
europeana:record.dc:creator: Орфелин, Захарија - аутор
europeana:record.dc:subject: 664 - Food technology
europeana:record.dc:description: One of the first book of popular science literature on agriculture (winemaking).
Једна од првих књига научно-популарне литературе из области пољопривреде (винарства).

europeana:record.dc:title: Bible
Библия
europeana:record.dc:subject: 200 Religion
europeana:record.dc:description: This is the first edition of the Bible published in Moscow and the first cartographic resource engraved by a Russian master. The text of the book was a re-edition of the 1581 Ostrog-city Bible, with a few small changes. The Introduction to the “Pious reader” says: "published on the base of the translation without changes except orthography and some of the names and speeches”. The text is published in two columns with a "biblical" font created especially for the edition by master caster, F. Popov. The Frontispiece of the book represent scenes from the Old and the New Testament and citations from the Good Book along with a two-headed eagle representing Czar the Rider, with map of Moscow on its breast.

Первое московское издание Библии. Текст книги явился переизданием, с незначительными изменениями, Острожской Библии 1581 г. В предисловии к «Читателю благочестивому» сказано: «издати с готового перевода, князя Константина Острозскаго печати, неизменно, кроме орфографии и неких вмале имен и речений нужднейших, явственных погрешений» (л. 2 об.). Текст отпечатан в два столбца малым шрифтом, специально отлитым для этого издания мастером Ф.И. Поповым. По изданию, в котором впервые был употреблен, получил название «библейного». Фронтиспис книги представляет собой сложную многоуровневую композицию с изображениями сцен из Ветхого и Нового Заветов, цитатами из Священного Писания, двуглавого орла с изображением всадника-царя на груди и плана города Москвы. Это первый картографический источник, гравированный русским мастером.

europeana:record.dc:title: Moscow sanctity guide
Путеводитель по Московской святыне
europeana:record.dc:creator: Рычин, Федор Иванович
europeana:record.dc:subject: 200 Religion;230 Christian theology;250 Christian orders & local church;720 Architecture
europeana:record.dc:description: This illustrated guide details the orthodox relics of the Moscow Kremlin and the surrounding area. Major works of architectural interest include the cathedral of the Assumption with its library and sacristy, the cathedral of Archangel Michael and the court churches and cathedrals of the cathedral of the Nativity of the Blessed Virgin. Relics located outside the Kremlin are also discussed, including the cathedral of Christ the Savior, the Kazan Cathedral, St. Basil’s cathedral and the Gates of the Resurrection with the Iviron chapel. The book also relays statistical data on the number of Moscow cathedrals and churches, as well as on the Moscow priesthood. The book contains 25 separate gravures of areas of Russian religous interest.

Путеводитель по православным святыням Московского Кремля и его ближайших окрестностей. Успенский собор Кремля: мощи святых, гробницы Патриархов Московских. Ризница и библиотека Успенского собора. Крестные ходы, совершаемые из Успенского собора. Другие соборы Кремля: Архангельский, Благовещенский, Верхоспасский, Спасо-Преображенский (Спас на Бору). Придворные соборы и церкви: Рождества Богородицы, св. Екатерины, Распятия Христова, Воскресения св. Лазаря. Чудов и Вознесенский монастыри. Патриарший (Синодальный) дворец. Патриаршая библиотека и ризница. Святыни вне Кремля: храм Христа Спасителя, Казанский собор, Покровский собор (церковь Василия Блаженного), Воскресенские ворота с Иверской часовней. Список чудотворных икон Москвы. Статистические сведения о числе соборов, церквей и монастырей Москвы и численности московского духовенства. Книга содержит 25 иллюстраций (гравюр) на отдельных листах.
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Москва, типолитогр. И. Н. Кушнерева и К°

europeana:record.dc:title: A Description of herbs OF Russian State accompanied with illustrations
Описание растений Российскаго государства с их изображениями
europeana:record.dc:creator: Паллас, Петр Симон (1741-1811)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 580 Botanical sciences
europeana:record.dc:description: This book marks the beginnings of the first research in to Russian flora. Author Peter S. Pallas, a famous naturalist, was born in Berlin but worked on a large number of Russian scientific expeditions from 1767-1810 . The books gravures of plants were made on the base of Karl F. Knappe’s drawings and were subsequently variegated with watercolour.

Одно из первых фундаментальных исследований, посвященных изучению растительного мира России. Автор книги, П.С. Паллас, знаменитый естествоиспытатель, уроженец Берлина. С 1767 по 1810 г. жил и работал в России, участник и организатор многих научных экспедиций по территории России. Гравюры с изображениями растений выполнены по рисункам К.Ф. Кнаппе и раскрашены акварелью.

europeana:record.dc:title: The Royal house of Romanovs: historical review of Romanovs’ house reign from the dark years to XIXc.
Царственный дом Романовых : исторический очерк царствования дома Романовых : от смутного времени до наших дней
europeana:record.dc:creator: Дубенский, Дмитрий Николаевич (1858-1923)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 940 General history of Europe
europeana:record.dc:description: The “House of Romanov” was published to coincide with the 300th anniversary of the Romanovs’ tsardom. Dedicated to Alexey Nikolaevich the crown prince, it uncovers the history of the Romanov dynasty and contains a large number of illustrations of historical events. Lithographed pictures from almost all the Romanovs’ portraits are also included in the edition. The book opens with a genealogical table of the royal household to clarify the sequence of events surrounding their rule.

Дубенский Дмитрий Николаевич (1868– 1923) - генерал-майор, редактор-издатель газеты «Русское чтение», редактор журнала «Летопись войны», во время 1-й Мировой войны состоял при императоре Николае II в качестве официального историографа, после Октябрьской революции эмигрировал и жил в эмиграции. Книга содержит краткий исторический обзор 300-летнего царствования представителей дома Романовых в России, начиная от Смутного времени и избрания Земским собором царем Михаила Федоровича Романова в феврале 1613 г. до начала 1913 г. Данное издание «С Высочайшего дозволения» императора Николая II было подготовлено к 300-летнему юбилею Царствующего дома Романовых и посвящено наследнику-цесаревичу и вел. кн. Алексею Николаевичу. Книга написана в форме популярного очерка, имеющего официальный характер. В начале помещено стилизованное изображение «Родословного древа Царствующего дома Романовых», а также фотолитографированный портрет императора Николая II и наследника-цесаревича Алексея в обрамлении заставки плетеных форм, увенчанной сверху императорской короной.

europeana:record.dc:title: Political correspondence of Ekaterina the Great, the Russian Empress. Part 4 (1766-1767)
Политическая переписка императрицы Екатерины II. Ч. 4. 1766-1767г.
europeana:record.dc:subject: 320 Political science;920 Biography, genealogy, insignia;940 General history of Europe
europeana:record.dc:description: Part 4 (1766-1767). The volume was issued by F. Buller with the assistance of magister V. Uliyanitskiy.
Часть 4-ая (годы с 1766 по 1767). Том издан бароном Ф.А.Бюлером, при содействии магистра В.А.Уляницкаго.

europeana:record.dc:title: The North Pole and Arctic inventions
Северный полюс и арктические открытия
europeana:record.dc:creator: Новосильский, Павел Михайлович (1800-1862)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 900 Geography & History;910 Geography and travel
